st.g:
-Stack all 3 Garm; interrupt The Ram's Voice (PBAoE) and The Dragon's Voice (donut).
-Avoid the three persistent fire zones; then group and burn the follow-up adds.
st.d:
-Help interrupt Voices; stay out of the fire lanes.
-Cleave down the trash packs quickly once grouped.
st.h:
-Expect spikes if a Voice goes off; spot-heal clipped players.
-Position to heal through incidental burn ticks while moving.
st.t:
-Grab and face all Garms; slide the pack away from fire zones.
-Use interruptions on Voices; keep adds gathered for AoE.

st.g:
-Double Vision: alternate red/white to reset stacks (3 stacks = death).
-Mortal Gaze: look away or cleanse Doom on the lit disk; kill Hourglasses for Roulette and avoid the lit quadrant at the final pop.
st.d:
-Control circle puzzles: Level 100 Flare needs an odd count; Level 150 Death fails on multiples of 3.
-Swap to adds/Hourglasses immediately to prevent raidwides.
st.h:
-Call out Doom fix (lit disk) and pre-shield for Roulette resolution.
-Be ready for burst if circles are mishandled; top quickly after mechanics.
st.t:
-Keep boss centered so players can swap colors cleanly.
-Pick up spawned adds; avoid facing the raid during Mortal Gaze casts.

st.g:
-Interrupt Ancient Flare/Ancient Quaga.
-Kill Forbidden Gates before Void Call; prioritize the larger gates later.
st.d:
-Swap hard to Gates and the clone; ignore fluff until casts are stopped.
-Tag larger gates first to prevent Jormungand spawns.
st.h:
-Mitigate/heal if an interrupt is missed; stabilize after gate waves.
-Help target-call priority gates while moving minimally.
st.t:
-Use interrupts on Scylla/Xande's Clone if available.
-Pick up spawns and hold them off the group while DPS delete Gates.

st.g:
-Avoid white swirls (Ice Floor) or get Deep Freeze; kill Slimes and stand in the poison puddle to halt spawns.
-Discordance: AoE the 5 heads or wipe; soak the small stack marker with 3–5 players; kill Prominence orbs before Radiance.
st.d:
-Priority: Orbs → Slimes/Toxic Slime → Discordance heads.
-Pass the Dragonfire Fly tether quickly before Suppuration stacks ramp.
st.h:
-Cleanse Concussion if applied; pre-heal stack markers and orb failures.
-During Heatwave, minimize actions; rely on oGCDs to steady the raid.
st.t:
-Park boss to keep puddles and orb lanes clear.
-Grab Toxic Slime/stray adds.

st.g:
-Alliance A/B/C take left/mid/right platforms; HP sync means all die together.
-If crosshair targets you, bait cone down; use jump pad to return; stand in the purple puddle for Shockwave or be knocked off.
st.d:
-Kill the Sacrificed Soldier quickly; avoid the spinning yellow disc.
-Help activate jump pads if teammates get pulled below.
st.h:
-Top players returning from the lower ring; rescue anyone drifting off pads.
-Pre-shield before Shockwave if groups are messy.
st.t:
-Keep Atomos centered; help trigger jump pads on top.
-Position to avoid dragging cones through your group.

st.g:
-Unchained: get Mini, enter belly via purple puddle, kill wall adds; outside team re-chain with both fetters.
-Common strat: DPS Rush (all DPS + 1 healer inside). Stay grouped to avoid Ululation fear; beware Tail Swipe behind.
st.d:
-Inside: burn walls/adds fast; outside: assist re-chaining immediately.
-Do not enter puddle without Mini or you’ll die.
st.h:
-One healer goes inside for DPS Rush; outside healer keeps chain carriers alive.
-Spot-heal fetter handlers and fear scatter recovery.
st.t:
-Hold Cerberus faced away; pick up Wolfsbane adds if using ABC strat.
-Help coordinate re-chaining windows while he’s slumped.

st.g:
-Feint Particle Beam: marked player kites blasts to the edge.
-Move to sides for Zero-form laser.
-Soak comet towers.
-Kill Dark Clouds/Storms before she eats them.
-Kill Hypercharged Clouds inside their boxes before Particle Beam completes.
st.d:
-If marked, run the beam wide; otherwise soak nearest tower and nuke adds fast.
-Enter a boxed zone immediately for Hypercharged Clouds.
st.h:
-Tank takes heavy autos + DoT—keep them stable during scatter mechanics.
-After add phases, prep raid healing for the follow-up raidwide.
st.t: -Keep boss steady.

185.g: Kill everything until Cerberus pukes you out.

st.g:
-Never stand in front; if Inhale pulls you, sprint out before Goobbue’s Grief and dodge Moldy Phlegm circles.
-Moldy Sneeze/Beatdown are frontals and apply Reduced Immunity—expect brief heal strain if people get clipped.
st.d:
-Stay on flanks/rear; spread loosely to reduce Inhale pulls and avoid Phlegm overlaps.
-If dragged in, pass through/away from the boss immediately to dodge the pollen blast.
st.h:
-Esuna Reduced Immunity; cleanse Poison from Goobbue’s Grief when safe.
-Stand central to reach pulled players quickly after Inhale.
st.t:
-Keep boss centered and faced away; don’t drag through Phlegm puddles.
-Recenter after Inhale so melee have space to exit Grief safely.

st.g:
-Interrupt Fire (stun or step behind during cast); if targeted by his gaze, kite to avoid Amorphic Flail.
-Add waves: kill Purple/White first (Paralysis/Heavy).
st.d:
-Prioritize Purple/White adds; save stuns/positioning to stop Fire.
-If focused, keep moving to avoid Flail and lead it away from the group.
st.h:
-Cleanse Paralysis/Heavy/Windburn quickly; spot-heal Flail targets.
-Watch add waves for burst on random players.
st.t:
-Hold boss mid, face away, and grab new adds quickly.
-Keep him steady so melees can slip behind to cancel Fire.

st.g:
-Stay in melee to prevent Scourge of Nym; avoid killing Tonberries unless space/control demands it (Rancor → Everybody’s Grudge scales).
-At ~25% multiple Slashers march inward—do not engage them; collapse center and finish the boss.
st.d:
-Avoid cleaving Tonberries; focus single-target on King, especially during Slasher phase.
-Only pick off Tonberries if they become a threat; otherwise ignore to limit Rancor.
st.h:
-Cleanse Heavy from stray Scourge hits; prep for Grudge bursts proportional to Rancor stacks.
-Stay central during Slasher march to heal safely without drawing aggro.
st.t:
-Anchor King center and in melee at all times; don’t kite.
-Ignore Slashers; maintain boss control while party finishes.

st.g:
-Avoid Corrupting Shot line AoE and spreading Crystalline Shot puddles
-Stay spread to minimize Corrupting Crystal stacks
-If you reach 3 stacks, move away so your explosion does not hit allies
-Kill Zombie War Hounds quickly to reduce stack pressure
-Lethal: If multiple players explode at once, raid will wipe
st.t:
-Keep Symond faced away to reduce line AoE risks
-Pick up hounds quickly to protect healer and DPS
-Be ready to reposition boss away from puddles
st.d:
-Focus hounds when they spawn to reduce AoE pressure
-Dodge puddles and Giga Slash knockback
-If at 3 stacks, sacrifice yourself in a safe spot away from allies
st.h:
-Top off players before Giga Slash knockback
-Prepare heavy AoE healing when puddles expand
-Be ready for burst damage if a player explodes at 3 stacks

st.g:
-Avoid the falling aethercrystals, they explode.
Zombies will wake up after you pass over them.
-Interrupt trash mobs' Banish cast, they can be lethal.

132.g:
-Ignore eggs until the message says they threaten to hatch
-When eggs glow, kill only one; always prioritize a spotted egg if present
-Lethal: Killing more than one glowing egg triggers Flying Frenzy, which can kill a player
-When Zu takes flight, kill all remaining adds and dodge ground effects under tank
132.t:
-Face Zu away from group
-Pick up pullet or cockerel adds quickly
-Position for Sonic Boom ground effects while Zu is airborne
132.d:
-Save AoE to avoid hitting multiple eggs
-If spotted egg hatches, kill the Zu Cockerel fast to break tether
-Focus adds when Zu flies up before resuming on boss
132.h:
-Prepare AoE heals during add phases
-Cleanse poison if Zu applies it
-Heal tank through Sonic Boom and Flying Frenzy damage if triggered

st.g: -Interrupt trash mobs' Banish cast, they can be lethal.

-Dodge Bombination circular AoEs
-Kill adds quickly or burn boss down depending on party DPS
-Lethal: Failing to dodge Bombination can heavily damage or kill squishier roles
st.t:
-Face Tyrant away from group
-Pick up Sailor adds immediately
st.d:
-Burn Tyrant down quickly; AoE adds with boss if DPS is high enough
-Dodge Bombination ground AoEs
st.h:
-Sustain tank through Sailor add pressure
-Watch for AoE damage from Bombination and be ready to top up party

134.g:
-When Siren vanishes, move to center to dodge Deathly Cadenza or to edges to avoid Feral Lunge
-Kill Privates and Sergeants quickly; Sergeants inflict Bind if they touch players
-Lethal: Failing Deathly Verse heal-to-full causes Hysteria and Confusion, potentially wiping party
134.t:
-Hold Siren near center for easy AoE coverage
-Pick up Privates immediately; kite Sergeants to prevent Bind
-Interrupt Lunatic Voice if possible
134.d:
-Focus Sergeants quickly to free bound players
-Burn Privates before they overwhelm
-Dodge Cadenza and Feral Lunge when Siren reappears
134.h:
-Heal Deathly Verse targets to full before timer expires
-Cleanse Bleed from Song of Torment with Esuna
-Cleanse Reduced Immunity from Lunatic Voice with Esuna
-Be ready with AoE heals during Cadenza or mass add spawns

st.g:
-Dodge Fire II ground circles.
-Fireflow alternates cones in cardinals: step into the first safe lane after it resolves.
-Burning Bolt is a tankbuster—heal/tank cooldowns.
st.d:
-Keep mobile for Fire II and Fireflow lanes.
-Stay off tank’s front to avoid cleaves.
st.h:
-Top up after Fire II; prep for tankbuster spikes.
-Position central to catch players adjusting to Fireflow.
st.t:
-Hold boss steady; pop mitigation for Burning Bolt.
-Don’t over-rotate boss so cones stay predictable.

st.g:
-Electrify is a standard circle AoE; dodge out.
-When Hydroelectric Shock charges (purple water), move to dirt slopes until safe.
st.d:
-Step onto slopes during Shock; ranged keep DPS up from safety.
-Close-range adjust quickly back after Shock ends.
st.h:
-Expect raid damage if anyone mistimes Hydroelectric Shock.
-Spot-heal slope-movers who may eat Electrify.
st.t:
-Face away; mitigate Levinfang tankbuster.
-Guide boss near slope edges so group reposition is quick.

st.g:
-At ~80% and ~60%, boss shields (Burning Ward). Kill fire wisps before they reach him or room-wide AoE goes off.
-Plain Pound: circle → double donuts. Start out, then step in.
-Firewater: simple circle AoE; dodge.
st.d:
-Focus wisps during shield phases.
-Dodge Pound patterns carefully; stay active on boss when shield drops.
st.h:
-Heavy healing if wisps explode; prep for tankbusters.
-Top party during transitions between shield phases.
st.t:
-Mitigate Straight Punch tankbuster.
-Drag boss away from torch spawns to keep wisps clear for DPS.

42.g:
-Kill Dung Wespe adds quickly before they Final Sting.
-Move out of Frightful Roar (point-blank AoE) and Mow (frontal cone).
-Mortal Ray applies Doom to all players—stun the cast or cleanse Doom by stepping on the glowing plate.
-Tank near the center for quick plate access.
42.d:
-Burn down Wespe adds ASAP.
-Watch Mortal Ray and move to orange plate to cleanse Doom.
-Avoid standing in front to dodge Mow.
42.h:
-Cleanse Poison (Mow) and Vulnerability (Roar) with Esuna.
-Be ready for heavy damage if Doom is missed.
-Top tanks for Triclip tankbuster.
42.t:
-Keep boss central between plates.
-Mitigate Triclip.
-Call Mortal Ray for stuns/plate cleanses.

43.g:
-Ignore boss when Soulstone is active; focus it to stun Guardian and make him vulnerable.
-Dodge Rockslide (line), Boulder Clap (frontal AoE), and True Grit (cone with Blind).
-Be prepared for party damage from Obliterate.
43.d:
-Always swap to Soulstone when it spawns.
-Use melee LB on Guardian during vulnerability if possible.
-Keep behind boss to avoid cones.
43.h:
-Esuna Blind from True Grit if needed.
-Spot-heal party after Obliterate.
-Cover knockback damage from Stone Skull.
43.t:
-Keep boss faced away from group.
-Mitigate Rockslide and Boulder Clap.
-Pick him up quickly after Soulstone breaks stun.

44.g:
-Dodge Looming Judgment (tankbuster).
-Kill Mythril Verge adds quickly: they gain Haste stacks and Self-Destruct at 6.
-Second add phase chains each player—kill your add fast or instant death.
-Dodge Dark II (large cone) and Dark (ground circle).
-Help other players after freeing yourself from chained adds.
44.d:
-Burn Mythril Verges fast, especially chained phase.
-Dodge Dark/Dark II telegraphs.
-Swap to help allies if your add dies early.
44.h:
-Heal through Creeping Darkness party damage.
-Cover tank during Looming Judgment.
-Be ready to heal allies freed late from add chains.
44.t:
-Mitigate Looming Judgment.
-Hold boss steady to keep Dark II cones predictable.
-Keep positioning tight so party can dodge cones.

52.g:
-Avoid Stone II ground AoEs and Mandible Bite frontal cones.
-Interrupt Silence when possible.
-Boss summons waves of adds: Soldiers (weak), Guards (AoE cones), and Marshal (tethers boss, giving her Vulnerability Down buff).
-Kill adds quickly, especially Marshal when it tethers.
52.d:
-Prioritize adds as they spawn, focusing Marshal > Guard > Soldier.
-Dodge Stone II circles and stay out of frontal cones.
52.h:
-Cleanse Silence from allies if missed interrupt.
-Top tank for Trap Jaws multi-hit.
-Watch AoE damage from multiple adds.
52.t:
-Keep Princess centered for add control.
-Mitigate Trap Jaws tankbuster.
-Pick up Guard and Marshal quickly.

96.g:
-When worm burrows, spread out to avoid group damage.
-Dodge Sand Pillar traps and Earthbreak eruptions.
-Run from Bottomless Desert pull and avoid center when worm resurfaces.
-Remove Sludge DoT quickly.
96.d:
-Stay spread when worm burrows.
-Move out of sand traps and avoid center during Bottomless Desert.
-Help burn adds if they appear.
96.h:
-Esuna Sludge DoT immediately.
-Spot heal after Bottomless Desert and eruptions.
-Keep tank topped for Sandstorm/Sludge.
96.t:
-Hold boss steady while surfaced.
-Be ready to re-engage quickly after burrow phases.
-Mitigate Sandstorm bursts.

97.g:
-Stand behind boss to avoid Ram’s Breath (right side ice cone, Heavy) and Dragon’s Breath (left side lightning cone, Paralysis).
-When eyes glow violet → move in (Dragon’s Voice donut AoE).
-When eyes glow blue → move out (Ram’s Voice point-blank AoE).
-Dodge Cacophony orb and Lightning Storm circles.
97.d:
-Stay behind boss to avoid breath cones.
-Run in/out quickly for Dragon’s Voice and Ram’s Voice.
-If targeted by Cacophony, kite orb away safely.
97.h:
-Cleanse Paralysis (Dragon’s Breath, Cacophony) and Heavy (Ram’s Breath).
-Top party after Voice mechanics.
-Be ready for spike damage from failed dodges.
97.t:
-Face boss away to avoid Lion’s Breath cleave.
-Sidestep Ram’s/Dragon’s Breath cones.
-Keep boss steady so party can position properly.

50.g:
-Fight near glowing crystals for Crystal Veil buff, which protects from Eyes on Me.
-Move to a new crystal when message appears that the crystal is dimming.
-Kill adds quickly and avoid their AoEs.
-Interrupt or avoid Dread Gaze (Paralysis) and Cursed Gaze (Amnesia) cones.
50.d:
-Burn adds fast.
-Position boss near crystals to keep uptime.
-Dodge gaze attacks.
50.h:
-Cleanse Paralysis and Amnesia if they land.
-Top group after Eyes on Me if anyone lacked buff.
-Watch for add damage spikes.
50.t:
-Tank boss near crystals so it’s vulnerable.
-Face away to keep cone gazes off party.
-Grab add aggro quickly.

st.g:
-Avoid Double Smash and Elbow Drop cone AoEs.
-Spread to reduce Firewater splash from adds.
-Kill Deepvoid Slaves on platforms quickly.
st.d:
-Focus adds on platforms while dodging Firewater circles.
-Burn boss after adds are cleared.
-Stay behind boss to avoid cone cleaves.
st.h:
-Heal through add damage on spread party.
-Be ready for higher tank damage when Elbow Drop begins at 50%.
-Spot heal Firewater hits.
st.t:
-Keep boss faced away from group.
-Mitigate Double Smash and Elbow Drop.
-Grab aggro on adds if they drop down.

st.g:
-Kill crystals as they activate (counter-clockwise order, every ~25% HP).
-Dodge Desolation columns – instant kill for most.
-If targeted, aim Desolation away from allies.
-Move out of black pools and avoid explosions.
-At 30% HP, he enrages and spams Desolation.
st.d:
-Focus crystals when active.
-Position carefully to avoid targeted Desolation.
-Burn boss quickly during enrage phase.
st.h:
-Prepare burst heals for random Desolation hits or pool damage.
-Top tank after Grim Fate cleaves.
-Cover raid during AoE Grim Halo and enrage.
st.t:
-Tank boss away from group, facing wall/side.
-Mitigate Grim Fate tankbuster.
-Move boss toward active crystal.
-Help control positioning when Desolation targets allies.

st.g:
-Avoid standing in Gold Dust AoEs.
-Clear Gold Lung stacks by eating Morbol Fruit (keep stacks ≤2).
-Fruit respawns over time; manage usage carefully.
st.d:
-Stay spread to reduce overlapping Gold Dust hits.
-Eat fruit at 2 stacks of Gold Lung.
-Assist on boss uptime while managing debuffs.
st.h:
-Prepare heavy AoE healing during Gold Rush.
-Watch tank during Hundred Lashings.
-Cover players slow to clear stacks.
st.t:
-Keep boss faced away from group.
-Use stuns on Locksmith if needed to safely eat fruit.
-Mitigate Hundred Lashings tankbuster.

st.g:
-Never stand in front of boss.
-Watch weapon stance:
 • One-hand hold → Frontal cone (100-Tonze Swipe).
 • Two-hand hold → Circle AoE (100-Tonze Swing).
-Dodge Glower laser and Eye of the Beholder C-shaped AoE.
-All major abilities can be stunned/interrupted.
st.d:
-Stay behind boss to avoid cleaves.
-Spread loosely to reduce Glower + paralysis overlap.
-Move close or behind boss during Eye of the Beholder.
st.h:
-Cleanse Paralysis from Glower quickly.
-Heal through Eye of the Beholder and stray AoE hits.
-Spot heal if someone eats a 100-Tonze attack.
st.t:
-Keep boss faced away at all times.
-Mitigate 10-Tonze and 100-Tonze tankbusters.
-Interrupt 100-Tonze Swipe/Swing or Eye of the Beholder when possible.

st.g:
-Consume Morbol Fruits at 2–3 Burr stacks to cleanse debuff.
-If hit by Bad Breath, eat a fruit immediately to clear all effects.
-At half HP, destroy Strange Morbol Fruits before they hatch.
-Avoid Vine Probe frontal and Hooked Burrs stacking damage.
-Alternate fruit usage to ensure availability later.
st.d:
-Target Strange Morbol Fruits fast; use LB if needed.
-Stay out of frontal Bad Breath cone.
-Manage Burr stacks with fruit.
-Focus burn boss after adds handled.
st.h:
-Stay far to avoid Bad Breath; cleanse debuffs with fruit if hit.
-Heavy healing needed if Burr stacks climb.
-Be ready to cover raid during add phase.
st.t:
-Tank boss facing away from group.
-Mitigate Vine Probe and Burr Burrow hits.
-Pull boss to keep ranged safe from Bad Breath.

st.g:
-Platforms rise and poison fills the floor – stay on safe platforms.
-Enemy waves include Valefors, Homunculi, Greater Demons, Valar, Dira, Cursed Eyes.
st.d:
-Stay on raised platforms to avoid ground damage and cleave AoEs.
-Save AoE cooldowns for add waves attacking platforms.
st.h:
-Expect steady platform-based damage—heal accordingly.
-Watch for knockbacks—rescue or position heal through group movement.
st.t:
-Tank mobs onto safe platforms away from group.
-Face enemies outward to protect platform DPS/healers.

st.g:
-Kill skeleton adds (Platinals) before they reach boss or raid will wipe.
-When dragon revives second time, ignore Rotting Eyes and burn boss.
-Poison fills floor occasionally; use raised platforms.
-Position boss based on datacenter convention (JP = center, NA/EU = far edge).
st.d:
-Burn skeletons quickly, focus adds before they reach dragon.
-Use raised platforms to stay safe from poison.
-Ignore Rotting Eyes on last revive; full burn boss.
st.h:
-Heal through raid damage when skeletons reach boss.
-Watch tanks during add-heavy phases.
-Be ready for high AoE healing in poison phases.
st.t:
-Tank dragon at center (JP) or far edge (NA/EU) depending on group strategy.
-Pull boss near adds to simplify cleaving them.
-Ensure uptime on boss while DPS handle skeletons.

st.g:
-Split into parties A/B/C to activate platforms and expose Atomos.
-Must station 4 players per platform before barrier activates to avoid Iron Giants.
st.d:
-Go to your assigned platform and avoid crossing prematurely.
-Burst Atomos after platform activation.
st.h: -Pre-heal platform teams in case of accidental AoEs or delays.
st.t:
-Lead adds into platform DPS safe zones.
-Avoid pulling boss or adds onto platforms.

st.g:
-Players with Astral Realignment buff can damage boss.
-Without buff, focus adds attacking Magic Pots.
-Protect Pots at all costs; if they die, wipe.
st.d:
-If buffed with Astral Realignment, hit boss.
-If not, kill adds tethered to Pots immediately.
-Avoid cleave range of boss.
st.h:
-Keep Pots alive with heals.
-Cleanse damage on buffed tank holding boss.
-Spot heal players killing adds.
st.t:
-If buffed, grab boss and face away from group.
-Swap aggro when other tank gets Astral Realignment.
-Help with adds if unbuffed.

st.g:
-Kill Iron Giants before they destroy comets.
-Drop comet markers outside boss’s ring.
-Hide behind comets during Ecliptic Meteor cast.
st.d:
-Burn adds, especially Iron Giants and Puroboros.
-When marked, place comets outside boss ring.
-Use comets as LOS cover for Ecliptic Meteor.
st.h:
-Heal towers if used; otherwise focus on raidwide damage.
-Prepare for high damage during Ecliptic Meteor phase.
-Support players dropping comets.
st.t:
-Main tank keeps boss centered.
-Off tanks pick up Iron Giants, face away from raid/comets.
-Protect comets until Meteor phase.

135.g:
-Avoid standing in front of boss.
-Dodge telegraphed AoEs.
-When Ancient Flare is cast, go to assigned platform (A left, B center, C right) to create barrier.
-Kill Iron Giants and Iron Claws adds.
135.d:
-Help kill Iron Claws quickly.
-Move to assigned platform for Ancient Flare.
-Dodge AoEs and stay behind boss.
135.h:
-Heal through raid damage during Ancient Flare.
-Be ready to Rescue players late to platforms.
-Support tanks when adds spawn.
135.t:
-Face boss away from raid.
-Move group to platforms during Ancient Flare.
-Pick up Iron Giant adds and hold aggro.

st.g:
-Throws Fire Angon spears that apply stacking Burn if left on ground.
-Kill spears quickly or party-wide Burn stacks wipe the group.
st.d:
-Target and destroy spears immediately before focusing boss.
-Maintain DPS uptime between spear phases.
st.h:
-Burn stacks surge if spears linger—heal through dot ticks.
-Raid heals needed during boss plus spear overlap.
st.t:
-Face boss away from party.
-Intercept spears to prevent mid-group placement.

st.g:
-Summons colored totems; effects are unknown until first cleanse—can buff, debuff, toad, etc.
-He casts fire AoEs and Toad on random players.
st.d:
-Purify one totem at first spawn to identify effect; pick attack buff color afterward.
-Avoid totem-related damage gaps, maintain steady uptime.
st.h:
-Clear toads with that totem—time heal removal precisely.
-Manage Fire resist stacks to avoid fatal AoEs.
st.t:
-Position boss clear of totem area so purifiers can safely step in.
-Keep boss mobile to prevent standing in damaging zones.

st.g:
-Uses Tyrannic Blare frontal cone; applies Rotting Lung with linked gas circles.
-Drops Sacred Standards buffing boss—tank must kite to avoid standing in them.
-Random Doom on players, removed by full heal.
st.d:
-Stay behind boss to dodge Blare; spread during gas phase.
-Move off infected player to avoid shared damage zone.
st.h:
-Top off Lung victims and manage AoE gas overlap heals.
-Be ready for Doom removals when cast triggers.
st.t:
-Kite boss continuously to avoid standing in Standards.
-Face boss to prevent cones; lead group around gas circles.

58.en: The Binding Coil of Bahamut – Turn 2

147.g:
Head reflects ranged physical; tail reflects magic.
Melee can safely hit tail.
Burn Sahagin adds quickly before Hydroshot puddles (Dropsy).
Kill Gyre Spumes immediately to prevent Elemental Converter drain and Tidal Wave wipe.
Watch water spouts: move opposite side for Spinning Dive.
At ~60%, be ready to activate converter to block Tidal Wave.
Avoid Grand Fall AoEs (Heavy debuff).
Phase 2 adds Wavetooth Sahagins — kill fast to prevent Hysteria.
Mechanics repeat until Leviathan falls.
147.d:
Hit tail if melee.
Casters target head, ranged focus tail.
Burn Sahagin adds quickly.
Prioritize Gyre Spumes.
Avoid Grand Fall AoEs.
Move properly for Spinning Dive and Tidal Wave.
Focus boss when adds are cleared.
147.h:
Heal through tankbusters (Dread Tide).
Top party after raidwides (Tidal Roar).
Cleanse Dropsy if possible.
Extra healing after Spinning Dive knockback and Grand Fall Heavy debuff.
Prepare for chaos if Wavetooth Sahagins cast Hysteria.
147.t:
Maintain aggro on head or tail depending on party comp.
Mitigate Dread Tide tankbuster.
Pull and hold Sahagin adds.
Position properly when Leviathan dives.
Be ready for Elemental Converter timing on Tidal Wave.

401.g:
-Ifrit uses stronger versions of Eruption (targeted AoE), Radiant Plume (inner or outer AoE), and charges.
-Nail phase occurs multiple times; failing to destroy all nails results in lethal Hellfire.
-Uses Crimson Cyclone (dash) and builds toward Enrage.
401.d:
-Avoid Eruption and Radiant Plume by watching cast indicators.
-Focus all nails during nail phases—missing even one is fatal.
401.h:
-Prepare strong AoE healing after Hellfire and Crimson Cyclone.
-Watch for tank damage spikes during cleaves and Hellfire.
401.t:
-Keep Ifrit centered and faced away from party.
-Pop cooldowns for heavy hits like Infernal Surge and Hellfire.

403.g:
Dodge Landslide or risk being knocked off the platform.
Stand near the red line during Geocrush to minimize damage but avoid falling.
Watch Weight of the Land puddles and move quickly.
Bomb Boulders explode in drop order—note the sequence and dodge accordingly.
Break players free from Granite Gaol quickly.
Destroy Titan’s Heart before Earthen Fury to avoid wipe.
Avoid getting pushed off ledge at all costs.
403.d:
Stay mobile to dodge Landslide and Weight of the Land.
Kill Granite Gaols quickly when allies are trapped.
Avoid bomb explosions by tracking spawn order.
Help burn Titan’s Heart before Earthen Fury.
Don’t stand near arena edges unnecessarily.
403.h:
Prepare burst healing for Tumult (can repeat up to 7 times).
Top off the party before Geocrush.
Cleanse Damage Down from freed Gaol players.
Keep group stable during raidwide Earthen Fury.
Raise players who fall off when possible.
403.t:
Face Titan away from party to avoid cleaving.
Mitigate Mountain Buster tankbuster.
Position carefully to avoid getting knocked off by Landslide.
Hold aggro on Titan during add mechanics and heart phase.
Move Titan minimally to give DPS safe space to dodge AoEs.

39.g:
-Fight consists of three phases: initial, sisters phase, and final.
-Garuda uses Slipstream (frontal cone stun), Friction (targeted AoE), Mistral Song (tankbuster), and Eye of the Storm (donut AoE).
-Summons Suparna and Chirada during second phase—must be separated.
-Uses Wicked Wheel (point-blank AoE) and Mistral Shriek (raid-wide AoE).
39.d:
-Stay behind Garuda to avoid Slipstream and Wicked Wheel.
-Focus Suparna first when sisters appear, then switch to Chirada.
39.h:
-Prepare burst heals after Mistral Shriek.
-Watch for simultaneous tank damage from Garuda and Suparna.
39.t:
-Tank Garuda facing away from the group.
-During sister phase, split tanks: one on Suparna, one on Garuda. Keep them separated to avoid buffs.

140.g:
-Casts Darkfire, covering part of bridge and spawning a Flambeau.
-Flambeau must be killed before it reaches fire or self-destructs, wiping party.
-Stun Flambeau if necessary to buy time.
140.d:
-Focus Flambeau immediately; prioritize it over boss.
-Keep moving forward as arena space shrinks.
140.h:
-Prepare AoE heals after Darkfire damage.
-Be ready for burst healing if Flambeau explosion nearly goes off.
140.t:
-Hold boss steady while group handles Flambeau.
-Assist in stunning or repositioning if adds interfere.

141.g:
-Improved Blasting Device spawns Waymaker Bombs; must be carried into boss path when timer nears 0.
-Black bombs spawn and self-destruct—move away.
-Sprites spawn around edges; must be killed.
-Golem uses Plaincracker cone at tank.
-After Golem dies, Biggy spawns with large bombs—move clear of blast radius.
141.d:
-One DPS handles bomb duty; drop Waymaker Bombs in Golem’s path.
-Other DPS focus adds and kill Biggy quickly.
-Stay away from exploding black bombs.
141.h:
-Top tank after Plaincracker.
-Prepare AoE healing if bomb explosions clip players.
141.t:
-Face Golem away from group to avoid cone.
-Pick up adds until Biggy spawns; maintain control while bomb DPS works.

142.g:
-Boss cleaves; only tank should stand in front.
-Circular AoEs appear—dodge.
-Giga adds spawn, target random players—kill quickly.
-Sand Worm spawns periodically; place Crystallized Rock on sand to distract it.
-Failure causes Bottomless Desert: heavy raid damage and pull-in, often wiping.
142.d:
-Burn boss and adds quickly.
-Designate someone to place Crystallized Rocks when worm spawns.
142.h:
-Spot heal players targeted by Giga adds.
-Be ready for heavy AoE healing if Bottomless Desert goes off.
142.t:
-Keep boss faced away.
-Pick up Giga adds as they appear, but they may target random players.

137.g:
-Casts Void Blizzard, applying Slow—Esuna required.
-Spawns Manor Butler adds; kill quickly.
-Places ice patches on ground—avoid standing in them.
137.d:
-Focus down adds quickly.
-Keep mobile to avoid ice patches.
137.h:
-Cleanse Slow from Void Blizzard with Esuna.
-Heal damage from adds and avoidable AoEs.
137.t:
-Keep boss centered to control ice patch placement.
-Pick up Manor Butler adds immediately.

138.g:
-Cleave attacks hit in front—non-tanks stay behind.
-Glowing spirit cutters and swirling swords cover areas—dodge promptly.
-Casts Abyssal Transfixion, inflicting Paralysis—must be cleansed.
-Spawns an add; kill quickly.
138.d:
-Stay behind boss to avoid cleaves.
-Focus adds quickly when they spawn.
138.h:
-Cleanse Paralysis from Abyssal Transfixion.
-Be ready for party-wide damage if AoEs are missed.
138.t:
-Keep boss facing away from party.
-Pick up adds as soon as they spawn.

139.g:
-Casts Void Fire III and Dark Mist—both unavoidable AoEs that must be dodged.
-Spawns adds in waves; she absorbs them and casts Blood Rain—damage scales with add HP left.
-First wave: Manor Sentry (grants stun/silence immunity).
-Second wave: 2 Maidservants (grant Determination buff); one must be pushed to 0% before absorb.
-Final wave: Lady Amandine; DPS check to reduce her HP before absorption.
-At ~15% HP, casts Beguiling Mist (charms party) followed by Void Fire IV; repeats 3 times—kill before third or wipe.
139.d:
-Burn adds to 0% quickly; focus one Maidservant fully.
-Use Limit Break on Lady Amandine to ensure she dies before absorption.
-Stop DPS if needed to control timing of add phases.
139.h:
-Prepare heavy healing for Blood Rain—damage scales with add HP.
-Pre-shield during Beguiling Mist + Void Fire IV combo.
139.t:
-Keep Halicarnassus centered to manage adds.
-Pull her away from absorbed add’s AoE pools when possible.

st.g:
-Avoid Eye of the Beholder lasers.
-Stand in Mammet’s Manawall aura during 1000-Tonze Swing to survive.
st.t:
-Watch mace grip for tankbusters: one hand = cone cleave, two hands = room-wide swing.
-Keep boss faced away from party.
st.d:
-Move through boss for one-hand cleave, move away for two-hand swing.
-Help trigger lever when 1000-Tonze Swing is charging.
st.h:
-Top tank after cleaves and swings.
-Heal through AoE damage if Manawall timing is missed.

st.g:
-Use pedestal orbs during Demon Eye cast to gain Gloam and survive.
-Focus down the exposed eye before it turns red.
-Dodge massive cone AoEs.
st.t: -Hold Catoblepas steady to avoid sweeping cones at the group.
st.d:
-Activate your assigned pedestal orb during Demon Eye.
-Burn the exposed eye quickly during DPS check.
st.h: -Heal players who miss Gloam or get clipped by cones.

st.g:
-Kill order: Healer first, Bard third, Gladiator last.
-Lancer ignores enmity—kite him if targeted.
st.t:
-Grab aggro on Gladiator and Bard.
-Mitigation for Gladiator’s abilities like Spirits Within.
st.d:
-Focus DPS on healer, then Bard.
-Keep moving if targeted by Lancer.
st.h:
-Be ready to cover random-target damage from Lancer.
-Watch for bursts from multiple enemies at once.

st.g:
-Kill Mumuepo first—chains and Thal’s Fury must be managed.
-Narasimha has tail swipes and random AoEs—stay alert.
st.t:
-Hold both bosses, face Narasimha away from party.
-Use mitigation while DPS burns Mumuepo.
st.d:
-If chained, call for ally to use Thal’s Scepter to release you.
-Focus DPS on Mumuepo before shifting to Narasimha.
st.h:
-Top off chained allies—they take damage before being freed.
-Be ready for heavy AoE if Thal’s Fury resolves.

st.g:
-Kill monkey adds first.
-When boss pounds chest, use one Banana Tree to interrupt.
-Do not let adds eat bananas.
-Avoid Stool Pelt AoEs.
st.t:
-Hold Sasquatch steady, face away from party when possible.
-Pull adds off bananas if they get too close.
st.d:
-Burn down Sifaka monkeys immediately.
-Trigger Banana Tree only when Chest Thump starts.
st.h:
-Top up group during Chest Thump AoEs.
-Dispel Stool Pelt debuffs if applied.

st.g:
-Avoid frontal line AoEs and puddles.
-Only enter bubbles when boss submerges for Whirlpool.
-Do not touch bubbles early.
-Move away from boss path during Tunnel.
st.t:
-Keep boss faced away from group.
-Move with boss target to reduce risk during Tunnel.
st.d:
-Stay clear of puddle AoEs.
-Enter bubble only during Whirlpool cast.
st.h:
-Prepare AoE heals after Surface Breach.
-Heal players who mistime bubble usage.

st.g:
-Kill 10 arms across platforms (2 per platform).
-Use Waterspouts to move but avoid stacking debuff.
-When marked with green icon, move to another platform, drop tornado, return.
-Focus Tentacles when they spawn—they are higher priority than arms.
st.t:
-Hold arm or tentacle on current platform; avoid unnecessary platform jumps.
-Face mobs away from party.
st.d:
-Kill Arms quickly, focus Tentacles when they spawn.
-If marked with World's End, drop tornado along platform edge and return.
st.h:
-Top players grabbed by Scoop.
-Heal DoT from Inkblot and group-wide tornado damage.

st.g:
-Boss sends vertical/horizontal line AoEs in expanding grid and spawns fixated sniper adds.
-Dodge grid quickly; kill snipers before they wreck HP.
st.d:
-Stay mobile to dodge grid patterns.
-Burst down snipers to stop their fixate damage.
st.h:
-Grid AoEs cause incidental damage—heal steadily.
-Sniper fixates may bleed down a player—prep single-target heals.
st.t:
-Face boss to minimize raid exposure to lines.
-Pick up snipers quickly before they fixate hard-targets.

st.g:
-Leaks ceruleum pools that later ignite in large AoEs.
-Summons adds and drops bomb clusters during invulnerable phase.
st.d:
-Kite boss to limit ceruleum coverage.
-Destroy adds and bombs before detonation triggers arena-wide damage.
st.h:
-Expect high raid-wide damage when pools ignite.
-Use AoE heals and cooldowns during ignition.
st.t:
-Tank boss along wall, dragging spread pools with him.
-Pick up adds fast and help knock bombs away from arena center.

st.g:
-Unpredictable AoE patterns from crosshatch grid.
-Summons tethered glider adds—tethers may deal snag damage or interrupt.
st.d:
-Dodge crosshatch quickly.
-Burn gliders before tether damage ramps.
st.h:
-Grid damage is low; treat as minor movement damage.
-Tethered adds can interrupt casts—prep burst heals after detach.
st.t:
-Face boss to minimize party exposure.
-Pick tethered gliders fast and break tethers to stop group disruption.

st.g:
-Targeted players with Prey will be Devoured, free them by attacking the Voracious Maw
-Avoid standing in persistent AoE pools on the ground
st.t:
-Hold boss steady, face away from group
-Pick up Voracious Maw adds quickly when they spawn
st.d:
-Focus Voracious Maw immediately if a party member is eaten
-Dodge persistent ground AoEs
st.h:
-Top off damage taken from Devour
-Keep players safe if they stand too long in AoEs

st.g:
-Boss will only attack players with Scale Flakes debuff
-Ensure tank is the one to receive stacks by standing in front of Ranch Wamoura when it dies
st.t:
-Stand in front of Ranch Wamoura when it dies to take Scale Flakes debuff
-Keep debuff refreshed before it expires to prevent boss from healing
st.d:
-Kill Ranch Wamoura adds quickly when they spawn
-Focus boss once debuff is secure on tank
st.h:
-Watch for Eerie Soundwave damage
-Heal tank through increased damage taken from Scale Flakes

152.g:
-Two doors with the same symbol need to be memorized when the fight starts.
-The doors should be opened just before Omen finishes casting.
-The party's invulnerable while traveling between the doors, keeping you safe from Omen.
-When marked, move away from the party.

st.g:
-Uses Swinge and Rake (cone cleave), plus Lion’s Breath frontal AoEs.
-Spawns Vigil Heirs that explode on death and buff boss if too close.
st.d:
-Kite adds away from boss before killing; DPS drag them to opposite side.
-Avoid boss’s cleaves by staying at flank/rear and maintain uptime.
st.h:
-Healer should stack off to let DPS clear adds safely; avoid healer-focused add explosion AoEs.
-Expect spike when adds die near boss—heal accordingly.
st.t:
-Corner-tank boss and face away to redirect cleaves.
-Do not pick up adds—let DPS handle, tank boss only.

st.g:
-Party uses corner cannons to damage boss and adds.
-Boss turtling (Diamondback) reflects cannon shots; Hard Stomp must be interrupted with stun shot.
st.d:
-Use Iron Kiss normally; switch to cannon stun (Spindly Finger) during Hard Stomp.
-Help clean adds once turtling ends.
st.h:
-Rotate two stunners to safely interrupt Hard Stomp.
-Keep NPCs healed—if all die, boss performs uninterruptible wipe Stomp.
st.t:
-Stay close to cannon platform; face boss so party can aim lines safely.
-Keep DPS on boss once Stomp interrupted and adds are handled.

st.g:
-Random combo of shoulder tackle, tail swipe, claw swipe; applies Infirmity debuff.
-At 60%, a clone spawns and adds fireball and breath.
st.d:
-Stay at flank to dodge cleaves and tail swings.
-During phase 2, kill original boss first, then burn clone.
st.h:
-Anticipate cleave spikes and Infirmity reducing heal efficiency.
-Heal burst after Fireball/Breath; reposition quickly.
st.t:
-Maintain flank positioning; kite boss to keep safe zone.
-Keep aggro on original during second phase until dead.

st.g:
-Avoid Bitter End frontal cone
-Spread to reduce Pradamante splash damage
-If Toaded, kite Enkidu until debuff ends
-If Mini'd, run while Gilgamesh chases
-Heal Confused players to full HP to remove debuff
-Lethal: Being caught by Enkidu while Toaded, or chased while Mini'd, can kill quickly
st.t:
-Face Bitter End away from group
-Position boss away from party when using frontal attacks
st.d:
-Dodge Bitter End cone and Pradamante
-If targeted with Toad or Mini, kite boss or Enkidu until safe
st.h:
-Heal through Pradamante damage
-Top off Confused players immediately to clear debuff
-Watch for Toad/Mini targets, keep them safe until debuffs expire

st.g:
-Burn down waves of adds between arenas
-Stack adds together for fast AoE kills
st.t:
-Gather and tank adds, keep them positioned for AoE
-Pull aggro quickly as waves spawn
st.d:
-Focus down adds fast with AoE
-Save cooldowns for large waves
st.h:
-Keep party topped during add waves
-Use AoE heals when multiple adds are alive

st.g:
-Avoid Whirlwind Slash AoE
-Dodge Giga Jump marker by moving away from others
-Stay clear of Whirlwinds on the ground, touching them causes explosions
-Lethal: Multiple debuffs (Toad/Mini) at once can overwhelm healers
st.t:
-Keep boss faced away from party
-Position boss away from Whirlwinds
-Pick up stray adds if any spawn
st.d:
-Dodge Whirlwind Slash, Giga Jump, and ground Whirlwinds
-Kite Enkidu if Toaded
-Be extra cautious while Mini'd to avoid AoEs
st.h:
-Heavy healing needed when multiple players are afflicted by Toad/Mini
-Top off after Whirlwind Slash and Giga Jump
-Maintain regens to cover sustained debuff pressure

st.g:
-Target the glowing red core on its limbs — disabling each spawns adds, then repeat until boss is vulnerable.
-Avoid Shifting Sands whirlpools that drag you under (instant death).
-Move out of sand spheres dropped on marked players (Dust to Dust).
st.d:
-Focus the orb-carrying limb immediately to progress phases.
-Dodge sands quickly to maintain uptime.
st.h:
-Provide raid-wide healing during add phases when limbs break.
-Keep players topped and mobile to survive sinking and sphere hits.
st.t:
-Hold adds away from the boss when they spawn.
-Position boss so party has clear space to avoid whirlpools.

st.g: Pick up spheres as you go through the duty, you'll need them later.

-Clears waves of Sabotenders; a Guardia add shields the boss and must be killed immediately.
-Interrupt the boss’s 100,000 Needles by dealing burst damage after Guardia dies.
-Deal with moderate AoEs (3,000 Needles) along the way.
st.d:
-Kill Guardia on spawn before continuing to boss.
-Burst DPS at the start of Needles cast to interrupt.
st.h:
-Shield/damage-mitigate when 3,000 Needles hits party.
-Focus burst healing around the interrupt window.
st.t:
-Pull adds around the boss but keep them off DPS while focusing the boss.
-Ensure Guardia is tanked immediately for swift takedown.

st.g:
-Mummies spawn, applying Curse of the Mummy; avoid being hit to prevent stacking to 4 stacks (auto-mummification).
-Boss uses Light of Anathema (random line) and Flurry of Rage (cleave), both giving Curse stacks if hit.
-Boss tethers a player—tethered player accumulates Curse stacks unless boss is stunned or distances.
-Avoid mummy lines crossing edges.
st.d:
-Move out of boss’s line-of-sight when casting Light of Anathema.
-Stun boss on tether cast to prevent tether stacking into mummification.
st.h:
-Dispel mummy curse before reaching 4 stacks to avoid mummification.
-Heal quickly when players are hit by mummy lines or boss cleaves.
st.t:
-Face boss away from party for Flurry of Rage.
-Stun boss when tethering initiates, or kite tethered player away to cut stacking.

158.g:
-Trash pull through packs of enemies; no major mechanics.
-Group pulls for AoE are ideal.
158.d:
-Stay stacked with AoE group to burst quickly.
-Help stun occasional adds to speed clear.
158.h:
-Heal through steady minor damage; no burst phases.
-Stay mobile as party moves between pulls.
158.t:
-Pull tightly and position packs centrally.
-Keep aggro on all mobs for AoE uptime.

159.g:
-Blue (ice), red (fire), and purple (lightning) orbs tether random players to pillars.
-Use interplay of orbs and water pools to mitigate Ancient Flare.
159.d: -Avoid frontal cleaves and kite orb appropriately: lightning to pillars, fire to thaw ice.
159.h:
-Watch frozen players and regen/shield them pre-thaw.
-Keep party topped for Ancient Flare, stand in puddle if available.
159.t:
-Tank centrally or north for space.
-Face Scylla away from group and manage add cleaves.

160.g: -Trash-heavy with a Green Dragon divebomb that poisons and spawns clones.
160.d:
-Stun Doga/Unei clones with AoE stuns to reduce pressure.
-Kill clones quickly to prevent poison buildup.
160.h:
-Provide healing for poison DoTs from dragon.
-Watch for clone auto-attacks and use shields.
160.t: -Hold clones and burn evenly; kite dragon knockback safely.

161.g:
-Spawned Clockwork Wright adds connect to boss with energy beams; block connections to prevent buffs.
-Intermission launches teams to outer platforms to clear adds.
161.d:
-Avoid electrical fields next to Wrights.
-Stack on platforms, burn adds, and return via jump pads.
161.h:
-Heal through add damage and AoE bursts on platforms.
-Be ready for electrified ground and intermission transitions.
161.t:
-Tank boss centrally; do not pull Wrights.
-Move to platforms after jump and hold adds.

162.g: -Red Dragon divebombs players marked with green marker; otherwise straightforward.
162.d:
-Move out from divebomb target marker promptly.
-Maintain uptime outside divebomb windows.
162.h:
-Heal divebomb damage and spread for cleave phases.
-Top up party immediately afterward.
162.t:
-Tank cleanses front/back; kite dragon away from group.
-Lead dragon away from active bomb zones.

163.g:
-Spawns Experiment adds; some tethered orbs that shrink Kum Kum when grouped.
-Curtain Call: hide behind ice-blocked players.
-If you're a frog, don't use your fire attack on the ice, it'll melt and leave no where to hide from Curtain Call.
163.d:
-Stun Experiment adds then burn quickly.
-Kite purple orb into Kum Kum add to shrink it.
163.h:
-Esuna bomb debuffs and heal toads/Others.
-Keep non-frog players healed and positioned for Curtain Call.
163.t:
-Tank boss centrally; pick up adds safely.
-Face away and hold adds during orb phases.

164.g:
-Yellow circle Aspects must be occupied; Aetherochemical Explosion orbs need soaking.
-Ancient Quaga: levitation pads spawn from stack markers; hide on pads.
164.d:
-Stand in yellow circles and soak explosion orbs early.
-Stack with party for Quaga pads and use LB if available.
164.h:
-Manage raid spread and AoE heals through circle mechanics.
-Support levitation stack phase and burst heal between bursts.
164.t:
-Tank at center, bait cleaves into empty space.
-Face boss away, position orbs for soaks, and guide party to pads.

st.g:
-Boss summons zombies that chase a marked player; boss becomes invulnerable if adds are killed by DPS.
-Player marked with orange arrow must kite zombies into boss’s AoE to save the party.
st.d:
-Stack on boss and burn during downtime; don’t AoE zombies or you’ll incur heavy debuff.
-Mark target should kite zombies in loops to ensure they’re cleared by boss.
st.h:
-Orange-marked player lures zombies—heal them if tanking adds near death.
-Stack centrally so kited zombies reach boss AoE safely.
st.t:
-Hold boss marking on tank; boss is pure tank & spank.
-Face boss toward space where zombies will be kited to avoid group interference.

st.g:
-Protect the NPC in center—if he’s damaged boss grows and will wipe party on death.
-Orbs float from portals and must be prematurely detonated by players.
st.d:
-DPS should intercept orbs before they reach center; skip boss burn until orbs are handled.
-Focus adds only after orbs are managed.
st.h:
-Ensure NPC stays unharmed—heal if he’s targeted by AoEs or orbs.
-Position between NPC and orb paths to block them.
st.t:
-Kite boss away from orb routes and NPC to prevent overlapping damage.
-Prioritize controlling boss presence so party can intercept orbs safely.

st.g: -Edda stands at center causing bleed aura; boss summons zombie adds that must be killed or they activate glyphs. More glyphs = stronger 'Red Wedding' AoE at end.
st.d:
-Burn zombies aggressively to prevent glyph buildup; use Cleric Stance if DPS role.
-Keep DPS on boss after adds are cleared.
st.h:
-Expect heavy raid-wide damage at end depending on glyphs—heal proactively during add waves.
-Assist in add DPS if safe to reduce glyphs.
st.t:
-Tank boss centrally but adjust to allow adds to be handled quickly.
-Move boss off center if necessary to give space for add cleansing lanes.

166.g:
-Shock Strike tankbuster—stay clear of MT.
-Thunderspark AoEs also break Chaotic Strike stuns.
-Collect Lightning Orbs to gain Surge Protection (3 orbs) but leave some for mechanics.
-Chaotic Strike stuns random player until freed by AoEs.
-Grey Arbiters spawn—kill immediately before Judgment Bolt.
-Rolling Thunder tethers two players; one must soak 3 orbs to cancel.
166.d:
-Focus Arbiters quickly on spawn.
-Spread during Thunderstorm to avoid overlapping damage.
-If tethered, coordinate who soaks orbs.
166.h:
-Prepare heavy heals if orbs are mismanaged (Ramuh hits harder).
-Free stunned players with AoEs or coordinate Thunderstorm placement.
-Top raid before Judgment Bolt.
166.t:
-Keep Ramuh faced away; Shock Strike cleaves.
-Pick up Arbiters instantly.
-Avoid standing near party to prevent tankbuster splash.

173.g:
-Shiva alternates between two stances: sword (cleaves) and staff (AoEs).
-Uses Icebrand (frontal cleave), Glacier Bash (tankbuster), Hailstorm (targeted AoEs), and Icebow (line AoEs). Ice puddles form that must be avoided.
-Casts Heavenly Strike knockback and Diamond Dust (large AoE with freeze).
173.d:
-Avoid Icebow and Hailstorm markers by spreading and repositioning quickly.
-Move out of puddles immediately and resume DPS after Diamond Dust freeze ends.
173.h:
-Prepare group healing for Hailstorm and Diamond Dust.
-Watch for tank damage spikes during Glacier Bash and Icebrand cleaves.
173.t:
-Tank Shiva near center, adjusting for stance.
-Face her away from group in sword stance and mitigate Glacier Bash.

st.g:
-Drops Aqua Balls applying Slime DoT; Tail Screw reduces target to 1 HP; Prey tethers and stuns tank.
-Cleansing Slime is critical before Tail Screw or it'll be fatal.
st.d:
-Avoid standing close to others to reduce multiple Slime stacks on Tail Screw targets.
-If Prey targets tank, a DPS can take it to stun Tail Screw faster.
st.h:
-Remove Slime ASAP—priority before Tail Screw.
-Be ready to top off players hit by Tail Screw (to ~2 HP).
st.t:
-Face boss away from the group and hold add spawns.
-If Prey hits you, tank it or pass to DPS and stun Tail Screw.

st.g: -Summons Slaves (stun), Leeches (heal), Boy/Guard adds; uses Musket marking players requiring damage to end it.
st.d:
-Burn Slaves and Leeches first to prevent stuns/healing.
-When Musket hits, switch to boss DPS until attack ends.
st.h:
-Keep Slave-stunned players healed until free; use shields for the Musket target.
-Apply Adlo or Stoneskin to Musket target to help survive.
st.t:
-Hold boss and adds together; tank slaves to protect DPS/healer.
-If Musket hits tank, get covered or pass it to PLD.

st.g:
-Spawns tentacles (stun) and Arms; killing all Arms briefly stuns Kraken and prevents fatal World’s End.
-Ink Jet blind is unavoidable but cleansable.
st.d:
-Ignore tentacles first; burn Arms quickly to stun Kraken.
-Attack boss once Arms are down to delay World’s End.
st.h:
-Remove Blind from Ink Jet promptly to resume healing.
-Heal through Arms phase; expect damage spikes.
st.t:
-Tank tentacles and boss; don't pick up Arms until DPS is ready to burn.
-Move Kraken to safe spot away from tentacle area between phases.

187.g:
-Odin uses cleaves, frontal cones, and circle AoEs frequently. At intervals, he vanishes and returns with Sanngetall (massive line AoEs), and summons spectral adds.
-Final phase includes Zantetsuken, a room-wide instant-kill if not interrupted with sufficient damage.
187.d:
-Avoid all AoEs and burn spectral adds quickly when they appear.
-Save burst for Zantetsuken cast—failure to interrupt leads to wipe.
187.h:
-Prepare group healing for Sanngetall AoEs and spectral adds.
-Top off party before Zantetsuken and mitigate incoming damage.
187.t:
-Tank Odin center and face him away from the group.
-Grab spectral adds immediately and use mitigation during Zantetsuken window.

st.g:
-At 80%, spread and absorb orbs. Alternate between big (physical vuln) and small (magic vuln).
-Kill small adds quickly; they do cone AoEs.
-Each orb hitting boss gives him a stack—at 7 stacks, non-tanks die.
-Stack for heals if holding 3+ stacks.
st.d:
-Alternate orb soaking to avoid stacking vulnerabilities.
-Kill adds fast to reduce raid damage.
-Avoid letting boss get stacks.
st.h:
-Prepare AoE heals when group soaks orbs.
-Cleanse damage after add cones.
-Heal through Sacred Soil windows if stacks accumulate.
st.t:
-Position boss for easy orb soaking.
-Mitigate damage when stacks climb.
-Hold boss steady during add phase.

st.g:
-Boss casts Double/Triple, then Spark twice/thrice.
-Tank swap with Provoke + Shirk to handle double/triple Spark.
-At 40%, orbs return—handle like Phase 1.
-Dodge End of Days (line AoE).
st.d:
-Avoid unnecessary orb stacks.
-Respect Spark—let tanks handle via swaps.
st.h:
-Prepare strong single-target heals for Spark hits.
-Top up group before orbs return.
st.t:
-Swap during Double Spark.
-Manage cooldowns across Sparks.

208.g: -Tanks handle dropping rocks, focus on clearing otherwise.
208.t: -In void, stand in circles with dropping rock and tank the damage. Not tanking these will cause a wipe.

st.g:
-Prelude to Slaughter: long cast sequence with multiple AoEs, move into safe spots
-Slaughter: cross fire AoEs + purple circle markers, spread to avoid overlap
-Adds at 60%: kill Moon Gana first before Falling Laughter completes or swords will drop
-Lethal: 3 or more swords left before Chandrahas will wipe the party with Laughing Moon stacks
-Chandrahas + Laughing Moon: heavy raidwide, healers must mitigate and top party
st.t:
-Keep Ravana faced away from raid to avoid cleaves
-Pick up adds quickly so DPS can kill Moon Gana safely
-Be ready to mitigate Chandrahas damage
st.d:
-Prioritize Moon Gana before Falling Laughter finishes
-Dodge linear and cross AoE patterns
-Spread with purple circle markers during Slaughter
-Save limit break if needed to finish adds before Chandrahas
st.h:
-Prepare raidwide healing for Prelude/Slaughter AoE chains
-Top the group before Chandrahas + Laughing Moon
-Use mitigation cooldowns during heavy AoEs
-Be ready for spike damage if adds succeed in casting Falling Laughter

st.g:
-No more Prelude to Slaughter; introduces Pillars of Heaven, Surpanakha, Rose of Hate
-Pillars of Heaven: knockback, can push you off after wall breaks
-Surpanakha: multiple linear AoEs on off-tank, avoid path
-Rose of Hate: spread to detonate safely
-Atma-Linga: raidwide AoE, may be cast twice
st.t:
-Position Ravana away from raid as always
-Be mindful of Pillars knockback angles; aim for walls
-Kite Surpanakha AoEs away from party if targeted
-Maintain aggro stability through stance swaps
st.d:
-Spread when targeted by white icons during Swift Slaughter dash
-Move into safe zones during Slaughter and Swift Slaughter AoEs
-If tethered by Rose orb, move away and take detonation solo
-Adjust to avoid falling from Pillars knockback once walls are broken
st.h:
-Heal through raidwides (Atma-Linga, Pillars, Rose detonation)
-Be ready for double Atma-Linga casts in succession
-Cover damage spikes from Swift Slaughter dash hits
-Sustain tank through repeated Surpanakha hits

st.g:
-Avoid circle AoEs and frontal cones (Wooly Inspiration).
-Share damage from Rout by standing between boss and target.
st.d:
-Preposition between boss and target to help share Rout.
-Stay mobile for fast AoE patterns.
st.h:
-Rout can catch players out of position—watch for sudden spikes.
-Minimal raid-wide damage otherwise.
st.t:
-Face away from group to avoid clipping them with cones.
-Stand near Rout target to share damage safely.

st.g:
-Spawns adds at 90% and 60% via Brain Drain.
-Separate boss and adds to avoid buffs; avoid Death Spiral donut AoE and knockbacks.
st.d:
-Switch to adds immediately when they spawn.
-Stay center during Death Spiral to avoid donut damage.
st.h:
-Heal tank heavily during add phases; boss buffs can spike damage.
-Watch positioning for knockbacks and AoEs.
st.t:
-Drag boss away from adds during spawn to prevent buffing.
-Interrupt Brain Drain if possible to delay adds.

st.g:
-Hide behind rubble for Whirling Gaol push.
-Dodge Alpine Draft and Freefall jumps.
st.d:
-Stand near rubble before Whirling Gaol.
-Use sprint to reposition after Freefall jumps.
st.h:
-Whirling Gaol push can scatter party—be ready to reposition.
-AoE spikes after jumps may require burst healing.
st.t:
-Position boss near rubble preemptively.
-Prepare to quickly regain aggro after forced movement.

st.g:
-Defeat Vundu adds while island shield and dragonkillers recharge.
-Activate both dragonkiller harpoons when ready, then board Bismarck to damage the Chitin Carapace from his back; island HP wipe occurs if shield fails.
st.d:
-Be ready to join one harpoon group; synchronize on the carapace to potentially kill it in one cycle.
-Avoid knockbacks from adds—don't stand near edge.
st.h:
-One person should manage the Magitek Field Generator timing.
-Heal through light AoE and carapace standing DoT.
st.t:
-Use cooldowns to mitigate carapace cleaves and face adds away from the group.
-Pull one Vundu add if not killed, keeping it off group for clean carapace DPS.

st.g: -Two Sanuwa adds spawn; they must be tanked separately to avoid buffs. Tornadoes and water AoEs appear. A timed Breach Blast wipe occurs if both adds are not killed in time.
st.d:
-Focus burst on one Sanuwa first, then the other—use Limit Break if needed.
-Dodge tornado movement and island-edge AoEs.
st.h:
-Upkeep healing during add burn; prep raid heal for Breach Blast if adds remain.
-Heal through knockback and water damage from tornadoes and adds.
st.t:
-Each tank picks up one Sanuwa and faces them away from each other and raid.
-Keep adds far apart to prevent tether buff overlap.

st.g: -Repeat carapace and add cycles while island shield is gone. New adds including Nat’maii Vundu will spawn, and Vapor Bubbles appear during rain/thunder; weather alternates and affects bubble behavior.
st.d:
-Join board when phased; sustain carapace DPS until chained.
-Kill Vapor Bubbles in rain but leave them alive in thunderstorms to absorb storms.
st.h:
-Prioritize healing tanks and players dismounted after the board phase.
-During thunder, heal random lightning hits from bubble destruction or weather signature.
st.t:
-Stay with boss after carapace broken and pick up any surviving adds on platform.
-Keep boss positioned to prevent adds from damaging platform before final chain.

st.g: -King Thordan uses Ancient Quaga and The Dragon’s Gaze (looking away avoids fear), along with Ascalon's Mercy—line AoEs with safe gaps. At 80%, he summons untargetable Knights with unique mechanics: orbs, ice puddles, towers, lines, and comets.
st.d:
-Avoid stacking for Lightning Storm and puddles from knock-off adds.
-Kill towers or step into them during Ser Hermenost to prevent paralysis.
st.h:
-Shield and heal through Ancient Quaga and orb explosions from Janlenoux/Adelphel.
-Ensure one player stands in each conviction tower to avoid raid paralysis during Hermenost phase.
st.t:
-Face Thordan away from party to direct cleaves outward.
-Stack for Ascalon’s Mercy gaps and rotate to intercept orbs safely.

st.g: -At ~15%, Thordan withdraws and each Knight sequences special mechanics: Charibert (Heavensflame circles), Hermenost (towers again), Zephirin (massive Sacred Cross cast), Vellguine (room-wide line charge), Janlenoux & Adelphel (cleaves + Holiest of Holy), Ignasse (edge smash), Paulecrain & Haumeric (ice circles and line tether damage), Grinnaux (growing puddles), Noudenet & Guerrique (comet/multi-AoE patterns).
st.d:
-Separate to avoid overlapping ice circles from Paulecrain; dodge Grinnaux puddles before they detonate.
-Burn Zephirin ASAP to soften Sacred Cross’s impact.
st.h:
-Stay mobile to avoid line AoEs and tower knockback overlaps.
-Coordinate shields around Holy chains and icy AoEs.
st.t:
-Tanks split responsibilities: one for Janlenoux/Adelphel cleaves, one for Paulecrain/Haumeric players away.
-Pick up Hermenost’s towers and avoid stacking for Grinnaux and comet circles.

st.g: -Thordan returns and casts Light of Ascalon (multi-knockback), followed by his ultimate, Ultimate End—high-damage cleave in succession across raid.
st.d:
-Stack tightly in mid-arena to minimize pathing issues during knockbacks.
-Disperse quickly after Ultimate End to avoid lingering AoEs.
st.h:
-Use raid cooldowns before Light of Ascalon; heal through staggered knockbacks.
-Prepare shields and regen for Ultimate End’s aftermath.
st.t:
-Face boss inwards to bait knockbacks toward safe zones.
-Stick to Thordan during this phase; DPS until he dies—he’s weakened and only uses auto attacks.

st.g:
-Mini-boss that spawns Sturm Doll adds stacking boss damage.
-Off-tank should pick up dolls; boss is the primary focus.
st.d:
-Stack for AoE to burst boss quickly, ignoring dolls.
-Avoid adds but help stun if extra survive.
st.h:
-Minor raid-wide damage; heal through steady cleaves.
-Stay mobile during movement-heavy steam room pulls.
st.t: -Primary tank holds boss; off-tank grabs dolls and keeps them off raid.

st.g:
-Phase 1: Oppressor spawns Alarum adds that leave Minimize puddles when killed under laser beams.
-Phase 2: Second copy (Oppressor 0.5) joins; both must die simultaneously or remaining one self-destructs.
st.d:
-Phase 1: Kill Alarums away from melee and under laser to reduce damage.
-Phase 2: Split DPS evenly and burn both bosses together.
st.h:
-Phase 1: Heal through Hydrothermal Missile and raid-wide AoEs.
-Phase 2: Prep cooldowns for 3000-Onze Missile and tank cleaves.
st.t:
-Phase 1: MT holds Oppressor south, OT kites Alarums.
-Phase 2: OT picks up the second boss north; tanks separate bosses to prevent buffing, then stack them for burn.

255.g:
-Eight waves of Gordian enemies advance; bombs begin dropping from wave 4 onward.
-Party can pilot Magitek Gobwalkers to drag bombs and apply Vulnerability to enemies.
255.d:
-Use Gobwalker to pull bombs away from party corner; DPS inside to maintain uptime.
-Prioritize kill order: Magitek Gobwalkers → Jagd Dolls → Hardhelms/Hardminds → Soldiers/Snipers → Gobwidow.
255.h:
-Steady AoE healing during waves; watch for bombs’ splash damage stacks.
-Help heal Gobwalker users and bomb-affected players.
255.t:
-Split tank sides; main tank holds spam on one side, off-tank on other.
-Pick up Gobwidows separately to control AoE and vulnerability stack.

st.g:
-Protean Wave cleaves and knocks back in multiple cones—sidestep all angles.
-Sluice marks four players with AoE—spread out, then dodge additional ground AoEs.
-Boss cleaves; face away from party and tank mid to avoid edge knockbacks.
st.d:
-Always stay behind boss; never stand near marked players during Sluice.
-Sidestep all cone AoEs quickly to avoid knockbacks into the edge.
st.h:
-Heal through three consecutive Splashes; time AoE heals between them.
-Monitor Sluice marker players in case they fail to spread or take overlap damage.
st.t:
-Face boss away from group; cleave is always active.
-Maintain center positioning to keep knockback angles safe.

st.g:
-Cleave must be shared by both tanks; tanks must stand together.
-Wash Away knocks players in random directions—stand center or use knockback immunity.
-After split, both hands cleave and inflict Blunt Resist Down—face away from raid.
st.d:
-Return to center before Wash Away or risk getting knocked into edge.
-Never stand between hands or near their cleave paths.
st.h:
-Top off before Wash Away; be ready to heal players knocked into the edge.
-Watch for overlapping cleaves during double-hand phase.
st.t:
-Share initial cleave; both tanks must stack.
-When adds spawn, each tank picks up one and faces it away from group and the other tank.

st.g:
-Kill adds before they reach edge; stun Piston Lubricants when they charge.
-Boss is invulnerable—avoid standing in water pool around center.
-Orange tether must be taken by tank and kept away from group until it resolves.
-Magnetic debuffs: same = stack center, opposite = spread apart to avoid collision.
st.d:
-Focus Gear Lubricants first, then burn Piston Lubricants.
-Handle magnetic debuff correctly to avoid being flung into water or atrophy.
st.h:
-Prepare to heal through failed add handling or magnetic collisions.
-Top off tethered tank post-explosion; damage is very high.
st.t:
-Take orange tether from marked player and move far from others.
-Stun Piston Lubricants before they rush; control their timing.

st.g:
-Cascade creates large AoE pools—avoid standing in or near them.
-Magnetic debuffs reappear: same = stack, opposite = spread; aim push/pull safely.
-Tank cleave now applies Blunt Resist Down—requires frequent swaps.
st.d:
-Dodge Cascade pools and avoid knockbacks into them or arena edge.
-Watch debuff icons and position carefully to avoid magnetic collision.
st.h:
-Coordinate mitigation for frequent tank swaps and Blunt Down stacks.
-Be ready for sustained damage from repeated mechanics and final enrage.
st.t:
-Swap every 4–5 stacks of Blunt Down; avoid overlapping debuff stacks.
-Ensure boss is positioned away from Cascade pools and edge at all times.

st.g:
-Two forelegs must be destroyed sequentially (one regenerates when the other dies).
-Orbs spawn targeting random players and must be soaked by others to prevent their death.
st.d: -Stand in to soak orbs away from marked player; save burst for when the leg is vulnerable.
st.h: -Heal marked players and orb-soakers promptly; prep party health for the burst window post-leg kill.
st.t: -Face leg toward safe zone; MT takes most orbs, OT can assist when MT is low.

st.g:
-Adds spawn: laser bits tether and deal splash damage; Jagd Dolls apply lethal stacks if not killed and separated.
-Mechanics layer atop Phase 1’s orbs and panzer quarantine.
st.d:
-Intercept tethered laser bits to relieve marked players.
-Assign DPS to grab and burn Jagd Dolls separately to avoid multiple stacks.
st.h: -Heal orb interceptors and tether interceptors; tag and heal Jagd Doll handlers.
st.t: -MT handles leg and orbs; OT picks up Jagd Dolls and positions them apart.

st.g:
-All prior mechanics return: orbs, laser bits, Jagd Dolls, plus Quarantine adds and healer DoT (Judgement Nisi).
-Core vulnerable briefly after fourth leg; then uses Royal Pentacle and heavy AoEs.
st.d:
-Burn fourth leg quickly to avoid dual-Nisi deaths; follow Nisi debuff pass order during Pentacles.
-Dodge AoEs and soak Orbs/Bits.
st.h: -Healer separation is essential for Nisi spread; provide cooldowns during Quarantine, Bits, and AoE bursts.
st.t: -Maintain leg tanking until fourth leg falls; face core properly and bait AoEs away from party.

269.g:
-Electric Swipe: cone from rear with Electrocution debuff.
-Immersion: raidwide AoE + orbs that drop puddles (Dropsy).
-Symbiosis: spawns Hybodus adds, boss untargetable until they die.
-Hydrobomb: boss chases marked player, dropping AoEs.
-Electric Whorl: ring AoE, safe in hitbox.
-Expulsion: circle AoE with knockback and Windburn.
-Hydrocore: split-party mechanic; kill Hydrocore inside while outside group kills Hydrospheres to stop buffs.
269.d:
-Stay behind boss but avoid rear cone.
-Kite Hydrobomb safely, away from allies.
-Burn adds quickly during Symbiosis/Hydrocore.
269.h:
-Cleanse Electrocution/Dropsy if possible.
-Strong AoE healing after Immersion and Expulsion.
-Sustain group split during Hydrocore phase.
269.t:
-Face boss away to keep rear cone off group.
-Pick up Hydrocore if tanked inside barrier.

270.g:
-Tether mechanic: health equalizes if difference too large.
-Each boss gains random resistance (Magic or Ranged invuln).
-Mucus Bomb/Spray: AoEs that tether and seize targets; allies must break.
-Shockwave Stomp: hide behind Irminsul or take lethal.
-Sawtooth Feeds: adds spawn; failure leads to devour mechanic spreading Parasite.
-Pulse of the Void: small AoE poison from Irminsul.
270.d:
-Target the boss you can damage (respect resistance).
-Spread for Mucus Bomb and free tethered allies.
-Kill Ark Keds to prevent Parasite spread.
270.h:
-Cleanses for Poison/Seized debuffs.
-Heavy heals needed after Shockwave Stomp.
-Extra healing if Parasite infestations spread.
270.t:
-Each tank hold one boss apart.
-Face Sawtooth away for cleaves.
-Position Irminsul to shield party during Stomp.

271.g:
-Everyone starts with permanent Bleed.
-Corrosive Bile: cone DoT + Poison.
-Flailing Tentacles: diagonal line AoEs with Concussion debuff.
-Idol of Impurity: adds increase Bleed stacks until killed.
-Void Pact: portals spawn Foobars; boss gains Stoneskin buffs.
-Beckon + Devour: pulls Foobars in to eat, empowering boss.
-Bile Below: instant-kill unless standing on raised platforms.
-Pestilence: heavy AoE, reduced by raised platforms.
-Black Lung: adds another Bleed + Black Phlegm orbs that must be cleared before they explode.
271.d:
-Dodge diagonal tentacle slams.
-Help clear orbs during Black Lung.
-Focus Foobars and Idols quickly to avoid wipes.
271.h:
-Bleed is constant—maintain baseline healing.
-Heal through Poison/Concussion.
-Be ready for massive damage if Pestilence empowered.
271.t:
-Face boss away to avoid cone cleave.
-Pick up Gyrtower/Idol adds immediately.

272.g:
-Sickle Strike: tankbuster.
-Sickle Slash: side cleaves, safe in front/back.
-Demonic Descent: either stack marker or random large AoEs.
-Nemesis Burst: circular cleave + knockback.
-Abyssal Reaper: cleave with knockback + Vulnerability Up.
-Petrifaction: gaze, turn away.
-Add Phase: splits into Echidna/Sinister/Dexter—each tank grabs one, keep apart to prevent buffs.
-Gehenna: raidwide after adds merge.
-Bloodguards: occasional adds.
272.d:
-Stack for descent marker or dodge scattered AoEs.
-Avoid gaze; reposition if knocked back.
-Burn adds quickly in split phase.
272.h:
-Tankbusters + Vulnerability Up require spot heals.
-Raid healing for Gehenna and Demonic Descent AoEs.
272.t:
-Main tank takes Echidna, other tanks grab Sinister/Dexter.
-Keep adds apart to prevent buffs.
-Swap only if Vulnerability stacks too high.

st.g: -Boss uses a spinning breath (rotates randomly clockwise or counter-clockwise) that must be dodged; later spawns Rose Hip adds that explode for heavy AoE damage.
st.d:
-Spot spin direction early and reposition away from cleave path.
-Burst Rose Hips immediately when they spawn to prevent explosion.
st.h:
-Top up party just before spinning breath to absorb damage.
-Heal through Hip explosions and minor cleave hits.
st.t:
-Face boss so cleave clears don’t cross party.
-Pull Rose Hips centrally and stay ready to reposition after spin.

st.g: -Several bees perform random column AoEs; boss casts 'Ally' to stack two large pillars simultaneously. Knight Hawk adds tether to boss and must be killed fast to reduce escalating raid damage.
st.d:
-Watch and avoid bees’ column markers.
-Kill Knight Hawk as soon as they tether to boss to prevent ticking raid-wide damage.
st.h:
-Move out of falling pillars to reduce healing strain.
-Prepare AoE heals when Knight Hawks spawn and damage increases.
st.t:
-Tank boss away from bee groups and pillar paths.
-Taunt Knight Hawks off boss and position them for easy DPS access.

273.g:
-Casts a frontal knockback AoE that pushes players toward arena edge; spawns Bulb adds that place Vulnerability Up pools.
-Uses Frond Fatale to charm players into pools; instant wipe if hit. Also uses a raid-wide AoE and spawn additional adds.
273.d:
-Run into boss to avoid knockback into edge.
-Kill Bulb adds quickly to minimize pool clutter.
273.h:
-Look away from boss during Frond Fatale cast to avoid charm and pool soak.
-AoE heal through vulnerability pool overlaps and raid-wide damage.
273.t:
-Tank near center to absorb knockback safely.
-Pick up adds and move them away from pool-heavy areas.

st.g:
-Fiendish Rage: stack on marked player to share damage.
-Ratzon: multiple players marked with green AoEs—spread.
-Ain: faces a random player and blasts 180° cone—stay stacked behind him.
-At 60%, adds spawn: kill Binah first, then Cochma.
st.d:
-Spread fast when marked by Ratzon.
-Keep behind boss to avoid Ain blast.
-Burn Binah add first.
st.h:
-Prepare AoE heals after Fiendish Rage.
-Clean up Ratzon damage—multiple players hit at once.
st.t:
-Keep boss centered so players can stack safely.
-Pick up adds immediately; tank Binah away for focus kill.

st.g:
-Stay toward center—falling is possible now.
-Pillar of Mercy: stand near blue circles (not inside) to avoid knockback off.
-Beam markers: two players get cleaves—split directions.
-Storm of Words must die before Revelation; drops air current for arm sweep—stand inside.
-Spread out before Sephirot’s beam, then restack.
-Red pillar mechanic: one player in each to prevent raidwide damage.
st.d:
-Kill Storm of Words ASAP; use cooldowns to burn.
-If marked by beam, move opposite of group.
-Stand in air current during arm sweep.
-Blue circles knockback, stand next to them - NOT in them.
st.h:
-Prepare raid heals after Pillar of Mercy knockback.
-Storm of Words Revelation is a wipe—be ready to heal through add damage until it dies.
-Blue circles knockback, stand next to them - NOT in them.
st.t:
-Tanks should take positions inside red pillars.
-Grab adds quickly after Storm of Words dies.
-Hold boss centered to control arena space.
-Blue circles knockback, stand next to them - NOT in them.

280.g:
-Casts Psycho Squamae (frontal cone) and spawns player clones that do Neura Squamae (look-away cone).
-Toxic Squama tethers a cloud to a player that explodes for AoE damage and puddles Vulnerability Up.
280.d:
-Face clone-cast away from boss and raid to avoid Neura Squamae cone.
-Kite Toxic Squama tether until it expires to avoid puddle placement.
280.h:
-Heal players hit by Toxic Squama explosion and shields advised on vulnerable targets.
-Pre-shield before Toxic Squama tether to reduce Vulnerability Up effects.
280.t:
-Tank boss facing away; reposition promptly when clones spawn.
-Maintain cleave rhythm without pulling tethered cloud into group.

281.g: -Casts Ancient Aero/Stone/Holy which spawn orbs that grow and explode unless popped; ancient Libra applies earth/wind resistance debuffs.
281.d:
-Destroy spawned orbs quickly—assign resistant players based on Libra debuff.
-Maintain DPS on boss between orb phases.
281.h:
-Prioritize shields/heals on orb target counters.
-Plan raid healing for Ancient Holy and overlapping debuffs.
281.t:
-Hold boss centrally; face away during cleaves.
-Pick up adds quickly post-sphere and kite them off orb locations.

282.g:
-Three-phase fight with Seed of Life revives; stance flips invert effects for Cure IV and Regen.
-Phase 3 introduces Decoy adds tethered to boss or healer requiring fast handling.
282.d:
-In normal stance, stand in Cure IV circles; avoid them in reverse phases.
-Burn Decoy add quickly—prioritize based on stance (Low Putto damages healer, High Putto heals boss).
282.h:
-Manage healing/damage zones based on stance: normal = heal circles, reverse = avoid them.
-Focus healer onto Decoy tethered off healer to protect against Prey.
282.t: -Pick up Decoy add appropriate to stance—High or Low—and reposition to prevent its effect.

286.g:
-Ratfinx changes size and uses different mechanics depending on his form.
-Giant form uses Boost (buff) followed by Bombs Away (slams based on player position); small form summons adds and uses AoEs.
-Players can transform into creatures using syringes on the sides to interact with bombs or avoid mechanics.
286.d: -Burn adds quickly in small form to avoid being overwhelmed.
286.h:
-Watch for tank damage spikes during Boost and Bombs Away.
-AoE heal during add phases and after large AoEs like Missile.
286.t:
-Swap at 4 stacks of Headache debuff in giant form.
-Use red syringe to become a gorilla and push bombs away before Bombs Away.

st.g:
-Drops mines on arena—avoid or tank may need to reposition boss.
-Players marked will have Blaster copies fall on them; spread to avoid overlaps.
-Copies charge in their facing direction after delay; getting hit deals damage + Vulnerability Up.
st.d:
-Spread in a line when marked to avoid overlaps.
-Dodge charging copies by watching their facing.
st.h:
-Prepare heals after players get clipped by charges.
-Be ready for damage spikes if mines detonate.
st.t:
-Move boss if mines clutter safe zones.
-No tank swap required.

st.g:
-Face boss away from group.
-Look at hands to identify mechanic: single drill = proximity line AoE, single laser = tank soak, double laser = group stack.
-Lasers bypass invulns; tanks swap after 3–4 stacks of Magic Vulnerability Up.
st.d:
-Stack behind boss unless targeted by drill.
-Join group for double laser split damage.
st.h:
-AoE heal after double laser.
-Top tank quickly if solo-soaking single laser.
st.t:
-Face away, manage stacks carefully.
-Swap tanks at 3–4 Magic Vulnerability stacks.

st.g:
-Everyone gets high (purple) or low (red) debuff—stand on opposite panel elevation.
-Wrong elevation inflicts heavy damage + Vulnerability Up.
-AoE follows each panel mechanic.
-Orbs above player = stack mechanic requiring indicated number of players.
st.d:
-Move to correct elevation panel (high debuff → low panel, low debuff → high panel).
-Stack in ring with correct number of players when targeted.
st.h:
-AoE heal after each elevation mechanic.
-Be ready to heal players who fail and get Vulnerability Up.
st.t:
-Stay on correct panel to avoid stacking debuffs.
-Swap only if Vulnerability Up is gained.

st.g:
-One player marked with blue indicator summons a water tornado.
-Lava pools spawn, knockback follows.
-Use Shiva ice rings to freeze tornado into an ice boulder.
-Hide behind frozen boulder to survive Ultra Flash.
-Tanks swap at 2 stacks of Vulnerability Up.
st.d:
-If marked, place water tornado safely for freezing.
-Position to hide behind ice boulder after knockback.
st.h:
-Prepare raid heals if anyone fails to hide behind boulder.
-Keep tanks healthy through swap cycles.
st.t:
-Swap tanks every 2 stacks of Vulnerability Up.
-Help position boss away from lava pools.

289.g:
-Ratfinx switches between giant and small forms with unique mechanics.
-Giant form builds Headache stacks leading to Concussion and a tankbuster.
-Small form summons Faust adds and uses bomb-based mechanics.
-Use red syringe to become Harambe and push bombs away.
289.d:
-Use red syringe (gorilla) to push bombs away before Bombs Away.
-Focus Faust adds during small form to prevent overwhelm.
289.h:
-Pre-heal tanks before Concussion and be ready for raid-wide damage from bombs.
-AoE heal during small form add phases.
289.t:
-Main tank holds boss during giant form; off-tank provokes at 4 stacks of Headache.
-Off-tank picks up Faust adds in small form to protect backline.

st.g:
-Boss casts Perpetual Ray (tankbuster) and Mega Beam (line AoE); periodically summons Steam Regulators that explode if not killed.
-Discoid: dangerous orbs spawn—intercept them or players die instantly.
st.d:
-Burst Regulators quickly to prevent Vulnerability Up/Down on raid.
-Intercept Discoid orbs to save tethered players.
st.h:
-Stack AoE heals for beam overlaps and explosion splash.
-Quickly top off players getting hit by Discoid if intercept fails.
st.t:
-Tank swap after Perpetual Ray to avoid stack buildup.
-Face boss away from raid for Mega Beam and group Discoid pathing.

st.g: -Two bosses appear on opposite sides: Brawler uses tankbusters (single/double), Vortexer uses Ice Missile (aoe pool), Fire Pool, and Super Cyclone.
st.d:
-Stay behind Brawler for shared busters; dodge Vortexer pools promptly.
-Kill the priority boss as assigned, switch when done.
st.h:
-Stack and mitigate double buster AoE; heal through Fire/Ice pool overlap.
-Prioritize heals when Super Cyclone and tank busters coincide.
st.t:
-Each tank holds a boss on assigned side.
-Maintain separation to avoid cleave overlap.

st.g: -Blaster summons clones (Mirage) and Mines; Swindler casts Height and Enumeration mechanics requiring positional response.
st.d:
-Avoid clone lines; dodge mines promptly.
-React to Height debuffs by standing on correct floor; match Enumeration numbers.
st.h:
-Heal through mine splash and misplacement damage.
-Reduce vulnerability from Height/Enumeration overlaps.
st.t:
-Pull and face bosses separately on opposite sides.
-Avoid overlapping mechanics between the two bosses.

st.g:
-Final form combining all previous bosses abilities: tankbuster, line AoEs, stack markers, jumps, beams.
-Enrage begins 10 s after complete cycle.
st.d:
-Dodge all recycled AoEs and stack for Long Needle properly.
-Handle Super Jump and Apocalyptic Ray by positioning.
st.h:
-Use raid cooldowns on Double Rocket Punch and Mega Beam phases.
-Heal through overlapping mechanics after combining all previous mechanics.
