st.t: -Swap at Double Rocket Punch; face boss away and position to dodge AoEs and lasers.

298.g:
-Phase 1: tankbuster + Heavy cleave; orange markers place web; burrows then does ring AoEs.
-Phase 2: draws players to web—split tasks: top handles orbs/spiders, bottom destroys Keyknots to drop the web.
-Phase 3: mixes Phases 1 and 2 with additional web/tornado mechanics.
298.d:
-After initial rings, stay stacked for tankbuster then spread during Heavy.
-In Phase 2, DPS on purple orbs first, kill spiders later; bottom DPS handles Keyknots.
298.h:
-Apply shields before Heavy AoEs; coordinate tether breaks.
-Top heal through Implosion and drop phase; bottom heal through orb and spider burst damage.
298.t:
-Tank boss and avoid plowing into party.
-1 tank holds boss top during Phase 2, other picks up spiders after drop.

299.g:
-Phase 1: regenerating adds explode with Vulnerability; portals must be covered during Punishing Ray.
-Phase 2 (Void Call): three adds appear—Succubus (mind control), Hagenti (Doom gaze), Dahak.
-Phase 3: Megadeath requires 1-4 stacks of zombie buff to survive, followed by Hell Wind AoE and repeating mechanics.
299.d:
-Kill regulators quickly; cover Punishing Ray spots to mitigate damage.
-Separate and burn adds in Void Call, stun Succubus, look away from Hagenti; soak Megadeath puddle once.
299.h:
-Heal orb soakers and manage Punishing Ray stacks; dispel Doom.
-Post-Megadeath, heal through Hell Wind and ongoing AoEs.
299.t: -MT picks up adds and positions away from raid; OT separates adds during Void Call.

300.g:
-Alliance A goes left, B in the middle, C to the right.
-Kill Void Fire quickly or else big boom.
-Kill Parthenope and rejoin middle.
-Step on red circles to create a barrier in the middle against Flaring Epigraph.
300.h: -If Big Burst goes off from Void Fire, expect need to burst heal everyone.
300.t: Let alliance B tank take the miniboss. Go left/right on alliance A/C.

301.g:
-Cycles between Sphere, Pyramid, and Cube forms.
-Sphere: Spread proximity markers left/back to avoid Debris Burst overlap. Kill adds. Handle stack marker.
-Pyramid: Move to ring platform to dodge line AoE.
-Cube: Stand on rectangular platform to avoid donut AoE. Tanks bait lasers and soak Ozmaspheres away from group.
-Ozmashade Phase: stand on circle to kill the add. Look away from Assimilation. Kill Ozmashade before Doomsday.
-Final Phase: Repeats all forms with doubled meteor targets.
301.d:
-Spread correctly for meteors. Handle stack marker.
-Stop all actions before Acceleration Bomb ends.
-Avoid ring AoE and let tanks soak orbs.
-Quickly burn adds and spread proximity markers in Ozmashade.
301.h:
-Shield meteor and stack damage.
-Cleanse Bleed/Poison in Pyramid. Time heals around Acceleration Bomb.
-Heal tanks during orb soaks and Holy.
-Free trapped players during Ozmashade and heal proximity hits.
301.t:
-Face boss away. In Cube, absorb Ozmaspheres and avoid cleaving raid with lasers.
-Tank adds in Sphere. In Ozmashade, help burn adds and reposition fast post-return.

302.g:
-Cycles between Sphere, Pyramid, and Cube forms.
-Sphere: Spread proximity markers left/back to avoid Debris Burst overlap. Kill adds. Handle stack marker.
-Pyramid: Move to ring platform to dodge line AoE.
-Cube: Stand on rectangular platform to avoid donut AoE. Tanks bait lasers and soak Ozmaspheres away from group.
-Ozmashade Phase: stand on circle to kill the add. Look away from Assimilation. Kill Ozmashade before Doomsday.
-Final Phase: Repeats all forms with doubled meteor targets.
302.d:
-Spread correctly for meteors. Handle stack marker.
-Stop all actions before Acceleration Bomb ends.
-Avoid ring AoE and let tanks soak orbs.
-Quickly burn adds and spread proximity markers in Ozmashade.
302.h:
-Shield meteor and stack damage.
-Cleanse Bleed/Poison in Pyramid. Time heals around Acceleration Bomb.
-Heal tanks during orb soaks and Holy.
-Free trapped players during Ozmashade and heal proximity hits.
302.t:
-Face boss away. In Cube, absorb Ozmaspheres and avoid cleaving raid with lasers.
-Tank adds in Sphere. In Ozmashade, help burn adds and reposition fast post-return.

303.g:
-Haircut cleaves left or right based on blade-side hair—causes Bleed.
-Extension tethers pull players in; failing to kill tentacles results in Garrote deaths.
-Bijous must be killed quickly to weaken Dancing Mad AoE.
-Living Locks (flowers) do knockbacks (bulbs) or donut AoEs (axes); position near axes.
-Penetration pushes/pulls based on whether you're looking at boss; avoid being forced into flowers.
-Depth Charge → Haircut combo follows her charge—dodge blade side.
-Arena-wide beams fire from flower sides late in fight.
303.d:
-Avoid blade side during Haircut and watch for tether pulls.
-Burn Bijous fast; kite chasing AoEs along edges.
-Stay in safe zones near axes during flower phase.
303.h:
-Cleanse Bleeds from Haircut.
-Heal through Dancing Mad and mitigate Evil Tress knockups.
-Watch Garrote and assist freeing trapped players.
303.t:
-Face boss away; avoid cleaving group with Bloodied Nail.
-Tank in center to give room for Haircut dodges and Depth Charge.
-Adjust boss facing to control Haircut direction safely.

st.g:
-Waves of pirates interspersed with cannon fire and tethered Coeurl adds.
-Dodge line AoEs and kill the Coeurl quickly to avoid healer bleed debuffs.
st.d:
-Maintain movement to dodge line attacks and cannon circles.
-Priority-target tethered Coeurl to remove bleed/healer debuff.
st.h:
-Raid takes incidental damage from AoEs—heal steadily.
-Quick single-target heals when Coeurl applies bleed fixate.
st.t:
-Face mobs to direct AoEs safely.
-Grip and tank Coeurl adds quickly to protect party.

st.g:
-Alternates between lightning tethers, freezing markers, and slime pools.
-Use lightning mechanics wisely: break tethers or soak lightning in slime, group freezing circles close for safety.
st.d:
-When tethered by lightning, separate to drop tether.
-When targeted for lightning, move into slime to become fettered and avoid damage.
st.h:
-Prepare burst AoE heals during freezing explosions.
-Monitor players in slime pools and mana-costly heals from tether failings.
st.t:
-Keep boss positioned away from mechanics.
-Call out tether and freezing so tanks can reposition adds/platform.

st.g: -Two phases: first melee with cone/tankbuster AoEs; second includes chests with antidotes, heavy marked target AoEs, and keg bombs.
st.d:
-Phase 1: dodge melee cleaves.
Phase 2: kill chest mobs for antidote, dodge keg explosives, and burst boss post-AoE.
st.h:
-Make sure each player gets to a chest with a potion to remove the poison.
-Heal marked players and prep cooldowns during keg explosions and tank busters.
st.t:
-Phase 1: face boss away from party.
Phase 2: tank boss to allow chest access, then reposition to avoid keg blasts and heavy-marked attacks.

st.g:
-Avoid Hot Wings (safe line along body) and Hot Tail (safe where Wings hit).
-Deafening Bellow raidwide, later double-cast.
-Spread from ground holes; avoid fire trail.
-Stack center when boss flies away, then spread for AoEs.
st.d:
-Stay mid-range so you can reposition quickly for holes and trail.
-Spread cleanly after holes spawn to avoid overlap.
st.h:
-Prepare heals for repeated Deafening Bellows.
-Position to heal spread-out players during holes + trail.
st.t:
-Face boss away from group.
-Anchor near center to allow group safe positioning.

st.g:
-Kill adds fast; failure wipes raid.
-Middle add untankable; avoid its frontal swipes.
-Side adds cleave—tanks face outwards.
-DPS check may require LB and healer DPS.
st.d:
-Focus side adds first; burn middle last.
-Use LB if DPS is low to beat timer.
st.h:
-Assign one healer per tank for side adds.
-Contribute DPS if healing load is light.
st.t:
-Tank each side add facing outward.
-Swap cooldowns as needed to handle cleaves.

st.g:
-Akh Morn tankbuster—heavier single-hit.
-Geirskogul: avoid targeted line AoE.
-Meteors: spread to edges, leave circles quickly.
-Room AoE after meteors—move away and heal heavy damage.
st.d:
-Spread meteors evenly to edges.
-Move quickly out of ground circles to avoid bleed.
st.h:
-Shield/heal Akh Morn target.
-Be ready for burst AoE after meteor mechanic.
st.t:
-Mitigate Akh Morn heavily.
-Face boss so Geirskogul line doesn’t clip party.

st.g:
-Akh Morn now requires full raid stack; bolts increase each cast.
-3 Fireballs spawn—safe in unused row/column, then sprint center for Hot Wings.
-Hot Wings safe line, followed by Hot Tail covering opposite line.
-Ground holes + fire trail repeat from Phase 1.
st.d:
-Stack on Akh Morn target until bolts end.
-Reposition fast between bomb, Wings, and Tail mechanics.
st.h:
-Prepare big raidwide heals for Akh Morn stacks.
-Layer shields and mitigation before Hot Wings + Hot Tail combos.
st.t:
-Stay stacked during Akh Morn even as MT.
-Reface boss away after bolts; keep control near center.

st.g:
-Sophia starts with Thunder II (frontal cleave), followed by Thunder III (donut AoE where safe spot is close or far).
-Followed by Aero III (centered AoE with knockback) and Daughter adds that cast Light Dew line AoEs.
-Proximity markers appear under players that must be moved away from to avoid extra damage.
st.d:
-Stack behind marked players during Fiendish Rage / stack markers to share damage from Thunder.
-Avoid front-facing during Thunder II and stay either very close or far away during Thunder III.
st.h:
-Shield before Thunder II and Aero III. Prep for follow-up damage from Light Dew and proximity markers.
-Stay mobile to avoid crowding into final knockbacks and proximity fields.
st.t:
-Face Sophia away from the raid at all times. Immediately reposition after Aero III to avoid pushing teammates off.
-Keep spatial awareness when Daughter appears and line-casts are cast.

st.g:
-Sophia casts Cloudy Heavens to become invulnerable and marks all players with Eternal Doom.
-Three Demiurge adds spawn (Paladin, Healer, Lancer) and must be killed quickly—failure triggers Zombification and wipe.
st.d:
-Burn Demiurges rapidly in priority order: healer first, paladin last for directional parry.
-Avoid lingering in frost puddles dropped by the lancer Demiurge.
st.h:
-Help dispel the confusion gaze from the healer Demiurge.
-Focus healing during AoE bursts from Demiurge adds and monitor Eternal Doom timers.
st.t:
-Off-tank picks up Binah/Cochma or relevant Demiurges quickly; MT handles others.
-Face adds away and avoid causing turmoil with parry mechanics on Paladin Demiurge.

st.g:
-Sophia casts Quasar, spawning scales on east and west. Meteors fall outside: orange =1, blue =3. Arena tilts toward heavier side.
-Players slide toward low side—positioning near edge and avoiding frost puddles from Phase 2 is crucial.
-Sophia also casts Sin & Punishment (light/dark ring markers) and Cintamani (always wipes if markers not paired).
st.d:
-Stand on the side opposite any blue meteor and at arena edge to avoid sliding off.
-For Sin & Punishment, pair light with dark markers—max two players per stack to avoid damage.
st.h:
-Avoid sliding into lingering frost rings; stay mobile and aware of scale orientation.
-Coordinated healing for paired markers and cleansing debuffs from Cintamani phase as required.
st.t:
-Guide facing outward to prevent knockbacks pushing group off edge.
-Aim positioning to keep Sophia centered and away from icy puddles before scale tilt.

st.g:
-Casts line AoEs in various patterns that apply Slow.
-Repel causes knockback; ice-floor causes sliding; Disclosure must be dodged by standing behind the boss when it closes its mouth.
st.d:
-Watch line AoE patterns and adjust quickly to avoid Slows.
-During Disclosure, stand behind the boss immediately to avoid party wipe.
st.h:
-Pre-shield for knockback and AoE overlap.
-Time heals for Disclosure phase and cleanse Slows if needed.
st.t:
-Keep boss centered to allow group movement.
Face boss sideways for clear visibility of AoEs and easier positioning for Disclosure.

st.g:
-Casts Bibliocide (raid-wide), Sea of Flames puddles, and Slosh (run away from boss).
-Ferrofluid: Players get + and - marks, if your mark is the same as the boss's, run close to the boss. Otherwise, run away.
-Seal of Night and Day: Players get sun and moon marks; run to the corresponding sun or moon sigil on the floor.
st.d:
-Respond correctly to symbol mechanics (stack/spread).
-When tethered by Slosh, move away from party to reduce splash damage.
st.h:
-Shield and heal through Bibliocide and Sea of Flames.
-Top off Slosh target and be prepared for overlap during symbol phase.
st.t:
-Face boss away from puddles.
-Allow tethered DPS to move freely and avoid cleaving group during Slosh.

312.g:
-White circle deals with Quakes.
-Black circle deals with Tornados.
-Green circle toggles Imp status. Use to turn back after getting hit by Properties of Imps.
-Find a rock to hide behind when Behemoth casts Ecliptic Meteor.
312.d:
-Enter correct circle based on upcoming mechanic (white for quake, black for tornado).
-During meteors, use safe zones and avoid stacking with imp status.
312.h:
-Prepare burst healing for tornado and quake phases.
-Heal through Thunder overlap if players are still imps.
312.t:
-Keep boss away from Behemoth spawn.
-Reposition Strix to prevent AoEs from overlapping circles or meteors.

326.g:
-Single-target tankbuster cleaves that can be shared between tanks.
-Minor raid AoE from Panzerschreck but no major mechanics.
326.d:
-Stay stacked behind boss to maximize uptime and cleave efficiency.
-Help stun adds when they spawn to support clear speed.
326.h:
-Heal consistently through raid-wide Panzerschreck.
-Be prepared for incidental damage between pulls.
326.t:
-Stack both tanks for the tankbuster and face boss away.
-Manage enmity cleanly; no swaps needed until taunt cooldown.

327.g:
-Arena split into 4 quadrants with intermittent lava.
-Adds must be dragged into lit platforms before lava's in' to melt, otherwise boss absorbs them and gains powers.
-Full-metal Faust same mechanic but has extra HP.
-Boss uses Scrap (tankbuster), Scrapline cleaves, Scrap Burst (hide behind meteor), and Scrap Bomb stack markers.
327.d: -When off-tank pulls adds, focus them as they must die ASAP.
327.h: -Keep eye on off-tank when they pull adds.
327.t:
-Main tank holds boss facing away.-
Off-tank: grab power generators and put on robot piles to wake them up.
-Pull activated robots to the lit panel - lava will sweep in and melt the defeated robot.
-Adds explode if alive when lava's in, wiping the raid.
-Full metal faust has a lot of HP, drag to the party and into a lit panel only as it gets close to dying.

st.g: -Arena features spike traps, ball traps, and lightning floors. Boss jumps between buttons to trigger them and brings in a steamroller add during phase 2.
st.d:
-Stand clear of spikes and trap zones; stack behind boss between mechanics.
-Burst steamroller quickly or it clears the raid.
st.h:
-Heal party through trap damage and immobilizations.
-Prepare for line and raid AoEs from adds.
st.t:
-Hold boss centrally to guide trap usage.
-Lead steamroller clear to delay its path toward the raid.

st.g: -Boss begins using a mix of unmarked AoEs: green donut or red cleave (Single Charge), plus saw blades and ongoing trap mechanics.
st.d: -Green = stand mid-range; Red = move away fast. Stay out of saw paths.
st.h:
-Position to avoid red cleaves and wall saw damage.
-Heal through burst AoEs after mechanics.
st.t:
-Anticipate AoE cues to face boss away from party.
-Guide raid into safe spots between traps and saws.

331.g:
-Three-phase fight with Optical Sight variations, adds, platform jumps, and Plasma Shield mechanics.
-Final phase includes Prey and Blassty Charge, requiring movement and positioning.
331.d:
-Avoid Optical Sight AoEs (massive, ring, or player-targeted) by knowing the orb pattern.
-Destroy Lapis Lazuli adds before Eternal Darkness and dodge lasers during Phase 3.
331.h:
-Heal low-health players after Photon and raid-wide E.D.D. damage.
-Protect Prey targets with shields and position them away from group.
331.t:
-OT pick up flying E.D.D. add immediately.
-If tryharding, tank swap after GA-100, face boss away, and bait Blassty Charge to rear.

st.g:
-Divine Spear is a frontal cleave—face boss away.
-Punishing Heat is a tankbuster.
-Mega Holy is raidwide AoE.
-Sacrament fires cross-shaped line AoEs; safe spots are diagonals.
-Blazing Scourge marks 2 players with heavy AoE—spread away.
st.d:
-Stay at diagonals during Sacrament.
-Spread quickly if marked by Blazing Scourge.
st.h:
-AoE healing needed for Mega Holy.
-Spot heal Blazing Scourge victims—damage is heavy.
st.t:
-Keep boss faced away for Divine Spear.
-Mitigation for Punishing Heat; reposition to ease Sacrament dodges.

st.g:
-Wave 1: 2 packs of 3 adds—stack mid and cleave.
-Wave 2: 2 Generals—tanks split them and face away.
-Wave 3: 4 Wings spam Almost Holy—focus kill to reduce raid damage.
-Judgement follows waves—use tank LB or wipe.
st.d:
-Burn adds fast, focus Wings to cut raid damage.
-DO NOT USE LB, TANK NEEDS TO USE IT FOR JUDGEMENT.
st.h:
-Raid healing needed during Wings’ Almost Holy spam.
-Prepare for raidwide hit after tank LB during Judgement.
st.t:
-Pick up all adds quickly, face Generals away.
-A tank should use LB during Judgement - wait for the final 5 seconds countdown.

st.g:
-Temporal Stasis freezes players; mechanics resolve after debuff falls.
-Plaint of Solidarity = stack, Plaint of Severity (green marker) = spread.
-Sacrament follows stasis—dodge quickly after freeze ends.
-Time Gate: 4 adds spawn and enter portals—1 player must chase and kill each.
-Gravitational Anomaly spawns overlapping circles with triangle/edge safe zones.
-Incinerating Heat = stack.
-Summon Alexander introduces Communion: players drop puddles from laser beams, move them to edge.
st.d:
-During Stasis, memorize mechanics (stack or spread) and move instantly once free.
-If chosen for Communion, drop puddles on arena edge.
-Burn portal adds quickly—help teammates once yours is dead.
st.h:
-Top group before Stasis; healing window is tight after freeze.
-Raidwide healing for Mega Holy, Incinerating Heat, and post-Wings damage.
-Heal Communion DoT victims as they place puddles.
st.t:
-Face boss carefully before Stasis to control Sacrament angle.
-Assign tank LB for Judgement if still alive from previous phase.
-Pick up portal adds immediately if chosen.

st.g: -Sharpstrike cleaves tank; puddle stun (Mucal Glob) precedes lethal Shuck—interrupt by killing a leg. Kamikiri adds spawn individual AoE puddles—kill to avoid Dropsy.
st.d:
-Focus Kamikiri first, then boss leg to interrupt Shuck quickly.
-Avoid standing near others to limit Dropsy puddle overlap.
st.h:
-Shield or heal tank before Sharpstrike. Prep burst if Shuck cast begins fail leg interrupt.
-Top off players in Dropsy puddles quickly.
st.t: -Face boss away during Sharpstrike. Grab adds early and position leg hits for cleanness.

st.g: -Boss casts Seduce → Coriolis Kick; players must touch one of four boxes to avoid Seduce by gaining Old status. Uses Tornadogenesis and Abyssal Volcano puddles chasing players.
st.d: -Use assigned box to dodge Seduce. Stack outside of puddles and keep moving during volcano marks.
st.h: -Heal through Tornadogenesis hits. Shield and prep raid for Abyssal Volcano splash damage.
st.t: -Face boss away from center to avoid cleaves crossing tanks. Maintain movement patterns to avoid puddle knockback overlap.

st.g: -Hides under Thick Fog triggering Churn adds that apply Dropsy—kill all quickly. Boss then bursts out with Black Tide causing zone damage + Vulnerability Up. Sharks spawn (Bite and Run), boss may fear via Mad Stare.
st.d: -Burn Churn adds rapidly to prevent stacking Dropsy. Steer clear of rippling zones after boss reappears.
st.h:
-Sustain raid during Thick Fog add waves. Heal through Black Tide and cleanse or manage Vulnerability Up.
-Face away quickly on Mad Stare to avoid fear.
st.t: -Pull and isolate sharks away from raid. Face Yohi away consistently and reposition after fog adds clear.

st.g:
-Void Death pulls players; run to edges or die.
-Green markers spawn tornadoes on players (Void Aero II).
-Void Aero III damages based on distance from it, so go to the purple walls.
-Ice crystals land and do damage, but then prevent you from being blown off in later attacks.
st.h:
-Many mechanics drop Esuna-able debuffs on party members.
-Particularly Doomsay which gives Doom to two players. You must Esuna this.
st.t: -Keep boss roughly in the center, but avoid lit-up platforms as those will 1-shot you.

st.g:
-Red markers place scythe AoEs on players.
-Wormhole: spawns four atomos, two orange and two blue. Will tether to one, and send a blue ORB or yellow DONUT.
-If it's a DONUT, stand on matching Atomos to avoid Donut AoE. If ORB, run away from matching Atomos to avoid blast AoE.
-Debilitator gives a debuff to fire or water. Turn the puddles to the opposite to receive less damage.
st.d: -Place scythes away from the main group.
st.h: -Lots of debuffs to Esuna.

st.g:
-Aethero Flare: just soak this.
-Eikonizer: stack.
-Flare Star: run away.
st.d: -Focus Dreadnaughts and Collectors over Ultima.
st.t: -If you're off-tank, make sure to grab Dreadnaughts so they don't touch your parties.

344.g:
-Thirty Thorns: move out of melee range.
-Shadespin: get out of her wings' way.
-When you see 'Shadows gather on the floor', stop moving.
-Nox Orbs: bait away from other players.
-Face shadow limbs when tethered to stop their movement.
344.t: -Pitfall spawns Connla adds. Off-tanks should grab these and keep them away from the queen.

st.g:
-Look away from Nightmare.
-Ultimate Terror: mid-range donut, either hug Diabolos or stand far away.
-Omen does raid-wide damage.-Kill lifegates 5 times to move to the next phase.
st.d:
-Melee stuns can interrupt diabolos' attacks.
-Focus deathgates so they don't spawn adds.
st.t: -Tank stuns can interrupt most of diabolos' attacks.

st.g:
-Has a shield to break through at first.
-Hollow nightmare now inflicts Doom.
-Earthshaker: marks 3 players for a cone AoE, so spread.
-Nox: spawns chasing balls. Keep these away from the party!
-Use towers to deal with particle beams, middle one only for tanks.
st.d: -If diabolic gate spawns, go in and kill the add quickly or the raid wipes.
st.h: -With the shield up, Diabolos will do extra damage so prepare to heal your main tank a LOT.
st.t:
-Use the middle tower for particle beam.
-Off-tanks should soak Critical Gravity red orbs away from the party.

st.g:
-Platform segments collapse in order: East → North → West → South. Touching a falling edge means instant death.
-Zurvan uses Metal Cutter (frontal cleave) and drops Flare Star puddles on random players.
st.d:
-Avoid standing near edges and behind boss to dodge cleave.
-Stack bait for Flare Stars then move as patterns develop.
st.h:
-Pre-shield before Metal Cutter and puddle drops.
-Heal through raindrop AoEs and reposition team away from dying floor tiles.
st.t:
-Keep Zurvan facing away from raid and centrally positioned.
-Shift boss as the platform collapses to prevent edge exposure.

st.g:
-Zurvan leaps with Soar causing clones that cast line AoEs.
-Flaming Halberd: player trails.
-Demonic Dive: stack/stagger.
-Wave Cannon: line on tank.
-AoEs: Ice Puddle, Biting Halberd (cone), Southern Cross, Ciclicle (donut), and Tail End (edge circle).
st.d:
-Follow safe zones for Soar patterns and avoid overlap in Halberd trails.
-Stack for Demonic Dive then dodge line, cone, donut, and edge AoEs in order.
st.h:
-Coordinate small stacks and shields for stagger and AoE chain.
-Heal raid through overlap of ice puddles and donut hits.
st.t:
-Rotate between Halberd lines; reposition boss mid-chain to keep group safe.
-Predict Tail End and guide raid toward arena edge.

st.g: -Waves of adds arrive: Thews, Wills, and Wit. All must be defeated to continue; left alive they trigger wipes or destabilize later phases.
st.d:
-Focus DPS to burn adds quickly, prioritizing Wit and Will in that order..
-Keep spread to minimize splash damage from AoE from adds.
st.h:
-Assign healer to the caster add (Wit) and shield tanks strapped to melee adds.
-Heal through explosion damage and prepare for transition damage spike.
st.t:
-Off-tank grab Execrated Wills/Wit.
-Position adds safely to avoid platform edge and overlapping AoEs.

st.g:
-Returns to Phase 2-style mechanics with added Broken Seal: players receive Fire or Ice tethers, meteors spawn in patterns. Mist-matched soaking or unsoaked meteors cause Vulnerability debuff.
-Tyrfing tankbusters increase in hit count each cast.
st.d:
-Tether correctly by fire/ice; coordinate safe soaking and avoid multiple AoEs.
-Stack or spread as needed and sidestep cone AoEs; watch for vulnerability stacking.
st.h:
-Share stacking for Demonic Dive/Wave Cannon.
-Mitigate contagion of vulnerabilities and match meteor soaking patterns quickly.
st.t:
-External developers only: tank switch appropriately for Tyrfing escalation.
-Keep orientation and positioning tight as arena fractures renew Soar and line mechanics.

st.g:
-Assail: untelegraphed tankbuster.
-Rasen Kaikyo: circle AoEs under all players—spread.
-Yata No Kagami: marked player gets knocked back, determines safe zone for platform AoE.
-Brightstorm: stack on marked player after Yata.
-Dark Clouds spawn and fire line AoEs that inflict Paralysis.
st.d:
-Spread for Rasen Kaikyo, then regroup.
-Stack quickly for Brightstorm after knockback.
-Stay aware of Dark Cloud line AoEs.
st.h:
-Prepare heals for Brightstorm stack.
-Cleanse Paralysis if possible from Dark Cloud hits.
st.t:
-Hold Susano steady, face away.
-Watch for untelegraphed Assail tankbuster.

st.g:
-One tank must pick up the crystal and clash with Susano.
-Focus Ame-no-Murakumo sword before cast completes or party wipes.
-Off-tank intercepts orbs from Sheer Force to protect party.
-Ends with a red line AoE—anyone inside dies.
st.d:
-Burn the sword as priority during clash.
-Stay away from red line marker.
st.h:
-Heal clash tank under Flesh Wound DoT.
-Be ready for incidental splash damage from missed orbs.
st.t:
-MT takes crystal and holds clash.
-OT collects Sheer Force orbs to reduce raid damage.

st.g:
-Stormsplitter: line tankbuster.
-Ama-no-iwato: one player trapped in stone; identify bottom-most target in enemy list and free before Sealed Gate finishes.
-Phase 1 mechanics return with increased overlap.
-Ukehi: raidwide, can occur once or twice.
st.d:
-Switch to trapped stone quickly during Ama-no-iwato.
-Spread/stack properly as Phase 1 repeats.
st.h:
-Prepare strong heals for Stormsplitter.
-Top party for double Ukehi casts.
st.t:
-Mitigate Stormsplitter.
-Assist in freeing the correct stone during Ama-no-iwato.

st.g:
-First Corrupted Aether always Water: run to waterspout side to avoid knockback.
-Fire requires standing in puddles, Lightning requires avoiding puddles.
-Spread when marked by Right Wing lightning.
-Avoid Left Wing icicles or platform-wide frost.
-Earth Breath targets two players with cones—position so only one side is covered.
-Stack for Ahk Morn to share damage.
st.d:
-Spread cleanly for Right Wing lightning.
-Stack with group on Ahk Morn.
st.h:
-Prepare strong AoE heals for Fire and Lightning.
-Rescue players during Tidal Wave if they misposition.
st.t:
-Hold boss steady.
-Mitigation for tank autos and be ready for wing bolts.

st.g:
-Large AoEs cover arena—move to far corners.
-Adds spawn from cocoons with proximity markers—spread away on drop.
-Hakkinryu tankbusters (Death Sentence) need attention.
-Defeat waves fast or DPS check fails.
-Fetter + Active Time Maneuver before Phase 3—mash to survive.
st.d:
-Burn adds quickly; focus Hakkinryu first.
-Use AoE to clear Ginryu packs.
st.h:
-Top off after arena AoEs.
-Sustain tanks through Death Sentence and add waves.
st.t:
-Grab Hakkinryu immediately; mitigate Death Sentence.
-Keep adds faced away from party.

406.g:
-Line Charge comes early—either corners to dodge or soak safely mid.
-Outer blue platforms can break from Tail Slam or Corrupted Earth—stand safe.
-After Tail Slam, target Shinryu’s tail—breaking it chunks boss HP.
-Wind pulses knockbacks from center; stay close in.
-Ice freezes floor—don’t move until it ends.
-Fire requires puddles; Lightning avoid puddles.
-Burning Chains: chained players spread apart.
-Ahk Morn still requires stacks, with extra blue beam AoE to dodge.
406.d:
-Focus tail after Tail Slam for faster clear.
-Spread for Burning Chains and Right Wing lightning.
-Avoid slippery Ice floors—stand still.
406.h:
-Big AoE healing for Wind pulses, Fire, and Akh Morn.
-Watch chained players for DoT healing.
406.t:
-Hold boss mid on grey platform to avoid edge danger.
-Move to Tail Slam platforms quickly to help DPS tail.
-Mitigation for repeated tank autos and add pressure.

683.en: The First Altar of Djanan Qhat

381.en: The First Altar of Djanan Qhat

390.g:
-Wyrm Tail and Twin Bolt are tankbusters; Twin Bolt also hits closest tethered player.
-Breathwing and Clamp knockback - hug boss during breathwing.
-Elements: Fire Orbs (AoE), Thin Ice (arena turns to ice), Levinbolt (spread), Blaze (stack), and Downburst (tornado in the center, avoid).
-Charybdis drops HP to 1—follow immediately with healing before Roar finishes.
390.d:
-If tethered for Twin Bolt, stand closest to MT intentionally; if not, avoid that spot.
-Dodge knockbacks toward safe zones during Breathwing and Clamp.
-React quickly to Classical Elements combos to avoid stacking mechanics.
390.h:
-Prepare burst healing after Charybdis + Roar.
-Watch for high incoming damage on Twin Bolt target and Vulnerability Up players.

391.g:
-Tilted platforms drop into void; watch quake markers and stay on stable tiles.
-Earthquake inflicts Hysteria if on unstable platforms—hug safe corners.
-Black/white puddles require standing in the correct color or you'll be knocked off.
-Gravitational Manipulation targets one role with knockback—look for arrows.
391.d:
-Gravitational Manipulation often targets DPS—adjust quickly to avoid fall.
-Time movement to puddles and safe tiles without interrupting uptime.
391.h:
-Big roomwide AoEs after Earthquake combos; pre-shield before quake.
-Watch for delayed damage from knockback failures or fear debuff.
391.t:
-Main tank: boss moves frequently—recenter quickly after tilt phases.
-Off-tank: help locate quake marker and preposition party accordingly.

392.g:
-Watch for spell cues: normal cast = real, upside-down = reversed.
-Platform turns into a board game; follow visual cues to avoid danger tiles.
-Frogs must bait AoEs and avoid clipping others.
-Adds phase requires splitting to interrupt casts simultaneously.
392.d:
-Move quickly to safe tiles during board phase; pay attention to glyph orientation.
-If transformed into a frog, bait AoEs away from the party.
392.h:
-Party-wide AoEs follow most spell mechanics—anticipate overlap damage.
-Adds phase can get chaotic—track split groups to keep both sides alive.
392.t:
-Main tank: pick up adds quickly during add phase.
-Off-tank: interrupt your assigned add; coordinate to avoid missed casts.

394.g:
-Watch for elemental cast indicators: Thunder = spread, Blizzard = stack, Fire = bait/explode.
-Void Tornado and Black Hole require precise movement or knockback immunity.
-During Decisive Battle, Exdeath gains new void mechanics—check cast name carefully.
394.d:
-Adjust positioning early for elemental spells to avoid rushed movement.
-Bait Fire AoEs away from others during Fire III orbs.
394.h:
-High raid damage during Decisive Battle; pre-shield and pre-position.
-Void mechanics have delay—don't top off too early or you'll waste heals.
394.t:
-Main tank: reposition away from party during Fire spells to control AoE.
-Off-tank: assist with add pickup in Decisive Battle; don’t overlap tethers or AoEs.

399.g:
-Main mechanic is Vril, which disables certain moves.
-Use Vril on: Divine Denial, Pull of Light.
-Kill Dreamer Ananta adds first to break shield.
-Hand of Beauty: circles on players—spread far.
-Divine Denial: knockback—use Vril or be pushed off.
-Pull of Light: tankbuster + knockback—Vril required.
-Pall of Light: stack marker—stand together UNLESS MARKED.
-Vril orbs appear during add phase—grab only one.
-Adds with bubbles restore Vril—kill those first.
399.d:
-Spread for circles, move out for crosses.
-Use Vril on knockbacks. Avoid double Vril pickup.
399.h:
-Shield before Divine Denial and Stotram.
-Top up party during adds and post-stack hits.
399.t:
-Grab boss, face away.
-Handle tankbusters with Vril and cooldowns. Don’t waste Vril early.

st.g:
-Watch Corrupted Aether gauge—Tidal Wave will knock back from water spout.
-Stand beside spout to reduce push and damage.
-Hellfire requires standing in puddles to survive.
-Wing glows: right wing = spread for lightning; left wing = dodge icy wing swipes.
-Akh Morn is a multi-hit cleave on tank—stack to share.
st.d:
-Move out for Earth Breath cones.
-Handle wing glows properly and don’t get pushed off by Tidal Wave.
st.h:
-Shield before Hellfire and Tidal Wave.
-Top off party after Earth Breath and Akh Morn.
st.t:
-Mitigate Akh Morn and face boss away.
-Position correctly for wing mechanics and knockback safety.

st.g:
-Hakkinryu and Ginryu spawn—kill quickly.
-Avoid proximity spawns by moving away from drop points.
-Players get tethered by Burning Chains—run apart to break.
-Breakthrough event: all players must press buttons to fill gauge.
st.d:
-Avoid spawn zones and focus down adds fast.
-Break tethers quickly and prep for Phase 3 shift.
st.h:
-Spot heal players who fail to dodge spawn damage.
-Stay mobile to avoid AoEs while healing.
st.t:
-Grab aggro on both adds and tank separately.
-Mitigate add cleaves and help maintain boss position.

st.g:
-More Aether types appear: Diamond Dust (freeze—stand still), Aerial Blast (stay near center), Judgment Bolt (avoid puddles).
-Tail Slam: tiles marked—destroy tail if vulnerable.
-Spikecycle: alternating lines across platform—find safe gaps.
-Line Charge: wide AoE charge—dodge or Sprint.
-Akh Morn returns, now heavier.
-Ending with Imperial Summons + heavy raid damage.
st.d:
-Break tethers and avoid puddles as required.
-Destroy tail and find safe tiles. Watch for charge paths.
st.h:
-Shield before Judgment Bolt and Akh Morn.
-Cleanse or rescue frozen players. Heal through final damage burst.
st.t:
-Handle stronger Akh Morn stacks and assist with tail.
-Tank tail if alive; face boss carefully for charge and wings.

st.g:
-If the boss raises his arm (100-tonze Swing), run out of melee range to avoid knockback/vuln up. If he stands up, stand inside his hitbox (safe zone).
-He occasionally targets a random player for Liquid Carapace, chasing them while vomiting lava; kite away from group.
-Avoid random Volcanic Debris falling from ceiling.
st.d:
-Stay behind boss to dodge cleaves; follow targeted player during Carapace to avoid overlaps.
-Kill adds if they appear to minimize splash zones.
st.h:
-Shield before major sweeps and carapace phases.
-Heal through lava damage and after Carapace finish.
st.t:
-Face boss away; reposition after arm-raise to bait swings safety.
-Keep moving boss centrally during Carapace to avoid pushing into walls.

st.g:
-Whipping Wittret tankbuster has no cast bar—keep boss facing away. Prompts like “The wind begins to howl” precede wide AoEs.
-Tsumuji-kaze adds spawn whirlwinds and wind orbs; paired with tornado tether dashes that track lines. Reaper’s Gale proximity follows.
st.d:
-Stay close or far (safe spots) during 'howl' donut. Spread for Patient Blade line.
-Stack post-tornado if near final cluster then dodge Reaper’s Gale edge drop.
st.h:
-Be ready for untelegraphed cleave; heal through whirlwind pierce hits.
-Heal after add bursts and Reaper's proximity damage.
st.t:
-Face boss away constantly to avoid tankbuster hitting party.
-Grab adds early; keep group clear of tornado paths.

st.g:
-Sinister Tide: arrow-marked tiles and blue orb track—predict its path to avoid hit and Vulnerability Up.
-Genbu casts untelegraphed Caduceus (tankbuster) and Hell of Water cross-AoE plus Hell of Waste markers.
-Then summons Chelonian Gate shield; if focus gauge fills before kill, Divine Cataract wipes.
st.d:
-Avoid Sinister orb paths; move out of marked tiles.
-Stay clear of marker drops; avoid cross bloom zones during Hell of Water.
st.h:
-Alternate heal through tankbuster and purge Vuln stacks.
-Prepare raid heal before Gate and wipe if gauge reaches full.
st.t:
-Use cooldown on Caduceus; face boss away.
-Pick up adds around Gate and help collapse it quickly.

st.g:
-Storm Pulse: raid-wide damage, no escape.
-Heavenly Strike: heavy tankbuster—mitigate.
-State of Shock: player grabbed and slammed; others stack at marker twice; AoEs back-to-back.
-Sweep of the Leg: 270° cleave right after shock—safe only behind boss.
-Unrelenting Anguish: red orbs swirl outward—dodge constantly.
-Fire & Lightning: column AoE from boss or edge—move fast to avoid.
-Hakutei appears at end of phase.
st.d:
-Stack at markers promptly for State of Shock.
-Move behind boss immediately for Sweep of the Leg.
st.h:
-Shield before Heavenly Strike and shock slams.
-Spread for State of Shock soak and heal through Fire & Lightning overlap.
st.t:
-Use cooldown for Heavenly Strike.
-Keep off-tank ready for second slam; face boss away to protect group.

st.g:
-Hakutei spawns—tanked off-tank and tank face away.
-Aramata puddles drop—marked players should place them at edge.
-White Herald: tank slammed at spread marker; others must spread.
-Fire & Lightning follows systematically.
-Roar of Thunder: massive AoE; damage depends on Hakutei’s remaining HP.
-After roar, players fall into Free-Fall phase.
st.d:
-Move puddles to edge quickly.
-Avoid cluster after Herald; don’t delay Fire & Lightning dodge.
st.h:
-Shield spread for Herald slam.
-Top off party before Roar based on Tiger’s HP.
st.t:
-Tank flip for Herald; FTK off-tank handles cleave.
-Keep Hakutei angled away from group and near edge.

st.g:
-Players fall through air with no actions possible.
-Avoid spark orbs, line AoEs, and center donut markers while falling.
-Touching outer ring kills instantly.
-After landing, survivors get hit with Fell Swoop—instant raidwide.
st.d: -Look down and move to clear zones to survive the fall.
st.h: -Cannot heal—survival depends on movement during fall.
st.t: -Position yourself near safe zones when landing; prepare for Fell Swoop.

st.g:
-Hundredfold Havoc fires twin sets of arrow-guided circle AoEs—dodge second wave mid-pattern.
-Bombogenesis: orange markers drop—spread markers apart.
-Distant Clap: wide donut AoE with safe space under boss.
-Fight loops previous mechanics until death or enrage.
st.d:
-Wait for first Havoc wave then move into safe space.
-Spread for Bombogenesis; avoid overlapping markers.
st.h:
-Shield before Havoc; mitigate Bomb overlaps.
-Raid heal before Distant Clap and after loops.
st.t:
-Face boss away and reposition behind him during Havoc.
-Stay under him safely through Distant Clap.

446.g:
-Players are pulled toward open train doors—run away to avoid being sucked in.
-Ghosts must be defeated in cabooses; interact with shackles to enter.
-Stack for AoEs like Diabolic Whistle; spread for Doom Strike tethers.
-Stay off train tracks during Head-On/Diabolic Head to avoid instant KO.
-When a ghost per-player spawns, take one and kill it in the place you're teleported to.'
446.d:
-Assign ghost-duty pairs early to minimize delay during shackle phase.
-Avoid track AoEs and be ready to reposition quickly after door pull.
446.h:
-Prepare for spike AoE healing after ghost phase.
-Use movement tools to avoid door suction without dropping healing uptime.
446.t:
-Main tank: face train away from party during frontal attacks.
-Off-tank: handle ghost cars if assigned; help intercept Doom Strike tethers.

447.g:
-Boss alternates between painting forms (Demonio and Madonna); each has unique mechanics.
-During painting casts, avoid marked tiles or get in safe zones based on art cues.
-Cleanse “Haunting” by entering light puddles before timer expires.
-Avoid AoEs while baiting paintings during Madonna form.
447.d:
-Don’t tunnel: painting casts need fast reaction to floor markers.
-Move early to bait paintings safely away from group.
447.h:
-Expect raidwide damage during transitions and Haunting overlaps.
-Time cleanses during light puddles while maintaining awareness of AoEs.
447.t:
-Main tank: reposition after each painting shift to stabilize boss facing.
-Off-tank: be ready to grab extra spawns during Demonio phase if adds appear.

448.g:
-Boss loads one of four programs (Delta, Sigma, Omega, Proto); each alters mechanics.
-During Program Omega, bait missile and divebombs away from party.
-Magitek Bits fire lasers down lanes—get between them or hug safe corners.
-Limit Cut assigns numbers; players must take tethers in order.
448.d:
-Program mechanics require fast repositioning—memorize safe spots for each.
-If targeted during Limit Cut, count your number and intercept your tether alone.
448.h:
-Expect high damage during Program Omega and Limit Cut.
-Shield preemptively before phase transitions to avoid scramble healing.
448.t:
-Main tank: watch for forced tank swaps during certain programs.
-Off-tank: take your correct tether during Limit Cut; avoid overlapping charges.

449.g:
-Hyper Drive is a single-target tankbuster.
-Blizzard Blitz can be donut or point-blank; move in/out accordingly.
-Flagrant Fire: spread from others when marked; initially overlaps with Thrumming Thunder.
-Thrumming Thunder: avoid straight-line AoEs.
-Timely Teleport: after teleport, move behind his new position; if no immediate frontal AoE, get in front to avoid Aero Assault knockback.
-Ultima Upsurge: unavoidable raidwide AoE.
-Trick versions of mechanics require the opposite movement - watch for question marks around Kefka.
-Statue of the Gods adds tower-wide mechanics:
-Dark purple orb's side half-arena blats.
-Bright orb knockbacks, run up to it to not get knocked off.
-Large orb to the side of the statue blasts that side's half of the arena.
-Gaze attacks (purple eye) face away from the tower, trick gaze is yellow with question mark and requires you to look at the tower.
449.d:
-During Flagrant Fire + Thrumming Thunder, move to safe lane while keeping distance from others.
-Remember trick versions require opposite actions—react quickly.
-When Statue’s bright orb appears, move close and angle to avoid knockback over the edge.
449.h:
-Prepare for overlap damage from Flagrant Fire and Thrumming Thunder.
-Heavy AoE phases (Ultima Upsurge, Hyper Drive follow-ups) require pre-shielding.
-Watch for Statue orb knockbacks and ress players who fell.
449.t:
-Use mitigation for Hyper Drive; keep boss centered for predictable mechanic resolution.
-Position to avoid Blizzard Blitz knockbacks and tower orb blasts.
-Turn Kefka away from party when appropriate; keep an eye on Statue mechanics to avoid sudden deaths.

464.g: -Uses Clout of the Tengu (raid-wide), Yama-kagura (targeted line), and spawn Tengu Embers that spiral and explode later. Gaze Wile of the Tengu inflicts Hysteria if looked at; Might of the Tengu is a heavy tankbuster.
464.d:
-Spread to avoid ember explosions. Dodge line AoEs and look away during gaze.
-Minimize downtime between attacks.
464.h:
-Shield before Clout and embers. Heal through ember explosion overlaps.
-Be ready to cleanse Hysteria if triggered.
464.t: -Face Otengu away. Mitigate tankbuster and maintain spacing from embers.

465.g: -Raises his left or right arm then slams it (Vulnerability Up). Uses overlapping cone, circle or burst AoEs, and spawns a growing lake (Mythmaker) that blocks movement and causes a knock-off if stood in too long.
465.d: -Watch which arm he raises and dodge accordingly. Spread for individual AoEs. Avoid the lake during Mythmaker.
465.h: -Heal raid through AoE overlaps. Be ready for add explosion damage after Mythmaker.
465.t: -Stay near safe side of the arena. Help move team out of growing lake and avoid side slams.

466.g: -Arena edge applies Bleed + Vulnerability Up if touched. Uses The Short End (tankbuster), Both Ends (point-blank or donut AoE based on staff), Mount Huaguo (raid-wide), Monkey Magicks add phase leading to Second Heaven, clone Splitting Hairs with adds, Long End tethers, and stack markers (Five-Fingered Punishment).
466.d: -Avoid edge. Dodge Both Ends correctly (staff form dictates safe zone). Spread or stack as required. Help burn adds quickly to delay Second Heaven.
466.h: -Shield raid before Mount Huaguo and Second Heaven. Heal clones extra if splitting occurs. Support tethered and stack targets.
466.t: -Face boss away. Use cooldown for Short End. During add phases, hold aggro on Sage adds. During Splitting Hairs, control tethered line mechanics safely.

st.g:
-Torment Unto Death: untelegraphed tankbuster cone—tank must face boss away from party.
-Zashiki-Asobi: fans explode in spawn order—stand near last fan, then move center.
-Nightfall: weapon-based—gun = stack, spear = spread.
-Reprimand: moderate raidwide.
-Midnight Haze: kill tethered adds before they collide.
-Lead of the Underworld: stack line marker—stack with target or intercept tether.
st.d:
-Adjust position based on Nightfall weapon.
-Move safely during Zashiki-Asobi and break tethers quickly.
st.h:
-Shield before Reprimand.
-Watch for party damage after tethers or fan explosions.
st.t:
-Face boss away for tankbuster.
-Intercept Lead tethers and reposition between mechanics.

st.g:
-Nightbloom starts add phase—deals raidwide and stuns.
-Suffering gauge rises as adds live—wipe at 100%.
-Waves of Specters spawn; kill quickly.
-Zenos Specter causes knockback and AoEs—deal with safely.
st.d:
-Focus DPS on adds to prevent gauge filling.
-Avoid knockback paths when Zenos spawns.
st.h:
-Heal through Nightbloom and add phase hits.
-Top off after stuns or knockbacks.
st.t:
-Grab aggro on incoming adds.
-Move Zenos add away from group if needed.

st.g:
-Selenomancy: standing in light/dark builds stacks—switch sides before 5.
-Orbs drop donut AoEs—watch your footing.
-Antitwilight/Perilune: raidwide—stand on meteor safe zone.
-Dance of the Dead: heavy raidwide damage.
-Lunacy: stack marker that hits multiple times.
-Dark/Bright Blade: cone AoEs left or right—adjust based on moon phase.
st.d:
-Switch sides during Selenomancy.
-Stack for Lunacy, avoid Blade cones.
st.h:
-Heal during Selenomancy and after Dance of the Dead.
-Shield before Lunacy and moon blade attacks.
st.t:
-Position boss to avoid cleaving group during blades.
-Manage tank mitigation during stack hits.

485.g:
-Elements change mid-fight: Wind pushes, Earth pulls—position to avoid falling.
-Chaotic Storm spawns expanding AoEs—rotate around the boss.
-Tethered players must intercept beams or orbs safely.
-Later phases combine mechanics rapidly—memorize safe responses.
485.d:
-Maintain uptime during rotating AoEs by hugging boss hitbox.
-Move early during elemental casts to compensate for knockback or pull.
485.h:
-Earth/Wind phase deals heavy raid damage with knockback—pre-shield.
-Watch tethered targets for beam damage and be ready to top off after hits.
485.t: -Main tank: rotate the boss cleanly to give melee space during AoEs.

501.g:
-Ambient Aether combos define safe positioning: Coil+Coil = get out; Coil+Flip = get in; Flip+Flip = plus (go diagonals); Flip+Coil = X (go cardinals)
-Earth Shaker and Thunderstorm will overlap after Aether: spread from Earth Shaker and avoid overlapping circles during Thunderstorm
-Cauterize + Scarlet Thread or Horrid Roar combos require stack bait then reposition to dodge dive-bombs and lines
-Northern Cross applies Thin Ice then Ambient Aether combos while sliding: pre-form safe circle near boss and slide accordingly
501.d:
-Assign cardinal/diagonal positions before combos; move immediately after second spin/flip to correct spot
-When Blizzard markers appear, run to edge corners to drop puddles early and avoid clogging arena
501.h:
-Prep raid shields ahead of Thunderstorm + Cauterize overlaps and Horrid Roar stacks
-During Akh Rhai + Exaflare + Blizzard, stagger heals and move ice-marked players to drop puddles away from group
501.t: -Make sure Ancient Dragon is faced away from the group.

st.g:
-Spread during Ballistic Impact while weaving between Flame Thrower cones.
-Use 'Larboard = left' and watch for boss spin before second Wave Cannon.
-Use Omega Jammer on Rocket Punches.
st.d:
-Memorize cone gaps for Flame Thrower; plan Ballistic Impact spacing early.
-Move opposite side immediately after Wave Cannon spin to stay safe.
st.h:
-Shield preemptively before Ballistic + Flame Thrower overlaps.
-Prepare AoE heals for raid damage from Atomic Ray and mispositioned players.
st.t:
-Ensure no other players are within the small radius during Mustard Bomb.
-Face Omega consistently to make Wave Cannon easier to read.

st.g:
-Stand in your circle during Executable #1 to cleanse Looper.
-Executable #2: run out for point-blank, then in for donut AoE; cleanse inside circles.
st.d:
-Find and stand in your beam circle quickly—failure causes raidwide penalty.
-Time your movement to avoid AoEs and still reach your cleanse spot.
st.h:
-Stagger heals during AoEs and post-cleanse damage.
-Monitor health during Looper phase closely—late cleanses can result in deaths.
st.t:
-Avoid unnecessary movement that could confuse circle assignments.
-Stay alert to quickly reposition for Executable mechanics.

st.g:
-Use Omega Jammer on Conductive Focus to charge shield to 100%.
-Failure to do so before Delta Attack finishes casting results in wipe.
st.d:
-Target the Focus immediately and use Jammer—delay risks party wipe.
-Don’t Jammer too close to others or risk overlapping AoE.
st.h:
-Top off HP before Delta Attack cast resolves.
-Spot heal anyone late to shield or hit by Jammer overlap.
st.t:
-Use Jammer promptly and avoid overlapping others.
-Reposition for follow-up mechanics after shield completes.

st.g:
-Electric Slide: all players must stack on marker to avoid lethal dive.
-Mustard Bomb tether targets a random player—move away before detonation.
-Rocket Punches and charging fists can appear together—watch both edges.
st.d:
-Stack quickly for Electric Slide—being late risks party wipe.
-Keep peripheral awareness high as multiple mechanics overlap.
st.h:
-Heavy healing needed after Electric Slide and Atomic Ray.
-Watch for paralysis debuff if Mustard Bomb tether goes off in group.
st.t:
-Move away from the group if tethered with Mustard Bomb.
-Reorient boss as needed between overlapping mechanics.

st.g:
-Solar Ray is a cleaving tankbuster—non-tanks must stay away from the main tank.
-Program Alpha: spread for circles, then stack; reposition to avoid Efficient Bladework point-blank AoE.
-Subject Simulation transforms into Omega-F and triggers a knockback; stay close to avoid falling.
st.d:
-Spread early and adjust during stack to dodge Efficient Bladework.
-Know the knockback timing after transformation—hug boss before it triggers.
st.h:
-Pre-shield Program Alpha and raidwide knockback (Discharger).
-Top off tank early during Solar Ray combo to prevent overlap deaths.
st.t:
-Face Omega consistently to stabilize Wave mechanics.
-Move away from group during Solar Ray to avoid cleaving others.

st.g:
-Fire III targets four players with AoEs; Blizzard III creates a cross pattern—both resolve at once.
-Synthetic Blades splits the arena; spread Fire III circles in narrow safe zone between blade AoEs.
-Subject Simulation transforms into Omega-M—move far away to avoid Bladework AoE.
st.d:
-Stay out of marked players’ circles while dodging Blizzard III cross.
-Use edge movement during blades to fit all spreads within safe center.
st.h:
-Laser Shower is frequent and unavoidable—keep party topped.
-Be ready for high damage during overlap of Fire/Blizzard and blades.
st.t:
-Stay aware of Synthetic Blades orientation to avoid baiting cleaves into party.
-Ensure boss is centered to maintain clear safe zones.

st.g:
-Program Alpha gains donut AoE (Beyond Strength); stack in center after spreads.
-Follow-up Bladework hits center after stack; move out immediately.
-Synthetic Shield means mechanics are reused but stacked in tighter timings.
st.d:
-After circle spreads, head to center for stack and dodge donut.
-Move instantly outward after stack to dodge Bladework.
st.h:
-Shield and AoE heal through Program Alpha combo.
-Anticipate rapid center-outside movement and position for post-stack heals.
st.t:
-Position boss for quick reaction between Beyond Strength and Bladework.
-Avoid keeping boss too close to edge—limits group movement space.

st.g:
-One player gets AoE, another a stack marker—both move far apart.
-Omega-M will Bladework at puddle location; Omega-F uses knockback.
-Position close to Omega-F to survive knockback and avoid Omega-M AoE.
st.d:
-If marked with AoE, move away from group to your puddle spot.
-Anticipate reappearance location and move to safe position fast.
st.h:
-Stack heals after puddle split; anticipate damage from Bladework or fall-offs.
-Keep knockback mitigation ready if positioning is late.
st.t:
-Identify reappearance spots; prepare to pick up your assigned Omega form.
-Move quickly to correct spawn without pulling boss over puddles.

st.g:
-Omega-M shields Omega-F; players must destroy M before F casts Laser Shower.
-Once Omega-M dies, damage F quickly to prevent wipe.
st.d:
-Use full burst on Omega-M as soon as he spawns.
-Cleave avoidance matters—don’t stand near the center during Bladework.
st.h:
-Prep raid cooldowns before Laser Shower cast.
-Top off raid after Discharger and prep for post-M death rush on F.
st.t:
-Grab Omega-M immediately; keep it away from group during tankbuster.
-Reposition Omega-F quickly after M dies to prevent Resonance.

st.g:
-Firewall splits party—each player can only damage M or F.
-Tank each boss separately to prevent Resonance (damage buff).
-Mechanics from both bosses occur in tandem; learn to track and dodge both.
st.d:
-Identify your debuff and focus the correct Omega.
-Avoid Meteor proximity zones; move to center if not a tank.
st.h:
-Expect high sustained raid damage from Laser Shower, Meteor, and Cosmo Memory.
-Time cooldowns around Cosmo Memory and Meteor casts.
st.t:
-Each tank must pick up the Omega form they can damage.
-Keep bosses apart after Cosmo Memory to prevent Resonance stacks.

st.g:
-Limit Breaks begin: Meteor (proximity), Sagittarius Arrow (line AoE), Blade Dance (tankbuster).
-Both bosses repeat previous mechanics in tighter combos.
-When one boss dies, the other begins spamming Laser Shower until defeat.
st.d:
-During Meteor, move to center if not a tank.
-Dodge Arrow’s line AoE and avoid standing in front of Omega-M.
st.h:
-Prepare mitigation layers for Blade Dance and Meteor overlap.
-Handle prolonged Laser Shower spam after one form dies.
st.t:
-Separate bosses to reduce raidwide damage.
-Stay away from group during Meteor; coordinate with co-tank to split bosses cleanly.

503.g:
-Kill Scarlet Lady adds quickly—they tether to DPS and apply fire DoT; if left, they revive and wipe via Ashes to Ashes. Stack and AOE them down together. 
-Screams of the Damned: unavoidable raidwide. 
-Screams repeats post-mechanical sequences. 
-Phoenix Down: flaming plumes appear in set pattern; kill small plumes first, then central to create safe zone. 
-Eternal Flame phase: absorb orbs by facing arrow marks; failure increases Scarlet Fever damage. 
-In final arena: avoid falling off edges or through centre hole. Mechanics include Southron Star (raidwide), Mesmerizing Melody or Ruthless Refrain (pull or knockback), Well of Flame + Rekindle (spread marker and dodge), Phantom Flurry (tankbuster + knockback), and Phoenix Pattern: track runes to avoid exploding quadrants. 
-Mechanics repeat until Suzaku is defeated.
503.d:
-ON Scarlet Lady spawn, spread and burn quickly to prevent explosive revival. 
-Absorb orbs correctly during Eternal Flame; avoid platform edges in final phase.
503.h:
-Shield before Screams and Scarlet Fever. Top off after Scarlet Lady bursts and during Mesmerizing Melody pulls. 
-Heal through Well of Flame overlaps and tether markers.
503.t:
-Use cooldowns on Cremate (tankbuster). Face boss away, rotate swiftly after Phantom Flurry to avoid edge knockback. 
-Help AOE down Scarlet Ladies swiftly.

536.g:
-Rake is a tankbuster.
-Lumen Infinitum is a frontal line AoE with no marker—stay away from boss’ face.
-Cyclone Wing is a raidwide AoE.
-Typhoon Wing spawns green orbs firing triangular AoEs; later adds puddles too—dodge both.
536.d:
-Never stand in front of boss during Lumen Infinitum.
-Move carefully to dodge orbs and puddles in later Typhoon Wing.
536.h:
-Prepare raid heals after Cyclone Wing.
-Tank damage spikes on Rake—anticipate follow-up auto-attacks.
536.t:
-Face boss away from group for Lumen Infinitum.
-Mitigation for Rake; keep boss centered to manage Typhoon Wing orbs.

st.g:
-Sacrament of Penance is a raidwide AoE.
-Catechism is a tankbuster.
-Judgement Day spawns two meteor puddles—at least one player must soak each.
-Exegesis maps glowing faces to the arena—stand on tiles without faces.
-Donut AoEs (Shiny Orbs) overlap with Exegesis—often corners with 2 orbs are safe.
st.d:
-Help soak meteor puddles if needed.
-Quickly identify safe square during Exegesis while avoiding donut AoEs.
st.h:
-Anticipate heavy raid damage during Judgement Day + Exegesis overlap.
-Top tanks quickly after Catechism.
st.t:
-Keep boss centered for clear Exegesis orientation.
-Swap tank duties as needed for Catechism.

st.g:
-Orison Fortissimo is raidwide AoE.
-Sacrament Sforzando is a tankbuster.
-Divine Diminuendo: normal = circle AoE; glowing = two extra ring AoEs, safe near edge of first circle.
-Conviction Marcato: normal = frontal line; glowing = extra lines forming X-shape, safe at cardinals (not front).
-Clones phase: boss and 4 clones cast AoEs—safe near glowing-ring clone for Diminuendo, then avoid X-shape during Marcato.
-Solitaire Ring spawns on 6 columns—stand on last one to spawn, then move before it fires.
st.d:
-Adjust to glowing variations—hug edge of circle or stand at safe cardinal.
-During clones, move quickly to glowing clone’s safe spot.
-Sprint to last column for Solitaire Ring to dodge line AoEs.
st.h:
-Heal frequently through raidwide AoEs and clone overlaps.
-Sustain tanks through Sforzando + add auto-attacks during clone phase.
st.t:
-Face boss away from party for Marcato line.
-Manage positioning during clone phase to keep AoE lanes clear.

st.g:
-Fifth Element: raid-wide damage.
-Infirm Soul: tankbuster.
-Onmyo Sigil: boss teleport + AoE—Yin-yang = move out, serpent ring = stay close.
-Serpent Descending: 4 players get circle markers—spread to avoid overlap.
-Kuji-kiri: grid of line AoEs—stand in gaps.
-After those, boss summons Wheel Shiki adds and transitions to Phase 2 (Strength of Spirit cast if adds remain).
st.d:
-Watch sigils: stay away for Yin-yang, close for serpent ring.
-Spread out for Serpent Descending, dodging Kuji-kiri lines.
st.h:
-Pre-shield before Fifth Element and Infirm Soul.
-Stack heals for Serpent Descending markers.
st.t:
-Use cooldowns for tankbuster.
-Face boss away to control AoE facing.

st.g:
-Wheel Shiki: includes Ao-no-shiki (stack) and Aka-no-shiki (knockback)—tethered DPS should bait them toward edge.
-Iwa-no-shiki add circles, then tethers leading to cones—aim cones away from raid.
-Ten-no-shiki: line AoEs across arena.
-Head Shiki: Doro and Numa heads explode on death. Stagger kills.
-Strength of Spirit: triggers if Head Shiki gauge finishes; leads to Dragon’s Wake and transition.
st.d:
-Assign Ao-no-shiki stack, steer red wheels safely out, dodge Iwa and Ten-no-shiki strikes.
-Stagger Head Shiki kills to reduce healer burst.
st.h:
-Heal through explosions and stagger deaths for recovery time.
-Use long-duration shields before Strength of Spirit.
st.t:
-Grab and tank Wheel Shiki and Head Shiki.
-Position tethered units away from raid.

st.g:
-Arena floods then shrinks island; avoid water to keep from drowning.
-Summon Shiki appears repeatedly: Blue Orochi (Coursing River), Yama-no-shiki, and others from Phase 2 in dual sets.
-Coursing River: snakes run across—stand near them to get pushed inward.
-Forbidden Arts: two-hit stack marker.
-Yama-no-shiki slams platform—watch arm signals, avoid red center zone.
-Force of Nature: explosive AoE at center; stand just outside.
-Serpent Ascending: 4 meteor circles appear—stand in each or take heavy damage and Damage Down stacks.
st.d:
-Stack quickly for Forbidden Arts.
-Ride Coursing River pushes inward; dodge Serpent Ascending zones.
st.h:
-Shield before Forbidden Arts and river damage.
-Heal spread for ascension circle hits.
st.t:
-Face boss for Shiki mechanics.
-Absorb serpent circle hits if need be and maintain raid positioning.

859.en: The Confessional of Toupasa the Elder

553.en: The Confessional of Toupasa the Elder

569.g:
-Clanging Blow is a tankbuster.
-Forceful Impact is alliance-wide AoE.
-Energy Bombardment targets 8 players with circles—spread.
-Energy Assault fires a massive lingering cone toward a random player.
-Energy Ring: circle AoE then expanding rings.
-Sidestriking Spin and Centrifugal Spin: rectangular AoEs from sides or center—safe in opposite axis.
-Systematic mechanics add hazards: Siege = edge orbs, Targeting = player lasers, Airstrike = aerial bombs, Suppression = half-arena lasers.
-Shockwave = raidwide knockback.
569.d:
-Spread promptly during Bombardment and keep moving for Airstrike.
-Watch cone and spin AoEs—stand in safe axis.
-Avoid edge during Shockwave knockback.
569.h:
-Raidwides (Forceful Impact, Shockwave) require AoE healing.
-Heal players clipped by overlapping Bombardment + Airstrike.
569.t:
-Use mitigation for Clanging Blow.
-Face boss carefully to predict Energy Assault cone.
-Keep boss central to manage add mechanics.

570.g:
-Alliance A: heads arc lightning below.
-Alliance B: conveyor belts push players toward edge (death).
-Alliance C: vents spray oil then arena erupts, oil debuff makes fire lethal.
-Left Arm drops container (cross AoE) and spawns tethered adds that self-destruct.
-Right Arm rotates, firing small cones and ring AoEs.
-Nozzles create lingering fire lines.
-Hobbes’ attacks: Laser-Resistance Test (multi raid AoEs), Ring Laser (safe center or pre-hit areas), Laser Sight (line stack per alliance), Short-Range Missile (circle AoEs per player).
570.d:
-Respect platform hazards (heads, belts, vents).
-Help soak stacks and move out with missile markers.
-Move with belts carefully to not slide into edge.
570.h:
-Multiple raid AoEs in succession during Laser-Resistance Test—layer cooldowns.
-Extra healing needed for oil debuff victims and missile overlaps.
570.t:
-Tanks can intercept all self-destruct tethers with invuln; otherwise split.
-Keep boss centered despite platform hazards.
-Mitigation for Catechism-type tankbusters.

571.g:
-Multiple enemies spawn with overlapping AoEs.
-Dodge combined cleaves and line attacks.
-Adds must die quickly before mechanics overwhelm.
571.d:
-Prioritize DPS on adds.
-Stay spread to avoid stacking overlapping AoEs.
571.h:
-Prepare for raidwide damage during multi-add AoEs.
-Sustain tanks handling multiple targets.
571.t:
-Pick up and separate adds quickly.
-Face them away from the raid to control cleaves.

st.g:
-Marx Smash covers platform sides depending on arm position.
-Raises one arm -> move away from that side.
-Both arms high -> stand in center.
-Both arms low -> go east or west.
-Precision Guided Missile: each alliance tank targeted—spread.
-Incendiary Bombing leaves napalm puddles.
-Guided Missile chases targeted players—kite away.
-Diffuse Laser = raidwide.
-Energy Barrage spawns 14 circles—leave center, then soak after laser.
-Adds phase: 3 Reverse-jointed Goliaths, 1 per alliance.
-Phase 2: hang around center to avoid arms, then get forced north by napalm.
When done, run to the back or die to Engels destroying the platform.
st.d:
-Move out from napalm puddles immediately.
-Spread when targeted by chase missile; don’t overlap.
-Help soak AoE circles after Barrage laser resolves.
st.h:
-Top tanks during triple tankbuster.
-Prepare heavy heals for Diffuse Laser + Marx Crush overlaps.
-Raid healing spikes during multi-mechanic Area Bombardment.
st.t:
-Spread tanks for Precision Guided Missile.
-Pick up and hold Goliath adds away from others.
-Move Engels’ target zones away from raid to leave space for safe lanes.

st.g:
-Neutralization is tankbuster.
-Laser Turret: line laser on target.
-Fore/Dual cannons: hind = stand to the side, flank = stand front or back.
-Laser Saturation = raidwide.
-Ballistic Impact: 6 players marked with circles.
-Engage Marx Support: Engels’ arms slam large quarters, move away.
-Undock: 9S goes aerial, Bombing Run sweeps arena thirds; follow 2P for safe edge.
-Anti-personnel Missiles light tiles in patterns that you then need to avoid. Good luck.
-Engage Goliath Tank Support: 2 tanks spawn, keep them faced away from the alliance.
-Hack Goliath Tank: one explodes huge AoE (hide behind other), then smaller second blast.
-Total Annihilation: kill adds, then stand in 2P's shield.
st.d:
-Avoid cannon cones by memorizing safe sides.
-For bombing run, follow 2P’s position.
-Spread carefully when marked by Ballistic Impact.
-Dodge tile AoEs by recognizing pattern early.
st.h:
-Raid healing required for repeated Laser Saturations.
-Top players hit by Ballistic Impact or tank lasers.
-Prepare heavy AoE mitigation during Goliath explosions.
st.t:
-Mitigate Neutralization tankbuster.
-Face tank lasers away from alliance.
-Hold aggro on Service Models quickly during Total Annihilation.

924.en: The Shifting Oubliettes of Lyhe Ghiah

640.en: The Shifting Oubliettes of Lyhe Ghiah

st.g:
-Frontal cleave (Sweeping Gouge) and random player charges (Bloody Charge).
-Adds spawn if fight drags on.
st.d:
-Avoid standing in front of boss.
-Burn boss quickly to prevent adds.
st.h:
-Watch for tank damage spikes from cleave.
-Adds can split healing focus.
st.t:
-Keep boss faced away from group.
-Hold aggro on potential adds if fight runs long.

st.g:
-Summons adds periodically.
-Madison flees after taking enough damage.
st.d: -Focus Madison; ignore adds unless overwhelming.
st.h: -Healing load increases with active adds.
st.t: -Control adds to reduce pressure on group.

st.g:
-Now uses bombs and adds again.
-Bombs detonate with large AoEs; avoid them.
st.d:
-Prioritize boss but move out from bombs fast.
-Use AoE if adds pile up.
st.h:
-Be ready for burst damage when bombs explode.
-Heal through potential group-wide AoE if bombs go off.
st.t:
-Position boss away from bombs.
-Quickly regain control after add spawns.

st.g:
-Spawns bubbles that trap players.
-Bubbles must be destroyed to free trapped allies.
st.d:
-Target and destroy bubbles quickly.
-Position carefully to avoid unnecessary bubble spawns.
st.h:
-Trapped players take damage over time.
-Stay mobile to avoid being bubbled yourself.
st.t:
-Maintain aggro while helping break bubbles.
-Position boss away from bubble spawns to reduce clutter.

st.g:
-Boss becomes invulnerable periodically while cultists channel dark energy.
-If cultists are not interrupted quickly, boss is empowered and deals more damage.
st.d:
-Focus down cultists as soon as they spawn.
-Burn boss during vulnerable windows.
st.h:
-Damage spikes if cultists are ignored.
-Watch for AoE bursts after boss is empowered.
st.t:
-Pull adds toward boss for cleave/AoE efficiency.
-Interrupt cultists to prevent empowerment.

st.g:
-Throughout the dungeon, players must disable cultist orbs to unlock Galvanth’s chamber.
-Orbs are guarded and will summon waves of enemies.
st.d:
-Prioritize orb-guarding enemies.
-Save AoE for waves of adds if they spawn.
st.h:
-Prepare for moderate damage during add waves.
-Use cooldowns if overwhelmed.
st.t:
-Hold aggro on all spawned adds.
-Keep mobs away from orb activators where possible.

34.g:
-Boss is passive until activated by blasting device.
-Uses point-blank AoEs and cleaves.
-Adds may spawn from surrounding tunnels.
34.d:
-Avoid close-range AoEs.
-Quickly clear any adds that emerge from tunnels.
34.h:
-Prepare for moderate AoE damage bursts.
-Watch for stray adds attacking party.
34.t:
-Face boss away from group.
-Hold aggro on both boss and spawned adds.

40.g:
-Slime boss splits into smaller slimes when damaged.
-Slimes move to fuse if not killed quickly.
40.d:
-Focus slimes down fast before they can merge.
-Use AoE abilities after first split.
40.h:
-Damage increases if slimes merge—watch for unexpected spikes.
-Stay mobile to avoid being cornered by slimes.
40.t:
-Pull slimes together for AoE.
-Prevent merges by keeping slimes controlled and grouped.

41.g:
-Boss uses AoE swings and targeted attacks.
-Spawns adds and uses bombs that must be avoided.
41.d:
-Focus boss while avoiding bomb AoEs.
-Use AoE if overrun by adds.
41.h:
-Watch for high burst damage if bombs or adds aren't handled.
-Stay at range to avoid frontal swings.
41.t:
-Keep boss away from bombs and group.
-Grab aggro on spawned adds quickly.

st.g:
-Uses large frontal AoEs and rear cleaves.
-Poisons players periodically.
st.d:
-Avoid standing in front or behind boss.
-Cleanse poison puddles only if safe to do so.
st.h:
-Watch for poison debuffs and cleanse quickly.
-Prepare for spike damage after AoEs.
st.t:
-Keep boss facing away from party.
-Position to minimize cleave hazard zones.

st.g:
-Becomes invulnerable while cocooned and summons adds.
-Large AoEs and poison zones fill the arena over time.
st.d:
-Kill cocoon and adds quickly to resume damage on boss.
-Move early to avoid creeping poison zones.
st.h:
-Heavy damage during add waves and poison phase.
-Maintain mobility to avoid overlapping AoEs.
st.t:
-Tank adds away from party.
-Reposition boss to clear zones as space shrinks.

st.g:
-Slimes and traps appear throughout the dungeon.
-Slime puddles explode if left unchecked.
st.d:
-Kill slimes before they detonate.
-Avoid stepping in trap circles.
st.h:
-Damage spikes if slime explodes.
-Minor healing otherwise.
st.t:
-Pull slimes into safe zones.
-Keep aggro on surprise spawns near traps.

48.g:
-Uses large frontal cleaves and cone AoEs.
-Summons adds during the fight.
48.d:
-Avoid cleaves by staying behind the boss.
-Swap to adds quickly when they spawn.
48.h:
-Spikes possible during cleaves or if adds ignored.
-Keep party spread to avoid overlapping AoEs.
48.t:
-Face boss away from group.
-Grab adds immediately to prevent chaos.

54.g:
-Two mini-bosses fought simultaneously.
-Jester uses magic AoEs; Steward uses physical cleaves.
54.d:
-Focus one target to reduce incoming damage.
-Avoid standing between both bosses.
54.h:
-Unpredictable damage from two sources.
-Avoid stacking near AoEs to preserve space.
54.t:
-Hold both bosses’ aggro and face them apart.
-Keep them from overlapping to prevent AoE chaos.

55.g:
-Casts line AoEs, summons adds, and activates wall turrets.
-Becomes untargetable while turrets are active.
55.d:
-Burn turrets and adds to resume damage on boss.
-Dodge line AoEs from boss and walls.
55.h:
-High AoE pressure during turret and add phases.
-Position to avoid wall lasers while healing.
55.t:
-Gather adds quickly to avoid party disruption.
-Keep boss centered to control turret line-of-fire.

st.g:
-Kill Violet Back adds quickly before they overwhelm
-Avoid standing in front of the boss.
st.t:
-Hold boss steady, face away from party
-Be ready for poison, call for Esuna if needed
st.d:
-Focus Violet Back adds immediately
-Stay behind or to the side of boss
st.h:
-Cleanse poison from tank with Esuna
-Heal through incidental AoE from adds

st.g:
-Avoid frontal cone AoEs
-Kill Tempest Biast quickly when it appears to save Brayflox.
st.t:
-Keep Drake faced away from group
-Pick up Tempest Biast quickly
st.d:
-Burn down Tempest Biast first, then Inferno Drake
-Stay out of frontal cone AoEs
st.h:
-Spot heal Brayflox during Tempest Biast phase
-Cleanse and top off players clipped by cones

st.g:
-Break bubbles to free trapped allies quickly
-Avoid Peculiar Light AoE to prevent Magic Vulnerability Up
-DPS Aiatar when it arrives until it flees
st.t:
-Maintain aggro on Hellbender and later Aiatar
-Position away from group to reduce splash damage
st.d:
-Focus bubbles immediately when they appear
-Dodge Peculiar Light and switch to Aiatar when it spawns
st.h:
-Heal trapped players freed from bubbles
-Watch damage spikes on tank during Aiatar’s phase

st.g:
-Avoid expanding poison rock AoEs
-Move quickly to safe spots as rocks explode
-Dodge line AoE breath attacks
st.t:
-Face Aiatar away from the party
-Prepare for tankbusters, mitigate with cooldowns
st.d:
-Focus boss while dodging poison rocks
-Stay behind boss and move out of line AoEs
st.h:
-Cleanse poison with Esuna
-Be ready for large healing during rock explosions and tankbusters

st.g:
-Uses frontal AoEs and summons adds during the fight.
-Ice puddles may appear and linger.
st.d:
-Avoid front of boss and clear adds quickly.
-Don't stand in lingering ice puddles.
st.h:
-Ice puddles can stack damage unexpectedly.
-Monitor party for pressure during add phases.
st.t:
-Face boss away from party.
-Pick up adds fast to reduce healer stress.

st.g:
-Targets players with charge attacks and narrow line AoEs.
-May leap to random players.
st.d:
-Stay spread to avoid overlapping AoEs.
-Burn boss quickly to reduce leaps.
st.h:
-Charge/leap patterns can cause spike damage.
-Use oGCDs to top off after unexpected hits.
st.t:
-Keep boss under control and away from party.
-Watch for repositioning after charges.

st.g:
-Heavy ice-themed mechanics with line AoEs and frozen ground.
-Flight phase includes targeted ice breath and sweeping AoEs.
st.d:
-Avoid frozen ground and move early for breath markers.
-Spread out during aerial phase to limit AoE overlap.
st.h:
-Intense damage during flight and breath phases.
-Keep party topped off between AoEs.
st.t:
-Position boss center pre-flight for consistency.
-Move quickly after flight to regain control.

st.g:
-Avoid its frontal Magitek Ray; move to flank or rear.
-Periodically casts Incendiary Support and summons adds with Request Assistance.
st.d:
-Stay behind or to the sides and circle to avoid random cannon AoEs.
-Save AoE bursts for waves of adds.
st.h:
-Prepare for periodic raid-wide damage (Incendiary Support).
-Watch position to avoid stray cannon circles on PCs.
st.t:
-Face boss away from party.
-Pick up adds promptly when summoned.

st.g: -Casts Thermobaric Strike with corner markers; Hypercharge with safe ring; Overcharge frontal cone; Cermet Drill single-target; Targeted Support circle AoEs.
st.d:
-Move early to safe corner and ring for impenetrable Hypercharge.
-Avoid cone telegraph; DPS add if needed.
st.h:
-Burst heals after Thermobaric and Hypercharge phases.
-Be ready for Spike damage from Overcharge and Drill.
st.t:
-Position boss centrally and rotate to avoid corner hits.
-Use cooldowns before Drill and Overcharge.

st.g:
-Alternates between raid-wide Plasmas, Roundhouse plus Discharge, Infinite Reach with Discharges, Angry Salamander, Thermobaric + Stunning Sweep combos.
-Watch telegraphs and safe point timings for Roundhouse/Discharge interplay.
st.d:
-Dodge by timing entry/exit around inner and outer circle markers.
-Move through Discharge patterns during Infinite Reach phases.
st.h:
-Stack AoE heals at Plasmas and after sweeping combos.
-Follow movement cues to keep party in safe zones.
st.t:
-Face boss to minimize party exposure during Roundhouse.
-Shift positioning quickly after teleport or aoe patterns.

100.g:
-Escort through mobs, using Magitek transporter to transition.
-Avoid marked AoEs from the Colossus (conal cleave, circle lasers).
100.d:
-Use AoE skills during escort pulls.
-Dodge Prototype Laser markers quickly.
100.h:
-Spot‐heal the tank during pulls before engaging boss.
-Keep raid topped before Colossus adds/shockwaves.
100.t:
-Pull groups tightly for efficient escort.
-Keep boss faced away and use cooldowns on colossus cleaves.

101.g:
-Ceruleum Vent: unavoidable raidwide AoE.
-Prototype Laser Alpha: four circle AoEs radiate outward from center.
-Prototype Laser Beta: each player marked with circle AoE—spread out.
-Grand Sword: cone AoE on random player.
101.d:
-Spread during Prototype Laser Beta.
-Avoid cone AoE from Grand Sword.
-Dodge outward-moving circles.
101.h:
-Heal through Ceruleum Vent.
-Watch for spread damage from Prototype Laser Beta.
101.t: -Maintain aggro; face boss away to reduce cone cleave risk.

102.g:
-Arena edges apply Electrocution DoT—don’t get knocked into them.
-Spine Shatter: tankbuster.
-Iron Uprising: frontal cone with knockback.
-Activate: summons Magitek Death Claw tether—kill it before it reaches target.
-Augmented Shatter: stack marker, followed by Wheel of Suffering (circle AoE at Nero’s location). Stack then move out.
-Augmented Uprising: large cone AoE from arena edge—dodge.
-Augmented Suffering: knockback from center—stand near center to avoid electrical field.
102.d:
-Stack for Augmented Shatter, then move out of Wheel of Suffering.
-Kill Magitek Death Claw add fast.
-Stay near center during Augmented Suffering.
102.h:
-Mitigate Spine Shatter.
-Heal raid after unavoidable damage or failed mechanics.
-Cleanse and heal anyone clipped by Electrocution.
102.t:
-Keep Nero centered when possible.
-Face him away from group for Iron Uprising.
-Position to avoid knockback into walls.

103.g: -Patterns: X-lines (Terminus Est), stacks (Festina Lente), line AoEs (Ductus), phantoms → blade energy spike.
103.d:
-Stand between X markers on Terminus Est.
-Kill Phantom Gaiuses fast to reduce Veni Vidi Vici damage.
103.h:
-Stack quickly on Festina; raid heal after.
-Heavy heal/tank cooldowns ready for final burst.
103.t: -Main tank: Keep aggro, use defence cooldowns on Innocence.

104.g:
-Innocence: tankbuster.
-Horrida Bella: unavoidable raidwide.
-Terminus Est: flaming X telegraphs—move between them.
-Phantasmata: clones cast Terminus Est from arena edge—stand between telegraphs.
-Festina Lente: stack marker.
-Ductus: line AoEs travel length of arena—avoid.
-Hand of the Empire: each player targeted with AoE—spread.
-At 5% HP: summons 4 Phantom Gaius adds. Kill them quickly while he charges Blade Energy. If bar hits 100%, Veni Vidi Vici wipes raid.
-Heirsbane: Phantom adds hit random players with moderate damage.
-After surviving, Gaius spams stronger Horrida Bella until defeat.
104.d:
-Spread for Hand of the Empire.
-Stack for Festina Lente.
-Dodge Terminus Est and Ductus.
-Burn Phantom Gaius adds quickly before Blade Energy fills.
104.h:
-Heal through Horrida Bella.
-Prepare AoE heals during Phantasmata and Ductus overlap.
-Support raid during Phantom Gaius adds with high damage output.
104.t:
-Hold Gaius steady while group dodges line AoEs.
-Pick up Phantom adds immediately at 5% HP.

35.g:
-Casts Eruption (targeted AoEs), Vulcan Burst (knockback), Radiant Plume (outer or inner AoE), and Hellfire (raid-wide damage).
-Nails spawn before Hellfire—must be destroyed to prevent wipe.
35.d:
-Move out of Eruption and Radiant Plume zones quickly.
-Focus Nails as soon as they appear to prevent Hellfire wipe.
35.h:
-Top party after Vulcan Burst and prep big heals before Hellfire.
-Watch for random target damage from Eruption and Nail explosions.
35.t: -Keep Ifrit faced away from party to avoid cleave damage.

33.g:
-Arena is small but has a safe edge; Titan uses Landslide (line knockback), Weight of the Land (AoE circles), and Geocrush (proximity AoE).
-At 50%, Titan summons his Heart—must be destroyed before he casts Earthen Fury or the party wipes.
33.d:
-Dodge Landslide by sidestepping immediately.
-Focus Titan’s Heart when it appears to prevent a wipe.
33.h:
-Top up party before Geocrush and post-Earthen Fury.
