-AoE heal after Weight of the Land if multiple players are hit.
33.t:
-Tank Titan near center to keep AoEs manageable.
-Face him away from the group to avoid cleaves.

39.g:
-Uses Friction (line AoE), Slipstream (frontal cone stun), and Mistral Song (tankbuster).
-Spawns razor plumes and satin plumes—satin must be killed to interrupt Mistral Shriek.
Phase transition splits arena with stone pillars and adds.
39.d:
-Kill satin plume immediately to prevent raid-wide Shriek.
Avoid line AoEs and stay mobile during phase shifts.
39.h:
-Heavy damage if satin plume lives—prep big heals for Shriek.
Watch for split damage during add phase and line AoEs.
39.t:
-Tank Garuda near arena center, away from plumes.
Interrupt Slipstream when possible and mitigate Mistral Song.

st.g:
-Earthen Fury is Titan’s ultimate—heavy raidwide.
-Geocrush drops proximity AoE—run far, then dodge follow-up Landslide.
-Weight of the Land spawns alternating circles—keep moving.
-At 80%: Granite Interment traps all players, Hydaelyn intervenes to end phase.
st.d:
-Avoid circle AoEs quickly; don’t get clipped by Landslide.
-Keep uptime while dodging alternating floor AoEs.
st.h:
-Prepare raidwide heals for Earthen Fury.
-Be ready to heal after Granite Interment damage spike.
st.t:
-Face Ultima Weapon away from party for cleaves.
-Maintain position at wall to keep space clear.

st.g:
-Aerial Blast is Garuda’s ultimate—heavy raidwide.
-Eye of the Storm creates donut AoE—safe inside center.
-Mistral Shriek: Garuda moves to edge and blasts large point-blank—go opposite edge.
-At 55%: Ultima casts Vortex Barrier, Hydaelyn interrupts.
st.d:
-Stay center for Eye, move far from Garuda for Shriek.
-Keep DoTs and bursts rolling during shield downtime.
st.h:
-Top raid quickly after Aerial Blast.
-Watch for Shriek damage if players misposition.
st.t:
-Keep boss to wall, face away.
-Move quickly when Garuda relocates to edge.

st.g:
-Hellfire is Ifrit’s ultimate—heavy raidwide.
-Radiant Plume circle AoEs cover arena—dodge.
-Vulcan Burst knocks back—be ready to move center after.
-Follow-up Radiant Plume hits edges—safe at center.
-At 35%: Radiant Blaze covers arena, Hydaelyn interrupts and Ifrit is torn out.
st.d:
-Move center immediately after Vulcan Burst to avoid edge Plumes.
-Stay mobile to dodge random Radiant Plumes.
st.h:
-Strong AoE healing after Hellfire.
-Watch health after knockback + Plume combo.
st.t:
-Hold Ultima steady while Ifrit casts.
-Adjust positioning quickly after knockback.

764.g:
-Homing Lasers: single-target tank hit.
-Magitek Ray: 3 consecutive line AoEs.
-Homing Ray: all players get AoE markers—spread.
-Tank Purge: unavoidable heavy raid AoE.
-Aetheric Boom: knockback—use immunity if available.
-Aetheroplasm: tethered orbs—absorb before collision.
-Citadel Buster: frontal line laser—avoid in front.
-Magitek Bits: untargetable, fire line AoEs—watch facing.
-Explosion: proximity gunship crash—move center.
-At 30%: Ultima cast enrage—Hydaelyn fills LB; DPS must use Limit Break to end fight.
764.d:
-Spread for Homing Ray; avoid clustering.
-Move to edges between AoEs; drop uptime safely.
-Use LB at Ultima cast to secure kill.
764.h:
-Heal through Tank Purge and raidwides.
-Watch knockback victims and orb overlaps.
-Keep tank topped for Homing Lasers.
764.t:
-Mitigate Homing Lasers and Tank Purge.
-Face boss carefully to avoid Citadel Buster hitting raid.
-Position near center to manage Bits and Explosions.

st.g: -Uses Ice Guillotine (tank frontal cleave), Snow Drift (raid-wide damage + Frozen stacks), Cold Wave (puddle AoEs), and spawns Frost Bombs that explode if not killed. After ~33%, casts Tundra: permanent edge ring that adds Frozen stacks.
st.d:
-Kill Frost Bomb adds quickly to prevent Frozen debuff buildup. 
-Move continuously to dodge Snow Drift and avoid reaching 4 Frozen stacks.
st.h:
-Top up party before Snow Drift and Tundra phases; Frozen stuns leave players vulnerable to follow-up damage. 
-Heal through Cold Wave puddles proactively.
st.t:
-Face boss away from party for Ice Guillotine and subsequent puddles. 
-Keep boss slightly off-center to maximize movement space.

st.g: -Casts Buffet (frontal cone), Northerlies (boss breathes on snowballs), Frozen Mist turns nearby Spriggans into snowballs, Spin (circle → donut), Frostbound adds spawn, and Frozen Spike with player markers.
st.d:
-Stand behind boss for Buffet. 
-Attack snowballs to interrupt Northerlies instead of killing Spriggans.
st.h: -Shield/tank-heal after Northerlies or snowball hit; Frostbound adds increase raid pressure—AoE heal accordingly.
st.t:
-Turn boss into Spriggans before Frozen Mist to create snowballs; manage orientation during Spin. 
-Pull additional adds safely after snowball bursts.

st.g: -Alternates Ecliptic Bite and Heavensward Howl (tank-focused), casts Thousand-Year Storm (raid-wide), drops icicles then Lunar Cry (must hide behind correct one), and buffs remaining icicle each rotation.
st.d:
-Move to avoid icicle pre-casts, hide behind the **blue** icicle after its first Lunar Cry, then relocate post-detonation. 
-Stay off boss front for Howl/Bite.
st.h:
-Prepare burst heal for Thousand-Year Storm and update after Heavensward Howl. 
-Auto-adjust for Lunar Cry aftermath—icicle blast + status effects.
st.t:
-Face boss away for frontal attacks. 
-Guide boss position so ice patterns don’t trap the group.}

201.g:
-Drops ceruleum tanks via Resounding Screech; tank explosions are unavoidable but clear aux tanks quickly.
-Casts Heavy Swing (tankbuster) and line AoEs from Mark XLT cannon.
201.d:
-Move aux tanks away before tankbuster lands to save party HP.
-Dodge line AoEs by moving to the cleared sides of the room.
201.h:
-Heal through unavoidable tankbuster but avoid standing near exploding aux tanks.
-Keep party spread to dodge the line cannon cleaves.
201.t:
-Pick up boss and face away from party and aux tanks.
-Move aux tanks as far from group as possible to reduce explosion damage.

202.g: -Fires Flame Thrower cones and Carpet Bomb AoEs; summons adds periodically.
202.d:
-Leave flame cone early and continue DPS once clear.
-Priority-target adds as soon as they spawn.
202.h:
-Ranged flame causes steady but dodgeable damage; heal accordingly.
-Expect spike healing when adds overlap with AoEs.
202.t:
-Face boss to direct flame away from party.
-Aggro adds quickly so DPS/healer aren’t overwhelmed.

203.g:
-Multi-phase with inner/outer donuts, line cleaves, chiron dragon adds tethered to positioning.
-Utilize safe zones: center/donut edge shifts; tank positions dragons for tethered cleave debuffs.
203.d:
-Stand in middle ring, then edge as Antipathy expands.
-Kill Mirage Dragons quickly to reduce Animadversion damage.
203.h:
-Use AoE heals on donut and line phases.
-Stack on tank for Akh Morn targets and line cleave bursts.
203.t: -Tank tethered dragons at correct distance (first far, second close) to avoid their defensive buffs.

227.g:
-Casts Acid Rain dropping AoE circles and spawns Dravanian Hornets.
-Uses Sweet Scent to summon hornets, then Devour: pulls marked player and eats nearby adds, buffing itself. Then casts Spit.
227.d:
-Kill hornets quickly to prevent Devour buff.
-Mark target should run out immediately after Devour to avoid shared damage.
227.h:
-Shield and top off mark target before Devour pull.
-Heal through raid-wide Spit and minor dot from Acid Rain.
227.t:
-Face boss away from party; reposition mark toward clear space.
-Pick up hornets so adds don’t cluster near party.

228.g: -Uses Razor Scales (cone AoE) and Primordial Roar which spawns colored slimes (red/orange & blue) and later a green Chyme with The Last Song cast.
228.d:
-Dodge Razor Scales cones promptly.
-Stack for red slimes, spread for blue ones; burn green Chyme immediately before it finishes cast.
228.h:
-Heal through light raid damage from Roar; watch for slime splash.
-Top off after Last Song explosions.
228.t:
-Tank-turn boss away from group before cone.
-Move adds/slimes away from raid to control space.

229.g: -Casts Abyssic Buster (frontal tankbuster), Chaos Blast (star of AoE columns + circles), and Comet: marks 2 players with green circles where boulders fall. At 50%, spawns Right & Left Wing to tank down before continuing Comet & Heavensfall (marked orange AoE), plus raid-wide Dark Star.
229.d: -Move marked Comet players to edge; stack after Heavensfall to share damage.
229.h:
-Shield/tank-heal through Abyssic Buster.
-Heal Heavensfall marks and post-Dark Star damage.
229.t:
-Face boss away for Abyssic Buster.
-During wing phase, pick off wings quickly; reposition boss for safe Comet boulders.

st.g:
-Uses Electric Cachexia (donut AoE) and Electric Predation tether on a player.
-Summons Leyak adds dead dragons awaken if broodlings triggered.
st.d:
-Tethered player runs to pillar to transfer tether and avoid stun.
-Prioritize Leyak adds to prevent Heavy debuffs on party.
st.h:
-Pre-shield tank before Predation transfer.
-Heal through incidental damage from Leyak Reflux.
st.t:
-Face boss away and keep donut centered.
-Keep adds off to side and taunt-swap as needed.

st.g:
-Casts Inflammable Fumes (fume rings) then Ashen Ouroboros (edge donut) or Proximity Pyre (close circle).
-Uses Crippling Blow (tankbuster), Deafening Bellow, and Body Slam knockback.
st.d:
-Avoid fume rings before boss's main AoE; dodge accordingly.
-Maintain consistent DPS between mechanics.
st.h:
-Heal through Deafening Bellow and Body Slam knockbacks.
-Pre-shield across overlapping explosions from fume + AoE.
st.t:
-Tank away from unsafe rings and face ark away from group.
-Interrupt Crippling Blow with cooldowns or swaps.

st.g:
-Uses Hot Tail and Hot Wings (line AoEs), Cauterize (fiery line), with eyeball circles spawning randomly.
-At ~30%, enters add phase: slays adds to stall Rancor gauge before Massacre, followed by Horrid Blaze.
st.d:
-Move out of tail/wing lines and eyeball markers.
-During add phase, burn fast to delay wipe gauge.
st.h:
-Top off players hit by Cauterize and stack heal after Massacre.
-Prepare AoE burst after gauge stops.

248.g:
-Fights in two phases: normal guards then primal form with orb charges and orbs that explode for Bleed.
-Keep orbs away from group during charge and avoid explosion circles.
248.d:
-Stay behind boss to dodge cleaves and share damage from Holy Shield Bash stuns.
-Move away from orb explosions to maintain uptime.
248.h:
-Top off players hit by Bright Flare from orb blasts.
-Use shields before Holy Shield Bash stuns to reduce follow-up damage.
248.t:
-Face boss away from party; rotate to steer him clear of orbs and group.
-Maintain aggro and position to help manage orb placement.

250.g:
-Pre- and post-phase transition, uses sweeping line AoEs (Hyperdimensional Slash) and ground rifts that inflict Vulnerability stacks.
-After phase flip, uses knockback Faith Unmoving and creates blind spots at pool edges.
250.d:
-Avoid line AoEs twice in a row and reposition away from Aetherial Tears.
-Bait knockback safely to avoid rifts and stacks.
250.h:
-Heal through stacks of mechanical hits and reposition party before knockback lands.
-Top off players stepped in dimensional rifts.
250.t:
-Keep boss angled away from group to control cleave direction.
-Pull him between line attacks and move players out before knockback.

251.g:
-Casts raid-wide Heavensflame rings, tethered Holy Chains on two players, and summons marching knight adds and Holy Flames during phase éclipse.
-Killing flames blocks Purification explosion.
251.d:
-Break Holy Chains by spreading apart after mark; move through Heavensflame rings quickly.
-Kill Holy Flames on time during eclipse to soften massive raid damage.
251.h:
-Shield tethered players and heal through chain bursts.
-Pre-burst before Purification, and AoE heal during knight adds overlap.
251.t:
-Face boss away and tank near edge to manage clarity.
-Pick up knights and kite them away from raid; position group for eclipse flame control.

36.en: Good King Moggle Mog XII and Mogglesguard
36.g:
-Fight features 7 moogle adds with different roles. All must be killed close together or they will revive.
-Each moogle has unique mechanics (e.g. AoEs, tankbusters, heals, knockbacks). Phase 2 begins after first full wipe of moogles, followed by King Moggle Mog joining with enhanced attacks.
-Wipe if mechanics are ignored or DPS isn’t synchronized.
36.d:
-Follow assigned kill order and synchronize killing blows to prevent revives.
-Dodge persistent AoEs like Pom Holy and spinning attacks from Whiskerwall.
36.h:
-Heal through frequent raid-wide damage and moogle AoE overlap.
-Cleanse debuffs like Disease and prep for burst healing after synchronized kills.
36.t: -Pick up assigned tank moogles (usually Whiskerwall and Ruffletuft).

st.g:
-Casts alternating line AoEs that inflict Slow; follows with Dark Blizzard III and Repel knockback.
-Opens and closes with Disclosure—standing on wrong side causes instant death.
-Words of Winter freezes floor, causing sliding and complicating movement.
st.d:
-Watch for line patterns and reposition quickly to avoid slow and AoEs.
-Move behind boss immediately when Disclosure begins; prepare for sliding during Words of Winter.
st.h:
-Hold shields and HoTs for knockback and overlapping AoEs.
-Help counteract sliding from frozen floor with timely heals.
st.t:
-Face boss to align knockback safely; move as needed to avoid frozen sections.
-Keep path clear for Disclosure transitions.

st.g:
-Becomes invulnerable at intervals; adds spawn in books—kill them fast.
-Adds tether orbs to players; drag orb into Byblos to break invulnerability.
-Oil clouds spawn later, deal damage + knockback; don’t run through unnecessarily.
-Gale Cut = frontal cleave, Tail Swipe = rear cleave, Head Down = charge that splits damage along line.
st.d:
-Focus adds quickly to generate orbs.
-When targeted by Head Down, line up with group to share damage.
st.h:
-Spot heal orb carriers if clipped by oil clouds.
-Heal through charge (Head Down) and multiple cleaves.
st.t:
-Face Byblos away from group to avoid cleave hits.
-Keep control of boss position during add/orb mechanics.

st.g:
-Marks players with orb drop markers—these spawn vulnerability-up circles if not dropped safely.
-Casts Void Call at ~85/55/25%: lights appear on plates; players must stand in groups to cancel summons or face adds spawning.
-Uses Deep Darkness (outer AoE) followed by Magic Burst (center AoE).
st.d:
-Drop orbs on edge away from platform circles; stack correctly to clear plates during Void Call phases.
-Destroy adds quickly if Void Call fails.
st.h:
-Heal orb carriers and those near explosion markers.
-Coordinate shields/AoE heals for Deep Darkness and Magic Burst overlap.
st.t:
-Tank boss near center but move slightly to help orb drop safe placement.
-Face boss away from group during AoEs and assist positioning during plate mechanics.

231.g:
-Summons magitek turrets that tether players and explode if not killed.
-Casts Magitek Slug (line AoE) and Magitek Spread (large cone, avoid by standing behind boss).
231.d:
-When turret tethers ally, help soak the beam and burst turret before explosion.
-Move to boss’s back during Spread to avoid damage.
231.h:
-Shield and top off tethered players to withstand turret explosion splash.
-Heal through random Slug hits and tankbuster-style hits.
231.t:
-Face turrets to shield tethered players and soak beam.
-Hold boss facing away and rotate to avoid AoE cones.

232.g: -Shifts between forms: Sphinx (AoE circles/cones), Cobra (tankbuster), Naga (petrification gaze), Machina (stack meteors). Weighing of the Heart triggers form swaps.
232.d:
-React to form changes: dodge circles/cones, stack for meteors, turn away from gaze.
-Burst when in forms without shared mechanics.
232.h:
-Pre-heal tanks before Hood Swing and apply shields; group heal through AoEs and petrify avoidance.
-Turn away to avoid Curse in Naga form.

234.g:
-Both bosses are targetable at all times and must be brought to 0.1% HP.
-Fire orbs: explode, safe spot is far from them.
-Ice orbs: donut, safe spot is IN the orb.
-Esoteric Fusion: collides orbs. If colliding fire, RUN AWAY, if colliding ice, run TO them.
234.d:
-For Burning Star tethers, move away from the collision path; for Frozen Star tethers, stand under them.
-Spread for Dark Fire II, line up properly for End of Days.
234.h:
-Heal through frequent raidwides and avoid overlapping AoEs.
-Stay mobile for ice/fusion mechanics while prepping burst healing.
234.t:
-Keep aggro on both bosses; coordinate to balance HP evenly.
-Position bosses to keep AoEs clear from group; intercept line stack if needed.

254.g:
-Continues mechanics from previous fight with increased intensity.
-Dualstar: collides 3 sets of two orbs, fire pair - ice pair - fire pair - same mechanic as before.
-Dualstore order is according to the orbs' tether distance - closer = first.
254.h:
-Prepare burst healing after Fusion Prime and during raidwide damage.
-Watch for tankbuster follow-ups and heal Vulnerability Up players.

277.g: -Uses Water Bombs (targeted circle AoEs), Odious Croak (persistent frontal cone), Toy Hammer (stun + cone cleave). Summons Poroggo Choirtoads and inflicts Frog Song debuffs on two players.
277.d:
-Avoid standing in Water Bombs and stay behind boss to dodge Croak.
-If you’re froged, keep distance until Choirtoads are killed.
277.h:
-Shield or cleanse stun from Toy Hammer as soon as possible.
-Heal froged players and raid through bomb and cone damage.
277.t:
-Face boss away to direct Croak safely.
-Kill Choirtoads quickly and use cooldowns after Toy Hammer hits.

278.g: -Casts narrow cone cleaves and summons Stardusts—untargetable adds that cast Mystic Light (circle AoEs). Also uses tethers that require hiding behind meteors.
278.d:
-Face boss away to dodge Jittering Glare cones.
-Kill Stardusts to limit AoE pools and hide from tethers behind meteors.
278.h:
-Pre-heal raid before cone cleaves.
-Heal melee hiding behind meteors after tethered shots.
278.t:
-Keep boss facing away from group.
-Pick up Stardust adds and position boss clear of meteors.

279.g: -Starts with six dolls (Calca + Brina) that cast alternating donut and cone AoEs, then merges into Calcabrina. Marks a player for Terrifying Glance cone, casts Brace (directional parry), Dollhouse (transforms two players into dolls), and Knockout tankbuster.
279.d:
-Avoid overlapping AoEs; burst dolls before the merge.
-When marked with Glance, face away and reposition out of the cone.
279.h:
-Prepare raid heals for Slapstick damage during Dollhouse.
-Heal tank through Knockout and surround with shields during Brace.
279.t:
-Save cooldowns for Knockout and face boss away during Brace.
-Pick up doll adds early and position boss to avoid doll cleave overlap.

292.g:
-Summons various moogle adds and Captain Mogsun, who tethers to Moglin to make him invulnerable.
-Casts Pom Praise to revive fallen moogles—knock corpses out of revival circles quickly to prevent revives and HP buffs.
292.d:
-Assist in burst-down of moogle adds and captain quickly when they appear.
-Knock corpses out of revival circles after Praise to avoid empowered revivals.
292.h:
-Provide raid-wide heals for Pom Holy.
-Monitor party to stop revivals by assisting corpse knockbacks.
292.t:
-Face Moglin away from the group.
-Prioritize grabbing new adds and guarding corpses from circles.

293.g:
-Uses Burning Bright (line AoE) that damages walls and creates electrified flooring if walls break.
-Gallop charges across the arena; players should hug walls to avoid being knocked onto electrified zones.
-Cloud Call spawns dark clouds that cast Lightning Bolt and apply Vulnerability Up—drop them near walls or edge to minimize party-wide damage.
293.d:
-Stay between boss and wall during Gallop to avoid electric floor knockback.
-Destroy clouds quickly and place them far from the group.
293.h:
-Heal players hit by Gallop knockback and Lightning Bolt stacks.
-Stack AoE healing for cloud explosions and Vulnerability Up hits.
293.t:
-Face boss down the arena for clearing Gallop path.
-Position boss so Burning Bright avoids wall destruction.

294.g:
-Casts Hallowed Wings (line AoE per wing), Holy Storm (arena-wide), Diamond Storm (freezes terrain, causes sliding), Frigid Dive (line AoE while frozen), and uses stack+AoE head marker (Akh Morn).
-Sliding mechanics from Diamond Storm can push players into other AoEs or off platforms.
294.d:
-Move carefully to avoid sliding into line markers during Diamond Storm.
-Stack tightly for Akh Morn and then spread for Holy Breath circles.
294.h:
-Prepare shields before sliding and line AoEs; heal through frozen ground damage.
-Use burst heals on Akh Morn stacks and after Massacre healing windows.
294.t:
-Rotate boss to bait line attacks away from the party.
-Swap after tankbusters and position to minimize sliding hazards.

st.g:
-Wind Blast is a path AoE—dodge quickly.
-Lift summons adds and turrets.
-Turrets cast Hot Air, launching the party upward; stand under Nuzal to bring him down after.
-Airstones tether to boss or turret—kill these first if present.
-Air Raid and Long Burst are unavoidable raidwides.
st.d:
-Prioritize Airstones when they spawn; otherwise kill turrets fast.
-Stand beneath Nuzal during Hot Air cast to end phase safely.
st.h:
-Prepare raid healing for Air Raid, Long Burst, and Hot Air overlap.
-Heal add-targeted players quickly—damage spikes are frequent.
st.t:
-Pick up adds as they spawn.
-Position boss so turrets and adds are easy to reach.

st.g:
-On Low is a frontal cleave on tank.
-On High is a raidwide AoE with knockback; stand against barriers.
-Dark Wings marks random players with AoEs—spread out.
-Stormcoming spawns windy AoE zones on barriers.
-Swiftfeather causes instant On Low after dash—treat as tankbuster.
st.d:
-Spread out for Dark Wings.
-Keep near barriers to avoid knockback deaths during On High.
st.h:
-Anticipate heavy raid damage from On High; AoE heal after.
-Spot heal Dark Wings targets.
st.t:
-Face boss away from group for On Low.
-Mitigation for Swiftfeather + instant cleave.

st.g:
-Ixali Aero III is a raidwide AoE.
-Ixali Aero II is a path AoE—step aside.
-Hawk alternates between stack marker or spread marker—adjust accordingly.
-Summon Garuda: roomwide AoE with small safe zones; all players marked with green crystal AoEs—spread out.
st.d:
-Move quickly into safe zones during Garuda summon.
-Stack or spread as indicated by Hawk marker.
st.h:
-Sustain raid through Ixali Aero III and Garuda AoEs.
-Be ready for burst healing after stack markers if combined with other AoEs.
st.t:
-Hold boss central for consistent path AoEs.
-Assist with positioning group for Hawk markers.

337.g: -Uses Magitek Claw (tankbuster), Magitek Ray (line AoE), Magitek Missile (targeted with high damage), and spawns tethered adds (Sky Armor Reinforcements).
337.d:
-Kill tethered adds immediately to reduce healer pressure.
-Move away when marked for Magitek Missile to avoid splash damaging others.
337.h:
-Be ready for moderate tank damage from Claw and raid damage from Missile.
-Heal through Magitek Ray line AoE with steady heals.
337.t:
-Face boss away; use cooldowns on Claw.
-Pick up adds and rotate tank as needed to manage pressure.

339.g: -Casts Launcher (raid-wide), Dynamic Sensory Jammer (movement/action lock), Diffractive Laser (puddle AoE), Magitek Bits (grid line AoEs), and Distress Beacon (spawn adds).
339.d:
-Stop moving/attacking during Jammer debuff to avoid self-damage.
-Move into safe spaces when Bits activate and help burst adds from Beacon.
339.h:
-Pre-shield before Launcher and heal through add bursts from Distress Beacon.
-Attend marked players affected by Jammer and Laser puddles.
339.t:
-Pick up spawned adds quickly.
-Face away to avoid cleave overlap and reposition for Bits lines.

340.g: -Uses Beak of the Griffin (raid-wide), Flash Powder (gaze stun with accuracy debuff), Sanguine Blade (leap cleave), Claw (tankbuster), Lionshead (sword adds + AoE), Restraint Collar (traps healer), and Big Boot (knockback).
340.d:
-Stand behind boss to dodge Blade; burn middle sword during Lionshead to create safe zone.
-Move quickly after Big Boot to avoid puddles.
340.h:
-Turn away on Flash Powder; cleanse accuracy if needed.
-Immediately heal healer trapped by Collar and prep for raid-wide Lionshead damage.
340.t:
-Hold boss facing away; cooldown through Claw.
-Chase boss after Sanguine Blade to maintain positioning; pick up adds during Lionshead phase.

st.g:
-Stay close to boss to dodge Amorphous Applause.
-Hydroball: stack to share.
-Sea Swallows All: run out to avoid AOEs, then return center for follow-up cleave.
-Overflow knocks party outward; run back in for Hydroball stack.
st.d:
-Always stack for Hydroball.
-Move fast after knockback to avoid late Hydroball deaths.
st.h:
-Top party after Hydroball and Overflow.
-Watch for Amorphous Applause following Sea Swallows All.
st.t:
-Keep boss mid-arena for easier dodges.
-Face away from group after pull-ins.

st.g:
-Bloodburst raidwide.
-Shadowflow creates zones inflicting vuln—avoid.
-Enter Night: tethered player runs far to break.
-Shadowsplit spawns clones—larger shadow zones to dodge.
st.d:
-Keep mobile for Shadowflow zones.
-Run quickly if tethered during Enter Night.
st.h:
-Heals for Bloodburst damage.
-Watch tethered player for burst if they fail to break.
st.t:
-Keep boss centered for clean Shadowflow gaps.
-Be ready to reposition when clones spawn.

st.g:
-Somber Melody raidwide.
-Virgin Tears leaves floor DoTs, later a ring around edge.
-Morbid Advance/Retreat force movement relative to your facing—pre-position to avoid Tears.
st.d:
-Dodge Virgin Tears puddles; adjust facing for forced march.
-Position safely before Advance/Retreat triggers.
st.h:
-Heal through Somber Melody raidwides.
-Keep group topped before forced movement mistakes.
st.t:
-Maintain control mid-arena for safe spacing.
-Keep stable position so Advance/Retreat isn’t chaotic.

st.g: -Avoid frontal cone (Heave), circular AoEs (Crumbling Crust), and line charge (Rush). After Rush, activated animals perform AoEs based on type.
st.d: -Stay behind boss for Rush tether; move away to dodge animal AoEs.
st.h: -Shield after Rush; heal through Earthquake stun/damage.
st.t: -Face boss away; reposition after each Rush to lead safe zones.

st.g:
-Hide behind rocks to block gaze.
-Step between expanding rings and away from pulsing floors.
-Dodge alternating cone AoEs and orbs crossing in lines.
st.d: -Understand each mechanic’s pattern and avoid all AoEs—there’s no damage to DPS.
st.h: -No healing required—failure is due to standing in mechanics, not damage.
st.t: -No tanking—success is purely movement/dodge-based.

st.g: -Avoid palette of raidwide (Wind Unbound), orb line cleaves, Flutterfall circles, and Confusion gaze. After defeat of adds, wings become vulnerable and outer edge rotates—don’t be knocked into rotating AoEs.
st.d: -Spread for Flutterfall; dodge orb lines and rotating edge circles. Avoid dash path during Yol’s movement.
st.h: -Shield after Wind Unbound; cleanse confusion and heal through feather splash.
st.t: -Tank-facing away for Feather Cut; reposition after Wingbeat knockback to avoid edge AoEs.

st.g: -Uses Cermet Pile (tankbuster cleave), Garlean Fire (arrow-line circle AoEs), Magitek Bits (persistent line lasers), and floating Rearguard Mines that explode on contact.
st.d:
-Stand behind boss to dodge cleaves. Watch for Mines and avoid walking into them.
-Dodge Arrow AoEs and crystal lines efficiently.
st.h:
-Shield for Mines and heal through laser overlaps.
-Heal tanks through Cermet Pile bursts.
st.t: -Face boss away from party. Use cooldowns on tankbuster. Avoid positioning near walls to dodge Mines.

st.g: -Casts Circle of Death (point-blank AoE), stack marker for 2-tonze Missile, persistent Magitek Bit line lasers with knockback, and Magitek Missile towers requiring soak.
st.d: -Stack for Missile soak, then spread quickly. Don’t stand in Bit laser lanes.
st.h:
-Stack in on missile target. Heal through circle and spread bit damage.
-Stay steady after tower soak.
st.t: -Absorb missile if needed. Face boss away from players. Avoid Bit lasers knocking you off edge.

st.g: -Uses frontal Chainsaw (tank cleave), Delay-action Charges (proximity bombs on players), Gunsaw lines, Thermobaric Charge (follows and explodes), and Magitek saw adds.
st.d:
-Avoid standing ahead of boss. Move off when targeted by proximity bomb marker.
-Dodge saw line swipes and avoid overlapping paths.
st.h:
-Shield stack for proximity hits and pre-heal before bomb explosions.
-Heal tanks spam during Chainsaw and saw phases.
st.t: -Face boss away. Move off Chainsaw cleave path. Maintain space during saw and bomb phases.

st.g:
-Alternates tankbuster (Wheel), circle puddle (Magitek Fire II), and raidwide (Magitek Fire III).
-Ultimately uses Wild Speed: immune until adds occupy edge turrets and fire Magitek Pulse at him.
st.d:
-Stay behind boss to dodge cleaves and puddles.
-After adds spawn, grab turret and fire it to break Wild Speed ASAP.
st.h:
-Shield for Fire II puddles and pre-heal for Fire III.
-Expect tankbuster burst from Wheel → heal properly.
st.t:
-Face boss away; mitigate cleave with cooldowns.
-Grab aggro of adds and direct turret line safely toward them.

st.g: -Uses Elemental Pillars scattered as Fire/Ice/Lightning, reset boss barrier buff. Discrete Magick (elemental cones, crosshatches, or towers) then Serial Magick of same type with stack or line markers.
st.d: -Adjust positioning per Discrete type: crosshatch, cone, or tower. Spread or stack on Serial Magick accordingly.
st.h:
-Top off before stacks and area bursts.
-Heal group stacks or spread accordingly.
st.t:
-Face boss away; reposition depending on barrier element.
-Maintain spacing to avoid overlapping lines or circles.

st.g:
-Performs Ketu Slash (tankbuster), Rahu Blaster (line AoE), and Ketu & Rahu combo (circle + proximity puddles).
-Periodic Roids phase triggers Enhanced versions: boss jumps to edge, gains buffs, spawning adds tethered to players.
st.d:
-Avoid lines during Rahu and dodge puddles quickly.
-Kill tethered adds fast during Roids phase; avoid stack overlaps.
st.h:
-Shield through Ketu Slash and heal stack where needed.
-Mitigate Enhanced bleed/vuln after Roids; heal through explosion orbs.
st.t:
-Mitigate tankbuster and face away.
-Soak or pick up tethered adds promptly and lead them away from squad.

st.g: -Cast Target Search (follows a player, leaves DoT puddle); Tail Laser cleaves front and back.
st.d: -Bait puddle to a safe zone; avoid standing near walls for Tail Laser.
st.h: -Pre-heal for Tail Laser and puddle stacks.
st.t: -Face boss away and reposition after puddle land to protect party.

st.g: -Uses Mana Burst (raidwide), Orders to Charge (spawns Magitek Bits), Orders to Fire (donut AoEs), Demimagicks (marked donut drops) and Mindjack (out-of-body, stun & body retrieval).
st.d: -Dodge donut circles and puddles. Return to your body quickly when Mindjack occurs.
st.h: -Shield before aoes and restore party quickly after Mindjack transitions.
st.t: -Face boss away and reposition to avoid Demimagick overlaps.

374.g:
-Arena edge inflicts Damage Down on contact—avoid knockbacks.
-Phase 1: Uses Art of the Storm (move away), Art of the Swell (knockback, hug Zenos), Art of the Sword (dodge line AoEs), and Vein Splitter (copies create AoEs).
-Zenos tethers a player before Lightless Spark (cone AoE); avoid standing near tethered player.
-Phase 2: At ~15%, Zenos summons The Storm, The Swell, and Ame-no-Habakiri. Defeat all before Aether Transfer gauge fills to avoid wipe.
374.d:
-Spread for Sword and Vein Splitter lines. Stand near boss to dodge Swell knockbacks.
-Focus adds immediately in Phase 2; avoid the outer ring when Swell uses knockback.
374.h:
-Pre-shield for Concentrativity and Storm AoEs. Heal damage from Swell knockbacks and untelegraphed tankbusters.
-Be ready to patch up party post-Lightless Spark.
374.t:
-Watch for “Kill!” shout before Unmoving Troika and mitigate accordingly.
-Face Zenos away, grab aggro on adds quickly, and reposition to center after Swell knockbacks.

st.g:
-Arena edge inflicts Water Resist Down and damage—stay centered.
-Uses Torpedo (tankbuster), Rising Seas (raid-wide), Hydro Pull/Pull (knock pull or push tied to edge), and Bloody Puddle markers followed by tethered orbs.
st.d:
-When marked, move puddles to edge safely—don’t overlap others.
-Stand behind boss for Torpedo and avoid orbs by kiting away from group.
st.h:
-Shield before puddles and Rising Seas.
-Heal tank through Torpedo and orb splash damage.
st.t:
-Face boss away and use cooldowns on Torpedo.
-Control orb tether path away from party and edge.

st.g:
-Casts Mystic Light (frontal cone) and Mystic Flame (under player circle) randomly.
-Spawns Subservient adds and becomes invulnerable before final cast Order to Self-destruct. After Shifting Light, players become Spriggans to place Shatterstone bombs under adds.
st.d:
-Spread out to avoid flame circles; dodge cones.
-When a Spriggan, place bombs under adds quickly using Shatterstone.
st.h:
-Shield before high-damage Flame/Air AoEs.
-Coordinate healing during add explosion damage.
st.t:
-Face boss away for Mystic Light dodges.
-Prioritize tanking adds and ensure players transform to Spriggans.

415.g:
-All moves are animation telegraphed: Rusting Claw (raise right arm), Tail Drive (tail lift), The Spin (proximity knock).
Casts stacking mechanics: Ring, Cross, Circle of Chaos, Eye of the Fire gaze, Words of Woe line attack.
415.d:
-Watch boss animations: dodge front or rear accordingly.
-Move out of proximity (Spin), spread for circles, stop moving for cross markers.
415.h:
-Apply shields before chaos markers and heal bleed stacks.
-Dispel confusion from gaze and heal post-Spin knockback.
415.t:
-Face boss away consistently.
-Intervene for Cross of Chaos markers (stop moving), and reposition adds for clean AoE avoidance.

st.g:
-Crystal Needle: heavy tankbuster.
-Hailfire: random player gets a line AoE—hide behind a shard.
-Shardfall: area-wide; dodge behind remaining shards.
-Dissonance: donut AoE—only safe spot under boss.
-Shardstrike: small circles on all players—spread and avoid wrecking shards.
st.d: -Hide behind crystals during Hailfire and Shardfall; don’t overlap Shardstrike circles.
st.h: -Pre-shield tank for Crystal Needle. Heal raid after Shardfall and Dissonance, especially those moving under boss.
st.t: -Use cooldown for Needle. Face boss away for Shardfall and don’t tank near crystals.

st.g:
-Aetherochemical Flame: raid-wide.
-Aetherochemical Residue: poison puddle under marked; drop at edge.
-Full Throttle: auxiliary drones require standing in the one without bars. Rock Biters move across tracks; avoid their path.
-Aetherochemical Coil: tankbuster. Dreadnaught adds spawn and must be tanked quickly.
st.d: -Move Residue puddles to edge. Dodge Rock Biters. Stay behind boss for Coil.
st.h: -Heal raid through Flame. Shield marked players before puddle drops. Heal after Coil and Dreadnaught cleaves.
st.t: -Face boss away. Use cooldown on Coil. Pull Dreadnaught fast and keep party clear of its cleave.

st.g:
-Rime Wreath: frequent raid-wide AoE.
-Mist Plume: star marker → line blasts and puddles.
-Vaporize: dragon disappears, spawns 3 Draconic Regards + 1 Mist.
-Tank should not kill Mist. After fog engulfs arena, Dragon dives (Cauterize) from random directions—players must scout by circling center, get out before dive.
-Touchdown: proximity marker edge—move away.
st.d: -Spread to reduce multi-target hits. When fog starts, move in a small circle around center to spot dragon dive. If marked with Mist Plume, avoid line and don’t touch puddles.
st.h: -Conserve mana for Rime Wreath. Heal survivors of Mist suck. Keep shields up for Cauterize chain damage. Heal knocked players off platform edge.
st.t: -Mitigate Rime Wreath or Coil. Face away during dive phase. Tank maintain center position and avoid pushing others into danger.

st.g:
-Jarring Blow tankbuster; Magitek Slash six-cone rings leave safe zones and fire puddles.
-Wildfire Beam places personal circle markers - spread.
-Magitek Ray stack marker; Exhaust line AoEs; Ceruleum Vent raidwide.
st.d:
-Spread for Wildfire Beam circles.
-Follow slash path cues and move into dissipated puddle rings early. Dodge line AoEs.
st.h:
-Pre-shield before Jarring Blow.
-Stack-shield and heal through Magitek Ray and puddles. Recover party post Ceruleum Vent.
st.t:
-Face boss away. Use cooldown on tankbuster.
-After slash patterns, position safe quickly and avoid standing in fire rings.

st.g:
-Nitrospin raidwide + ring fire. Needle Gun (front) then Oil Shower (rear/back coverage).
-Burrows to target glowing wall section with line fire.
-Freezing Missiles appear as proximity AoEs.
st.d:
-Stand behind boss during Oil Shower.
-Move off fire path after burrow attack. Avoid overlapping proximity missiles.
st.h:
-Shield for Nitrospin and Oil Shower. Heal post-drill tankbuster.
-In burrow phase, move away from fireball path quickly.
st.t:
-Mitigate Unbreakable Cermet Drill with cooldowns.
-Face away and reposition after burrow to avoid firefull corridor.

st.g:
-Annia uses melee (Delta Trance, Angry Salamander, Stunning Sweep).
-Julia uses ranged (Innocence, Heirsbane, Air Strike, Order to Bombard).
-Artificial Plasma is a shared raidwide.
-Crossbones 'X' markers track players and knock back on hit.
-Crosshatch sends Crossbones between sisters in narrow lanes.
-Tanks exploding will detonate nearby tanks.-Imperial Authority will wipe the party if either sister finishes casting after revive phase.
st.d:
-Avoid Crossbones and tank detonations; don't stand near Ceruleum tanks.
-Spread during Covering Fire; hug wall during Order to Bombard safe spots.
st.h:
-Heal through Artificial Plasma and tankbusters.
-Prepare AoE heals after Bombard and Crossbones knockbacks.
st.t: -Keep boss centered during tag phases; position for safe zones during Bombard and Crosshatch.
